Eresvita is working as a cook in order to make her great dream - of giving her daughters a university education and of having her own house - a reality.

loans.use: to support her father as he purchases household appliances and covers healthcare costs.

loans.name: Jesús Antonio

texts.es:
Jesús de 23 años de edad, estudio técnico agronomo,es casado,su esposa trabaja en un negocio familiar en la venta de ropa, ya tienen un niño pequeño.


Él es empleado de una gasolinera,trabaja en jornada de la mañana todos los días,también tiene un taller de reparacion de refrigeradoras y cocinas que lo administra otra persona,y por las tardes él se incorpora para ayudarle a las reparaciones de su taller.

El préstamo lo utilizara para pago de deudas y comprar repuestos,con el propósito de que sus clientes lleguen y darles un buen servio, de esa forma quedara satisfecha la necesidad.

El sueño de Jesús  es mejorar su negocio tener mas demanda de clientes y los materiales necesarios para atender mejor a los clientes y seguir aportando ingresos para su esposa y su pequeño hijo,seguir trabajando con la institución.
texts.en:
Jesús is 23 years old and studied to be an Agricultural Technician. He is married, his wife works in a family business selling clothing. They have one young child.

He is an employee at a service station. He works every day from the early morning. He also has a workshop where he repairs refrigerators and stove that is managed by another person. In the afternoon he joins him and helps with the repairs in the shop.

He will use the loan to pay debts and to buy spare parts with the idea that clients can come and receive good service and fulfill their needs in this manner. Jesús's dream is to improve his shop, have more customers and have the material needed to provide better service to the clients. He wants to continue to bring money home for his wife and young child and continue to work at the gas station.

loans.use: to pay some debts and buy spare parts.

loans.name: Sarorm

texts.en:
Sarorm is 26 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in a wooden house in the Kampong Cham province, The main source of her family’s income comes from selling grocery items, which she has been doing for almost 10 years. Her husband is a paid worker. 

Sarorm requested her first loan from VisionFund, which she will use to buy grocery items to sell. She hopes to make a living better.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Ei's Group

texts.en:
Ei, 43, is from a rural village located in the Damabe district of Kampong Cham province. She is married and has three children. She and her husband earn a living through planting cassava. She and her husband have been in this business for 25 years. The current business earns her family about 70,000 KHR per day.

Ei has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops from her agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Ya's Group

texts.en:
Ya is 52 years old and married. She lives with her husband and ten children in a rural area located in the Dambae district of Cambodia. She has been growing cassava and farming rice for 10 years. Her husband also works for others for a fee. The current business earns her family about 36,000 KHR per day to feed the family. She manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day.

This is the sixth loan for Ya with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Ya is now leading her group to ask for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s business and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch is a 40-year-old mother of three children living in a rural village of the Damabe district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and growing cassava for almost 15 years. The current business earns her about 36,000 KHR per day. 

This is the fourth microloan for Touch with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Touch, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income in order to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Sinat is 31 years old and married. She lives with her husband and three children in a rural area of the Sangke district of Battambang province. She and her husband are farmers who have been growing corn and fishing. They also supplement their income by working for others for a fee.
 
Sinat is a first-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Sinat is now leading her group to ask for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow her business and make more crops to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, fabric, and an iron.

loans.name: Naiyoern's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Ponhea Krek district where farming is a common way to make a living, Naiyoern is a 34-year-old mother of three dependent children. Cassava growing, which she and her husband have been in for 14 years, is the main source of family’s income, and her husband supplements the income by working for others for a fee.
 
This is the first microloan for Naiyoern with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Naiyoern wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to have another source of family income so as to increase her income to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Dmitriy

texts.ru:
Вот уже 13 лет как Дмитрий тогрует на рынке. Он продает мужскую джинсовую одежду. У него хорошее торговое место и много постоянных покупателей. Дмитрию нравиться его бизнес и он намерен развивать его дальше.

Дмитрий просит предоставить ему кредит в размере 15,000 гривен на закупку новых летних моделей джинсов. Он хочет давать своим клиентам возможность выбирать самое лучшее по доступной цене.

Дмитрий женат, у него есть одна дочь. Проживают в своей квартире. Дополнительную прибыль Дмитрий планирует потратить на улучшение жилищных условий своей семьи, а также инвестировать часть обратно в бизнес.
texts.en:
It has been 13 years since Dmitriy started selling at a market. He sells men's jean clothing. He has a good retail location and many regular customers. Dmitriy likes his business and he intends to develop it further.

Dmitriy is requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 hryvnia to purchase new summer types of jeans. He wants to provide his clients with an ability to chose the best at an affordable price.

Dmitriy is married and has one daughter. They live in their own apartment. Dmitriy plans to spend the additional profit on improving his family's living conditions and also on investing some of the returns back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase new models of summer jeans

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмире 39 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Гульмиры- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Стартовав в 2002 году, благодаря упорному труду Гульмиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 5 овец, а также есть земельный надел. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку минеральных удобрений для проведения весенне-полевых работ. Доходы от кредита Гульмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет улучшить жилищные условия своей семьи.
texts.en: Gulmira is 39 years old, married and raising 3 children together with her husband. Gulmira has a secondary education and, to provide the primary source of income for her family, is involved in animal husbandry and farming. Started in 2002 and thanks to Gulmira's hard work, today her business contains 2 cows, 5 sheep, and also a land plot. The monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Gulmira requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy mineral fertilizers for doing spring field work. Gulmira plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing livestock quantities and improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers for doing spring field work

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase yams, beans, and vegetable oil

loans.name: Maria Fernanda

texts.es:
María es una joven de 26 años, tiene dos niñas una de 6 y una de 4, ambas nenas se encuentran estudiando en la escuela. Viven juntas en casa de familiar ubicada en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, es la ciudad enlace entre la sierra y la costa, por ello existe bastante intercambio comercial. También en esta zona habita la etnia Tsachila o llamados Colorados, por eso el nombre del cantón. Desde hace 5 años comenzó a vender cosméticos de manera ambulante, ella  recorría los barrios aledaños a su domicilio ofreciendo su producto, luego en la bahía de la ciudad junto al local de su madre donde vende ropa se puso un pequeño puesto donde ahora expende toda su mercadería, lo atiende de martes a domingos todo el día, en las tardes sus hijitas la acompañan al local y su abuelita se encarga de cuidarlas. Ahora también ya distribuye a otras vendedoras su producto porque gracias a los créditos que ha obtenido en la Fundación ha podido crecer.
Ahora solicita para la compra de más mercadería como perfumes, cremas, maquillaje, ya que necesita abastecerse porque están próximas las fiestas del cantón y sus ventas se mejoran.
María agradece enormemente a la institución porque gracias a los microcréditos los clientes pueden superarse como ella lo ha logrado. Con estos ingresos podrá darles la educación que necesitan sus pequeñas
texts.en:
María is a young 26 year old woman. She has two girls, one is 6 and the other is 4. Both girls are in school studying. They live together in their family´s home located in the city of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas. This city is the link between the mountains and the coast, and because of that, there is a lot of trade. Also, the ethnic group Tsachila or the so-called Colorados, live in this area, which is where the name of the region comes from. 5 years ago, she became a cosmetics street vendor. She went all over the neighborhoods close to where she lives offering her product. Later, in the city bay next to her mother´s place where she sells clothes, she started a little stand where she now sells all of her goods. She works there all day from Tuesday to Sunday. In the afternoons, her little daughters go with her to the store and their grandmother takes care of them. She now also distributes her product to other vendors because thanks to the loans that she has received in the Fundación, the business has been able to grow.

She is now asking for a loan to buy more merchandise like perfumes, lotions and makeup. She needs to stock up because the regional celebrations are coming up and her sales improve.

María is enormously grateful to the organization because thanks to microloans, clients can better themselves like she has done. With this income she will be able to give her daughters the education they need.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Reat's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Battambang province’s Kam Rieng district, Reat is a 62-year-old mother of seven children. She has been farming rice and planting sugarcane for 10 years. Together, she and her husband can earn about 49,000 KHR per day from the current business and can manage to save about 25,000 KHR each day.

Reat has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Reat wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an air-conditioner, generator and iron.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new chair and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Samban's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Srey Snom district where farming is a common way to earn a living, Samban is 38 years old and married. As a mother, she has struggled to feed her three children by farming rice and grow cassava. Having been in the business for 20 years, the current business earns her approximately 25,000 KHR per day. 

Samban is a second-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Samban will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Srem's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Siem Reap district, Srem is age 56 years, married, and has seven children. The main sources of family income are from rice farming and growing cassava, which he and his wife have been in for 38 years to make a living. 

Srem is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now he is leading his group to seek a loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland. He hopes to earn more income from his current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Buusara

texts.ru: Буусаре 44 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 6 детей. У Буусары среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она с 2000 года занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Буусары, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 2 дойные коровы, а также земельный надел мерою 0,50 ГА, где Буусара выращивает картофель и морковь. Ежемесячный доход от реализации продукции оптовым покупателям на местном рынке составляет в среднем 10,000 сом (KGS). Буусара обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для закупки минеральных удобрений и семян картофеля для проведения весенне-полевых работ, также часть средств будет потрачена на покупку коровы. Буусара намерена расширить свой бизнес, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита она хочет направить на улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en: Buusara is 44 years old, married and raising 6 children together with her husband. Buusara has a secondary education and, to provide the primary source of income for her family, has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 2000. Thanks to Buusara's persistence, drive and hard work, today her business contains 2 dairy cows and a land plot of 0.50 hectares in size. Buusara grows potatoes and carrots. The monthly income from selling products to wholesale buyers at a local market amounts to 10,000 som (KGS) on average. Buusara requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy mineral fertilizers and potato seeds for doing spring field work and partially to buy a cow. Buusara plans to expand her business, which will certainly result in an increase in the family's capital. She wants to direct the earnings from the loan toward improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and potato seeds for doing spring field work and to buy a cow

loans.name: Rodolfo Alexander

texts.es:
Rodolfo de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato técnico automotriz,  está soltero tiene casa particular pero dentro del terreno de su mamá y su abuelo vive ahí también. Rodolfo realiza trabajos de mecánica de forma independiente  desde hace tres años y también, trabajos de mecánica de forma independiente desde hace tres años, también compra y vende vehículos usados en su casa y ayuda a su mamá con una pequeña tienda.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar una caja de herramientas para el taller y que le hacen falta para trabajar, a futuro espera tener estabilidad económica y construir su casa más segura de ladrillo o bloque ya que actualmente es de adobe.
texts.en:
Rodolfo, 24 years of age, studied auto mechanics up through the 12th grade. He is single, has a house, but on land belonging to his mother, and his grandfather also lives there. 

Rodolfo has worked independently as a mechanic for some 3 years and he also buys and sells used vehicles at his house, plus he helps his mother with a small store.

The loan Rodolfo solicits through CREDICAMPO is to purchase a box of tools he currently lacks for his work. In the future, he hopes to achieve economic stability and to reconstruct his house more securely of brick and cement block, since at present it is made of adobe.

loans.use: to buy a box of tools he currently lacks for his auto repair shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an over-sewing machine, an air-cooler, and a generator.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a generator, fabric, and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Parida

texts.ru: Парида, 53 года, замужем, мать 4 детей, старшие дети самостоятельные и живут отдельно, младшие активно помогают по хозяйству. У Париды - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством. Стартовав в 1995 году, благодаря упорному труду Париды, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 дойные коровы, 10 овец, 1 лошадь. Ежемесячный доход от перепродажи скота и молочной продукции составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Парида обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Парида планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить средства на покупку холодильника.
texts.en: Parida is 53 years old, married and a mother of 4 children, the oldest of whom are independent and live separately and the youngest actively help with the business. Parida has a secondary education and, to provide the primary source of income for her family, is involved in animal husbandry. Started in 1995, thanks to Parida's hard work, today her business contains 4 dairy cows, 10 sheep and 1 horse. The monthly income from reselling livestock and dairy products amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Parida requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy cows and sheep for increasing livestock headcount. Parida plans to invest the earnings from the loan into increasing livestock quantities and saving money to buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy cows and sheep for increasing livestock headcount

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grocery products and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.ru: Гулрухсор родилась в 1968 году. Она добрая и трудолюбивая женщина. Гулрухсор замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее дети не совершеннолетние.  Она имеет высшее образование. Гулрухсор последнее 5 лет работает в государственной организации по делам женщин. Она успешно введет свою работу. Гулрухсор данное время нуждается финансовой поддержке, так как она больна и должна вылечиться. Она  запрашивает займ на сумму 7000 сомони для покупки лекарства. Она надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Gulruhsor was born in 1968. She is a kind and hardworking woman who is married with two school-aged children. She has a higher education and for the past five years has been working with success in a government organization dealing with women's affairs.

Gulruhsor is in need of financial support as she is ill and needs treatment. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 somoni to buy medicine. She hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy medicine

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 42 years old; she is married and has four children who are in school. She is in the poultry business in the Philippines.

Annie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

Annie has been in poultry business for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Annie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens

loans.name: Arlie

texts.en:
Arlie is 53 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Arlie has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future Arlie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La perseverancia, el esmero y la dedicación, son características esenciales que definen a Leonarda y que han llevado el negocio de su pulpería por el camino del éxito. Ella tiene 36 años de edad, está en unión libre y tiene una hija. Es una mujer trabajadora y una excelente madre. Para llegar hasta dónde está hoy, tuvo que viajar a otro país para encontrar mejores oportunidades de empleo, puesto que la economía familiar no era muy buena. Regreso, trabajo de doméstica, asimismo en la venta de productos de belleza y a los 26 años logro obtener un buen capital para establecer su pulpería.
Ella solicita el crédito para mejorar el sistema higiénico en su hogar, con el objetivo de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, quiere brindarles salud de calidad para que se desarrollen con éxito en la sociedad. Su mayor soporte han sido su hija y su compañero de vida, ellos aseguran que la unión hace la fuerza, todos depositan su confianza en el financiamiento, quieren seguir luchando por un futuro prospero. Otro de sus ingresos son la costura y el alquiler de una casa, a través de estos le facilita ayuda económica a su madre, su  meta es mejorar su servicio higiénico y seguir trabajando, aprender nuevos oficios para seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Perseverance, commitment, and dedication are essential characteristics that define Leonarda. She has been able to take her grocery business down the road of success. Leonarda is 36 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has a daughter. She is a hardworking woman and an excellent mother. In order to get to where she is at today, Leonarda had to travel to another country in order to find better job opportunities since her family’s financial situation was not very good. Upon her return, she worked as a domestic employee and sold beauty products at the same time. At the age of 26, she had enough capital to establish her grocery store.

Leonarda is requesting a loan in order to improve the septic system in her house. Her goal is to improve her family’s living conditions and provide them better health so that they can develop successfully in society. Her greatest support has come from her daughter and her life companion. Their unity as a family gives them strength. All of them have put their trust in this loan because they want to keep striving toward a prosperous future. Leonarda generates additional income from sewing and renting out a house. This allows her to help her mother financially. Leonarda’s goals are to improve the septic service, keep working, and learn new trades so that she can keep progressing.

loans.use: to improve the septic system in her house.

loans.name: Ingris Yaneth

texts.es:
Ingris de 21 años de edad,  estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañada su pareja trabaja en una granja, con ella hace viajes en pickup y vende ganado en su comunidad, son padres de una niña aun no va a la escuela, viven en el terreno del papá. Actualmente,  han iniciado una pequeña granja agrícola, manejan cien pollos por semana hace unos 3 meses iniciaron,  ya que el negocio anterior no le funciono antes destazaba reses y cerdos cada semana esto le resulto mas rentable y fácil de manejar; la galera la tienen cerca de su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar lamina, madera para construir una galera mas grande, debido a que la actual no le alcanza para producir los pollos suficientes para surtir a sus clientes,  esto le va a generar mayores ingresos para su familia, a futuro planea manejar una galera mas grande y que le genere estabilidad económica para que su hija vaya a la escuela.
texts.en:
Ingris, 21 years of age, studied up to the 6th grade. She lives with her life partner who works on a farm. With Ingris, he makes trips in a pick up truck and sells cattle in his community. They are the parents of a girl who does not yet attend school. They live on her father's land.

At present, they have begun a small agricultural farm. They have been raising 100 chickens per week for some 3 months now. Their previous business did not work out. Each week, they used to butcher beef and pigs. Chickens have proven more profitable and easier to handle. The chicken pen is near their house.

The loan Ingris is soliciting will be used for purchasing metal sheets and wood to construct a larger pen, since their present pen is insufficient to produce enough chickens to satisfy customer demand. This will generate greater income for their family.

In the future, Ingris plans to have an even larger pen that should generate economic stability, enabling her daughter to attend school.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets and wood to construct a larger chicken pen.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 61 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like rice, soft drinks, sugar, etc. to sell.

Conchita has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like rice, soft drinks, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Melvin Yalil

texts.es:
Melvin tiene 30 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, por  las condiciones económicas de su familia ya no pudo seguir estudiando, ahora está soltero y con él viven tres de sus hermanos y su mamá. De él no depende de ninguna persona ya que tampoco tiene hijos todavía.

Melvin se dedica a  trabajar en la siembra de granos básicos,  tiene 18 años de desempeñar esta actividad., desde que era un pequeño sus padres lo llevaban al campo, de manera que así pudo aprender esta actividad, y por no tener otra fuente de ingresos se vio obligado a sembrar granos básicos. Antes trabajaba  como ayudante de albañil. El lugar donde trabaja actualmente está a 5 minutos de su casa y se conduce a pie. En las diferentes actividades agrícolas se involucran sus hermanos colaborándole en el aspecto económico para compra de los insumos y pago de mano de obra, y generalmente trabaja de  6:00 am  a  1:00 pm.

   Él utilizará el dinero para comprar los insumos agrícolas ya que el gobierno les regaló una parte pero no le es suficiente para lo que él siembra, comprará  3 quintales de formula y 5 quintales de sulfato, con el crédito podrá comprar sus insumos y darle así los requerimientos nutricionales a sus cultivos para obtener  mayor  producción. 
  
Su sueño es seguir trabajando con CrediCampo ya que es una institución que tiene muchos beneficios  para los agricultores, por otra parte quiere salir a  buscar una fuente de ingresos y con las ganancias poder construir su vivienda y formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
Melvin is 30 years old, single and lives with his mother and three sisters. He graduated from secondary school but could not continue his studies due to the economic conditions of his family. He is not dependent on anyone nor does he have dependent children.

Melvin works growing basic grains. He has been doing this for 18 years. When he was small his father would take him to the fields and he learned farming in this way. As he has no other way to make money he grows basic grains. He used to work as an assistant bricklayer. The place where he works in 5 minutes away from his house and he travels on foot. He and his brothers collaborate with the field activities and share the costs of inputs and paying for labor. Generally they work from 6 am until 1 pm.

He will use the money to buy agricultural inputs as the government has given them some but not enough for the crops. He will buy 3 quintals of fertilizer and 5 quintals of sulfate. With the loan he will be able to purchase the inputs to provide the needed nutritional requirements for his crops in order to obtain a higher yield.

His dream is to continue to work with CrediCampo as this institution provides many benefits for farmers. On the other hand he wants to find sources of income and with the profits be able to build a house and have his own family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: Gabriela de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella tiene una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, Gabriela está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos como sopas, granos básicos, refrescos, detergentes, etc. y así tener junto a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gabriela is 55 years old and lives in her own home along with her family. She has a small store in her home that she has managed for several years. From the sales she makes, Gabriela is able to pay for the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy more products such as soups, basic grains, soft drinks, detergents, and other items. This will allow her and her family to have a better quality of life since they all live together at home.

loans.use: to buy soups, basic grains, soft drinks, detergents, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase various goods (cookies, soaps, canned tomatoes, cube)

loans.name: Dely

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, two of whom are in school, Dely works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food-vending. Dely is borrowing PHP 11,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell through her general store business, like sardines, biscuits, and milk.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requests an additional loan to further build her business.

Dely has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, like sardines, biscuits, and milk.

loans.name: Satkynbu

texts.ru: Саткынбу 36 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей. У Саткынбу - среднее образование, она знает, как правильно использовать и планировать денежные средства для достижения поставленных целей. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Саткынбу с 1992 года занимается животноводством, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 дойные коровы и 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход от перепродажи скота и молока составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Саткынбу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Саткынбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение своего бизнеса и хочет накопить средства на покупку мебели для дома.
texts.en: Satkynbu is 36 years old, married and is the mother of five children. Satkynbu has a secondary education. She knows how to properly use and plan her money to achieve her goals. As the main source of income for her family, Satkynbu has been practicing livestock breeding since 1992. She currently has 2 milk cows and 15 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income from reselling cattle and milk is around 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of the further development of her farm, Satkynbu turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep. Satkynbu plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further expansion of her business. She also wants to wants to save money to buy furniture for her home.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es: La Sra. Martha Cecilia trabaja para un centro de salud publico en el municipio desde hace mas 21 años como responsable de datos estadisticos, actuamente este credito lo requiere para la compra de material de costruccion para realizar una reparacion menor en el dormitorio ya le resultado daño con los temblores realizados en el mes de abril del año 2014
texts.en: Martha Cecilia works at a public health facility in town and has done so for 21 years.  She is responsible for keeping statistical data.  She needs this loan to buy building materials to repair her bedroom that was damaged by the earthquakes in April 2014.

loans.use: to repair her bedroom

loans.name: Neftali

texts.es: Don Neftalí es propietario de un comedor y tortillería ubicado en san Martin Jilotepeque. En el ofrece a sus clientes y público en general comidas típicas y especiales. Este es el tercer crédito que solicita. Agradece a Fape Y Kiva el apoyo que brindan para poder ayudarse. Con los créditos ha podido comprar más material para cocinar, y también para arreglar el área de su comedor y por ello han crecido sus ventas y obtenido más ganancias y con eso está dando estudio a sus cinco hijos porque lo que el desea es que sus hijos se lleguen a graduar y así desenvolverse mejor en la vida.
texts.en: Don Neftalí owns a small restaurant and tortilla bakery located in San Martin Jilotepeque. There he offers typical and special meals to his clients and the general public. This is the third loan he has requested. He is grateful to Fape and Kiva for the support they have provided in order that he can help himself. With the loans he has been able to purchase more cooking equipment, as well as to smarten up the area of his small restaurant, leading to an increase in sales and earning greater profits. With this he is putting his five children through school, as he hopes that his children will graduate and thereby better make their way in life.

loans.use: to purchase goods for meal preparation

loans.name: Ben Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BEN ont en moyenne  30 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KORO/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BEN sont à leur  7ème  prêt solidaire. YABAKORO 2ème  femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 15Kgs d’oignon, 25Kgs de Sel, 20Kgs de beurre de karité, 1 paquet de  Cube Maggi et 10Litres d’huile. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group BEN average 30 years of age and three children each, all living in traditional families in KORO/SEGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through ties of kinship, and they have businesses buying and selling condiments. After having correctly paid back their previous loans, the women of the group BEN are now on their seventh solidarity loan.

YABAKORO, the second woman from the left in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase 15 kg of onions, 25 kg of salt, 20 kg of shea butter, a packet of Cube Maggi [bouillon cubes], and 10 liters of oil. She gets her supplies locally and from surrounding villages. Her sales are made to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash and often credit. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used for covering expenses related to healthcare, clothing, and schooling. And the rest will be reinvested in her work.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Dúo Luz De Vida San Lucas Group

texts.es: Dúo Luz De Vida San Lucas, integrado y representado por doña Esperanza, quien vende ropa y zapatos americanos, desde hace 16 años, tiene su local cerca del mercado de san Lucas, ahora también a puesto a la disposición de sus clientes carteras, y ropa típica.  Feliz por sus logros y ganancias que ha obtenido, desea invertir en un lote de ropa para dama, siempre varia sus lotes para tener variación en su local, su sueño es  seguir ahorrando para cuando ya no pueda trabajar.
texts.en:
The group Dúo Luz De Vida San Lucas is made up of and represented by Esperanza, who has been selling American clothing and shoes for 16 years. She has a store near the San Lucas market. Now she has made available to her customers wallets and traditional clothing.

She is happy for the successes and earnings she has had, and she wishes to invest in a batch of women's clothing. She always varies her merchandise in order to have a variety in her store.

Her dream is to continue saving for when she cannot work anymore.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Lluvias De Gracias Barcenas Group

texts.es:
Duo Lluvia de Gracia 
Reyna es madre soltera de dos niños de edades de 1 año y 6 años, el niño de 6 años asiste a la escuela de su comunidad, ella se dedica a su negocio el cual es venta de artículos de consumo diario tales como ( arroz, frijol, azúcar, etc.) inicio su negocio hace 3 años cuando se separaro de su pareja, se vio en la necesidad de trabajar para sostener los ingresos del hogar inicio su negocio con capital propio, actualmente solicita un crédito para invertir más en la tienda ya que le falta mercadería, agradece a Dios el tener un lugar propio para su negocio, anhela ver a sus hijos con un mejor futuro y darles lo necesario.
texts.en:
Duo Lluvia de Gracia

Reyna is a single mother with two children, ages 1 and 6.  The six year old attends the community school and she sells daily consumable items (rice, beans, sugar, etc.)  She started this business three years ago when she separated from her husband and saw the need to work to support her household.  She started with her own capital and is asking for a loan to invest more into her store because she needs merchandise.  She is grateful to God for having a place for her own business.  She wants her children to have a better future and be able to provide them with what they need.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Linda Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Linda tiene 46 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora que vive sola en el Distrito de Imperial, debido a que sus padres fallecieron hace algún tiempo.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, desde hace más de 4 años trabaja en el Mercado de la zona donde reside, dedicándose al  comercio de venta de maní.
La señora Linda está agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que con el apoyo brindado ella podrá invertir en su negocio de venta de maní, comprando mayor cantidad de productos entre la materia prima, bolsas, para que así pueda vender más y generar mayores ingresos, de esta manera ella saldrá adelante, trabajando con mucho empeño y dedicación.
texts.en:
Linda is 46 years old and very hardworking.  She lives alone in the Imperial district because her parents passed away some time ago.

She is a person with a great desire to get ahead and has been working in the local market for more than four years, selling peanuts.

Linda is grateful to the Kiva lenders because their support will allow her to invest into her business by buying products and supplies such as bags, in quantity so she can come out ahead by working with much effort and dedication.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice and beans and some condiments.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 42 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Elvira is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to pay sugarcane laborers to clear grass and to buy fertilizer.

Elvira has been farming sugarcane for 15 years and earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay sugarcane laborers to clear grass and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 49 years old and married.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Emelita is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Emelita has been pig fattening for eight years and also earns income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta is 61 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like coffee, milk, and sugar to sell.

Enriqueta has been in this business for six years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like coffee, milk, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 50 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sardines, noodles, and sugar to sell.

Esperanza has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from buying and selling livestock.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sardines, noodles, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 64 years old and married with 13 children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 60,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like rice, sugar, and noodles.

Felicidad has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 29 years and also earns an income as a feed retailer.

Felicidad aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like rice, sugar, and noodles to sell

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 35 years old and single and works very hard to help her parents.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like sardines, canned goods, chips, noodles, and sugar.

Jenalyn has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Jenalyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like sardines, canned goods, chips, noodles, and sugar

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell used clothing business in the Philippines and also earns income from pig fattening. Helen is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more used clothing to sell for her business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Jodelyn

texts.en:
Jodelyn is 35 years old and married with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like sugar, soft drinks, and coffee.

Jodelyn has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Jodelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like sugar, soft drinks, and coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Pelelina

texts.en:
Pelelina is 40 years old and a married woman. She has nine children. She has a small plantation, where she grows taro, bananas and yams, which she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years.

Pelelina needs a loan to buy chemicals, sprayers, a tiller, a crowbar, a wheelbarrow and fertilizer. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Pelelina will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies for farming

loans.name: Ivoga

texts.en: Ivoga is a 39-year-old, unmarried woman. She has five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas, which she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for seven years. Ivoga needs a loan to buy sprayers, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer and a spade. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Ivoga will save the profits from her sales, in case of an emergency.

loans.use: to buy sprayers, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer and a spade

loans.name: Inmaculada Group

texts.es:
El grupo Inmaculada, está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Actualmente están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, que les permitirá conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello poder seguir trabajando.
La Sra. Celia es manicurista, y pide este préstamo para la compra de materiales, como ser esmaltes, acetona, algodón, alicates, cortaúñas y demás. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que con gran esfuerzo y sacrificio esta saliendo adelante.
Celia quiere ir creciendo y luchando para poder ayudar a su familia y darles lo que necesitan y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades. Todas agradecen por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo y que les será de mucha ayuda.
En la foto hay 18 personas ya que el grupo tiene 18 miembros, pero en este ciclo solo 17 retiran el préstamo.
texts.en:
The Inmaculada group is in its fourth cycle as a communal bank of women, in which all its members work and help one another get ahead. They are participating in a poverty elimination survey, which will allow them to evaluate their situations so that they can improve their conditions. 

Celia is a manicurist, and is requesting this loan to buy materials such as nail polish, nail polish remover, cotton balls, nail files, clippers, and more. She is a very hardworking person who is putting in a lot of effort and sacrifice to be successful.

Celia wants to continue growing and striving to provide for her family, fulfill their needs, and ensure they are not left without necessities. The whole group is thankful for this opportunity they have been given and which would be help them greatly. In the picture there are 18 people as there are 18 members of the group, but in this cycle only 17 are participating.

loans.use: to buy materials such as nail polish, nail polish remover, cotton balls, nail files, clippers, and more.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es de la ciudad de Pilar, esta estudiando la carrera de Comercio internacional, es una persona muy sacrificada que esta estudiando y trabajando al mismo tiempo. El comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en cubrir sus cuotas de la universidad, y que le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder nuevamente cubrir sus cuotas de este año, ya que de esa forma seguirá estudiando y luchando por su objetivo.
texts.en:
Pedro is from the city of Pilar and is studying for an international business degree. He is a very self sacrificing person who is studying and working at the same time. He says that her previous loan was used to pay university fees and that it was a great help.

Today he asks for a new loan to be able to again pay the fees for this year, since in this way he will be able to continue studying and fighting for his goal.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar es de ciudad del Este, está estudiando la carrera de licenciatura en electromecánica, comenta que le gustaría poder emprender un rubro de acuerdo a su carrera, en su propia empresa.
Su familia es quien lo apoya en todo lo que él decide, gracias a su familia él está donde está. Comenta que pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de la universidad, como cuotas y copias, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Edgar is from Ciudad del Este and is studying for an electromechanic degree. He says that he would like to take on a career related to his degree, in his own business.

His family is who supports him in everything that he chooses.  Thanks to his family, he is where he is. He said that he asks for this loan to be able to pay his university expenses such as fees and copies, and in this way to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to pay university fees and to make copies.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Cada una de las integrantes de este grupo trabaja con la intención de generar sus propios ingresos. Y poder ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de sus esfuerzos, y el trabajo unido.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rossana quien a través del trabajo y deseo de superación se esmera en trabajar para lograr sus objetivos en la elaboración de comestibles para lograr mayor producción y mejor ganancia. Ella demuestra interés y dedicación a su trabajo para poder solventar los gastos de la casa y con  el compromiso que tiene con su grupo.
La Sra. Rossana solicita el préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carne, condimentos, pollo y demás de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo, luchando.
texts.en:
Each member of this group works with the intention of generating their own income.  They strive to be able to help their loved ones through their own efforts and by working together.

One of the members is Rossana who, through her work and desire to overcome, takes great pains to achieve her goals of producing better food and making better profits.  She shows interest and dedication in her work so that she can pay for her household expenses and meet the commitments she has made to her group.  

Rossana is asking for a loan so that she can invest it in the purchase of vegetables, meat, condiments, chicken, and other products so that she will be able to continue with her work and keep fighting.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, chicken, and other products.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor es estudiante de enfermería, vive con sus padres, y comenta que está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, con lo que quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Él es un estudiante muy dedicado que está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder destacarse en sus estudios. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir sus estudios.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, y así seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Victor is a nursing student.  He lives with his parents and says that he is studying for a nursing degree with which he will be able to help others.

He is a very dedicated student that his putting forth his best effort in order to stand out in his studies.  He is grateful for this opportunity that he is getting to continue his studies.

He asks for this loan to be able to invest it in paying university fees and be able to continue his studies as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Yuditt

texts.es:
Yuditt es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, vive con sus padres, está estudiando y al mismo tiempo trabaja. Es empleada de una distribuidora.
Está estudiando la carrera de Derecho, está cursando el primer año. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de una impresora y una notebook, para así poder realizar de sus estudios y trabajos de la universidad, para  llegar a la meta de ser un Profesional y poder servir a su familia.
texts.en:
Yuditt is from the city of Curuguaty. She lives with her parents and is studying and working. She is an employee at a distribution company.

She is studying Law and is in her first year. She requests this loan so that she can invest in the purchase of a printer and a laptop. This will allow her to complete her studies and university schoolwork so that she can achieve her goal of becoming a professional and helping her family.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop and a printer.

loans.name: Trigida

texts.es:
Trigida está estudiando la carrera de licenciatura en Administración de Empresas, vive con su familia en casa propia, en la ciudad de San Ignacio.
Está a punto de terminar sus estudios académicos y eso la motiva a seguir creciendo.  Ahora está haciendo su tesina, y después ya podrá obtener su título. Se define como una chica trabajadora, inteligente y con carácter. Su deseo es poder ayudar a su familia con sus ingresos profesionales.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Trigida is studying for a Business Administration degree. She lives with her family in their own home, in the city of San Ignacio.

She is at the point of finishing her academic studies and this motivates her to continue growing. Now she is doing her thesis, and after that she will be able to obtain her degree. She describes herself as a hard-working girl, intelligent and with character. Her desire is to be able to help her family with her professional income.

She asks for this loan to be able to pay her fees, and in this way continue with her studies as she has been doing. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Cristhian

texts.es:
El Sr. Cristhian tiene 29 años,  vive con su esposa y su hija en la ciudad de San Lorenzo. El se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados, se dedica en este trabajo desde el año 2010.
Comenta que además trabaja en una huerta en una plantación de productos hortícolas, y que  su objetivo es montar un local de ventas de verduras.
Pide el préstamo para la compra de animales. Agradece por el apoyo que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Cristhian is 29 years old. He lives with his wife and daughter in San Lorenzo city. He has been buying and selling cattle since 2010.

He says that he also works in a vegetable garden on a horticultural plantation and that his objective is to set up premises from which to sell vegetables.

He is asking for the loan in order to buy animals. He is grateful for the support which he is receiving

loans.use: to buy animals

loans.name: Siempre Unidos Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Laura ella es soltera y tiene 57 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.
Los socios que están pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal Siempre Unidos.

 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de comida, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de artesanía.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partners belong to The "Siempre Unidos" communal bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district. It belongs to the Cusco Province and the Cusco Department. 

The partner is named Laura. She is single and is  57 years old. She has one son. The partner has a restaurant business. 

She prepares different meals such as chicken with potatoes, soups and meat dishes. The partner works from 10 am to 5pm and has seven years working in this business. 

It is going very well for her. Her dream is to increase her restaurant business. She is requesting a loan to buy products for cooking such as chicken, meat and vegetables. 

The partners in this group photo was taken after the meeting because they asked for permission for work reasons. 

The person who's face is blocked out is not a member of the "Siempre Unidos" communal bank

The other partners work selling clothes, food, groceries as well as handicrafts. 

The partner is thankful to those who form part of this dream and is committed to paying the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: to buy products for cooking such as chicken, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Dúo Luz De La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
DUO LUZ DE LA ESPERANZA
Doña Fidelina es originaria de Tecpan Guatemala, tiene 36 años de edad, tiene bajo su responsabilidad a sus tres hijos (1 mujer y 2 varones), ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la crianza de animales.
El esposo de ella trabaja como chofer y gracias al apoyo de el ella sigue adelante con su negocio ya que entre los dos se están ayudando para poder salir adelante.
El sueño de ella es ampliar su negocio, así podrá obtener mejores ganancias y mandar a sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor.  
Ha tenido cuatro  créditos KIVA y con la puntualidad que ella tiene en sus pagos  no ha caído en mora.
texts.en:
“Luz de La Esperanza” (Light of Hope) Group

Doña Fidelina is originally from Tecpan, Guatemala. She is 36 years old and responsible for her three children (one daughter and two sons). Fidelina makes traditional woven products by hand and also raises animals.

Her husband works as a chauffeur. Thanks to his support, Fidelina is able to continue with her business. The two of them help one another so that they can get ahead.

Fidelina’s dream is to expand her business. She hopes to generate more income so that she can send her children to school for a better future. Fidelina has taken out four Kiva loans and repaid them on time without falling behind.

loans.use: to buy materials for making and selling traditional woven products.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne  37 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à SORON/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des céréales, d’arachide , des condiments et du charbon de bois. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur  2ème  prêt solidaire. SOUTOURA 1ère  femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 120Kgs d’arachide et 15 sacs de charbon de bois. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group BENKADI average 37 years of age and five children each, all living in traditional families in SORON/SEGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through ties of kinship, and they have businesses buying and selling grains, peanuts, condiments, and charcoal. After having correctly paid back their previous loans, the women of the group BENKADI are now on their second solidarity loan.

SOUTOURA, the first woman from the left in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase 120 kg of peanuts and 15 sacks of charcoal. She gets her supplies locally and from surrounding villages. Her sales are made to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash and often credit. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used for covering expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and schooling. And the rest will be reinvested in her work.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts and charcoal

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 50 years old and married, with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell recycled materials business in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks of recycled materials to sell.

Elizabeth has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell recycled materials business for 30 years and also earns an income from pig-fattening.

She aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Sucett

texts.en:
Sucett is 32 years old and married with four children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, sugar, soap, shampoo and other groceries.

Sucett has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish. Now, she has requested the additional loan to further build her business.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, sugar, soap, shampoo and other groceries

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 35 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, chips, shampoo, soap, cream, and coffee.

Marlyn has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns income from buying and selling charcoal and food vending.

Now, she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Marlyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, chips, shampoo, soap, cream, and coffee.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Emelita works hard to support her family.

She has a vehicle repair shop business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell charcoal. Emelita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional materials for her vehicle repair shop business and to pay for laborers' salaries.

Emelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her shop and to pay for laborers' salaries.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 49 years old and married. She has five children. She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for two years, and she earns additional income by weaving 'nipa' into roofing material.

She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy items to sell, like soap, shampoo, noodles, canned goods, and other groceries. Dina has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF, before this loan. She aspires to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her general store, like soap, noodles, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Domestica

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Domestica works hard to support her family. She has a business, buying and selling salted eggs in the Philippines. She earns additional income from farming vegetables.

Domestica is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF. She will use this amount to buy additional trays of salted eggs to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan, to further build her business.

Domestica has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional trays of salted eggs to sell

loans.name: Nubia Azucena

texts.es:
Nubia es una joven emprendedora de 22 años de edad, actualmente está estudiando profesorado en ingles en la universidad, es madre soltera de una hija que aún no estudia por su edad, con ella viven sus padres y hermanos.

Nubia se dedica a estudiar pero los días que no asiste a clases sale a vender ropa confeccionada del cual obtiene parte de sus ingresos. Ella decidió comprar ropa aunque al principio era poco lo que compraba, con el paso del tiempo se dio cuenta que si le generaba ganancias fue así como decidió surtir más su negocio. Antes solo ayudaba a sus padres en los oficios del  hogar, y  la distancia a donde sale a vender es variable ya que tiene varios lugares dónde ir a ofrecer su ropa.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar ladrillos de barro para construir un horno para elaborar pan, con el crédito podrá ayudar a sus padres a comprar los materiales. Cuando elaboren pan podrán sacar algunas ganancias que le ayuden a cubrir sus gastos familiares y así tener una mejor calidad de vida

Su sueño es luchar contra cualquier dificultad para lograr sacar su carrera  universitaria  y un día poder estar en una aula educando y contribuir a tener un mejor país, ya que las condiciones de vida hoy por hoy no son favorables y requiere de un esfuerzo para lograr lo que se propone cada uno en particular.
texts.en:
Nubia is a young, enterprising woman who is 22 years old. She is currently studying to be an English teacher at the university. She is a single mother and she has a daughter, who is not studying yet because she is still young. Nubia and her daughter live with Nubia's parents and her siblings. Nubia studies, but when she doesn't have to go to classes, she sells clothing, which is how she earns some of her income. She decided to purchase clothing even though at the beginning, she didn't buy much. With time, she realized that she was earning some income, so she decided to stock up her business. Before, she only helped her parents with the housework. The distances that she has to travel to sell the clothing vary, because she has several places where she goes to sell clothing now.

She needs the loan to purchase clay bricks to build an oven to make bread. With the loan, she will be able to help her parents to purchase materials. When they make bread, they will be able to earn money that will help them to cover their family expenses, and to have a better quality of life.

Her dream is to fight against any difficulty, to earn her university degree, and to one day to be in a classroom teaching, and contributing towards a better country. Living conditions today are not favorable, and they require hard work to achieve what one proposes.

loans.use: to purchase clay bricks to build an oven to make bread.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 35 years old and married. She has three children, who are in school. Mercedita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and she earns income from an entertainment business, as well.

She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase stock to sell, like snack foods, canned goods, sugar, soap, shampoo, and noodles. She has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF, before this loan.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell, like snack foods, canned goods, and sugar

loans.name: Luz Helena De Los Angeles

texts.es:
El sueño más común de una persona a la hora de iniciar un negocio es que este sea muy rentable y le genere artos ingresos y el caso de Luz Helena no es una excepción pero este sueño lo ve más humilde ella simplemente sueña con tener una tienda y que perdure en el tiempo compartir con los vecinos y obviamente generar buenos recursos que le permitan mantener su hogar y aumentar su calidad de vida. 
Luz Elena aprovechara un local que desocuparon y el cual se encuentra muy bien ubicado ye s cerca a su hogar para arrendarlo y convertirlo en una típica tienda de barrio y aspira a convertirse en esa tendera querida y apreciada.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido para su futura tienda con la que aspira a tener una vida tranquila rodeada de sus vecinos y familiares.
texts.en:
Typically, the dream of someone who is starting his or her own business is for it to be profitable and generate income, and Luz Helena is no different. However, she sees her dream as a humble one, she simply wants to have a store that will operate for a long time, to share with her neighbors, and obviously to generate resources that will let her support her household and better her quality of life.
Luz Elena will take advantage of there being an empty building that is in a good location, and close to her house, to rent it and turn it into a typical neighborhood store. She hopes to become the shop owner that everyone knows and loves. She is asking for a loan to buy a variety of products for her future store, with which she hopes to have a peaceful life surrounded by her neighbors and her family.

loans.use: buy products in order to start her own neighborhood store, so that she can have a peaceful life surrounded by her neighbors and loved ones.

loans.name: Jenelyn Ruffa

texts.en:
Jenelyn Ruffa is 22 years old, single, and works hard to support her parents. She sells clothing in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming flowers

Jenelyn Ruffa requested her eighth loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional stocks of clothing to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Gulmiyra

texts.ru: Гулмийра, 55 лет, вдова, мать 4 детей. Старшие дети проживают отдельно, младший сын живет с матерью и помогает по хозяйству. У Гулмийры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она с 1999 года занимается животноводством, выращивает и разводит овец и лошадей. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). Для содержания скота есть все условия, летом отгоняет скот на пастбища, зимой содержит в сараях. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулмийра обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота, она хочет приобрести лошадей. Доходы от кредита Гулмийра планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Gulmira is 55 years old, a widow, and a mother to four children. Her older children live on their own; Her youngest son lives with her and helps her with her farm. Gulmira has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, she practices livestock breeding. Since 1999, she has been raising and breeding sheep and horses. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). She has all of the necessary conditions for housing cattle. In the summer, she puts her livestock out to pasture; In the winter, she houses them in her barns. For the purpose of the further development of her farm, Gulmira turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 90,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. She also wants to purchase horses. Gulmira plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also wants to save money to make repairs on her house.

loans.use: to buy cows and horses.

loans.name: Mauricio Edilberto

texts.es:
Mauricio tiene 26 años de edad, este joven estudió hasta noveno grado debido a los escasos recursos económicos de su familia, por el momento no tiene hijos y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a llevarle los alimentos al lugar donde él trabaja y con  él viven su padres y un hermano. 

Mauricio se dedica a trabajar en un molino de nixtamal, también a trabajar en la siembra de granos básicos y hortalizas. El trabajo en el molino lo aprendió ya que su madre desde que era joven  tenía un molino  y  en los ratos que él tenía libres le enseñaba como funcionaba, en cuanto a los trabajos agrícolas  desde pequeño se lo enseñó su padre, luego su padre se enfermó y por eso hasta la fecha Mauricio ha tenido que encargarse de las actividades agrícolas para que su familia pudiera de esa manera salir adelante, el lugar de trabajo está a 15 minutos de su casa y se va a pie para llegar. En las actividades que realiza le ayuda su hermano menor pero solo los fines de semana porque estudia en otra ciudad.

Con el financiamiento comprará los insumos agrícolas dentro de los cuales están: 2  quintales de fórmula, 3 quintales de sulfato además invertirá parte  del financiamiento en la siembra de frijol. 

Con el crédito cubrirá la necesidad de poder comprar todos los insumos pues de lo contario se le haría muy difícil, ya que la situación económica de su familia no es nada favorable y quiere sacar bastante producción.

Su sueño es tener su propia casa pues donde vive actualmente es de su padre, por otra parte pretende tener su propio molino para prestar ese servicio a la gente y de alguna manera mejorar económicamente.
texts.en:
Mauricio is a 26 year old man who studied until the ninth grade due to the lack of money in his family. At the moment he does not have any children and his wife makes a living as a housekeeper and brings his food to his work. His parents and one brother live with him.

Mauricio works at a mill where they grind maize, as well as farming staple grains and vegetables. He learned to work in the mill because his mother has had a mill since she was young and during his free time she taught him how it worked. Regarding farm work, his father taught him when he was little, then his father fell ill and that is why, thus far, Mauricio has had to take charge of the farming duties so that his family can get by. His workplace is 15 minutes from his house and he walks there. His younger brother helps with the work, but only on weekends because he goes to school in another city.

With the loan he will buy farm supplies which includes: two quintals of fertilizer, three quintals of sulfate and he will spend a portion of the funds on planting beans.

The loan will allow him to buy all the supplies, otherwise it would be very difficult for him, because his family's economic situation is not good and he wants to produce a sufficient amount.

His dream is to have his own house, because where he lives now belongs to his father. On the other hand he hopes to have his own mill to lend this service to others and somehow improve economically.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies which includes: two quintals of fertilizer, three quintals of sulfate and he will spend a portion of the funds on planting beans.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es un hombre de 39 años de edad, es comerciante, es padre de 3 hijos, estudio hasta cuarto grado de básicca. 

Isabel trabaja venidendo pan, es su propio negocio lo ha hecho durante dos años, lo aprendio por iniciativa propia y decidio dedicarse para tener un ingreso economico adicional, tmabien se dedica a la agricultura y tmabien trabaja con ganando bovino.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar lácteos para surtir su negocio de venta de làcteos que tiene en su casa. Con el préstamo podra ofrecer a sus clientes diferentes podructos y por lo tanto tendra mejores ingresos para que su familia. Sus sueños son que su negocio siga creciendo y para su familia que sus hijos puedan estudiar y que puedan tener un futuro digno y propesro.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 39 year old businessman and father of three who studied until the fourth grade.

Isabel sells bread and it is his own business that he has developed during the past two years. He taught himself and he decided to do this as a living to have additional income. He also works as a farmer and raises cattle.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy dairy products to stock the dairy business that he has in his house. With the loan, he will be able to offer different products to his customers and therefore he will make a better income for his family. 

His dream is that his business will continue to grow and for his family, he hopes that his children can study and that they have a deserving and successful future.

loans.use: to buy dairy products to stock the dairy business that he has in his house.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis de 49 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, esta acompañado, su pareja trabaja en los oficios domesticos, tiene dos hijos de los cuales uno trabaja como empleado y el otro esta estudiando.
