Luis trabaja la agricultura lo ha hecho por mas de 30 ñaos, decidio trabajar en esto para apode tener granos basicos par su alimentaciòn,  tmabien trabaja con vacas lecheras y ademas trabaja vendiendo frutas y verduras.

El préstamo que esta soliictando, es para comprar semilla de maíz, abono, pesticidas y herbicidas. El cliente comprara insumos agricolas de una sola vez. Sus sueños son seguir trabajando para crecer un poquito en los diferentes negocios y en cuanto a sus hijos poder darle un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Luis is 49 years old, and finished fourth grade. He is in a common-law relationship, and the pair work in domestic offices. They have two children, of which one works as an employee and the other is a student.

Luis works in agriculture which he has done for more than 30 years; he decided to work in this field to be able to have basic grains for feeding. He also works with milk cows and additionally sells fruits and vegetables.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy corn seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides. The client will buy these agricultural investments all at one time. His dreams are to continue working to build a little in different business and be able to give his children a better future.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia is a 52-year-old married woman with six children. 

She has a plantation where she grows taro, yams, breadfruit and bananas, which she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. 

Telesia needs a loan to buy a rake, an axe, a water hose, a crowbar, new gum boots, a wheelbarrow and a chainsaw. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. 

Telesia will use the profits from her sales to support her family and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a rake, an axe, a water hose, a crowbar, new gum boots, a wheelbarrow and a chainsaw.

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
For two years, Adil has operated Servpreme, his very own carpet, upholstery and tile cleaning business. Adil diligently serves the northern New Jersey area, and every day he gets the chance to help people improve the look of their homes' interiors. 

Unfortunately, Hurricane Sandy struck shortly after Adil started his business, and he had to pull together extra funds in order to repair his company van, which was flooded. However, after a year and a half, Adil, his business and his community have come back strong!

He's looking to make 2014 his best year yet, and with your support, he can do it. Adil will use this loan to upgrade his equipment so that he can better serve his clients.

loans.use: to upgrade his carpet installation equipment.

loans.name: Televise

texts.en:
Televise is a 33-year-old, married woman, with five children. She catches and sells fish in her community to earn a living. She has five years of experience with this business. 

Televise needs a loan to buy a new fishing canoe, a chest freezer, a new spear, flippers, and new goggles. She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's education. Televise has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2009.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing canoe, a chest freezer, a new spear, flippers, and new goggles.

loans.name: Carlos Armando

texts.es:
Carlos es padre de 7 hijos y feliz habitante del municipio de Carmen De Viboral, desde allí trabaja en su negocio de producción, venta y distribución de panelitas de coco, arequipe, y panelitas de leche. Esto lo hace en una bicicleta que adecuó para realizar esta actividad.
Decidió iniciar con su empresa buscando una oportunidad para salir adelante después de haber sufrido un accidente en una mina de carbón en la que antes trabajaba.
El es un ejemplo de superación y esfuerzo ya que a pesar de todas las adversidades y problemas de salud a los que se ha enfrentado, nunca se ha rendido y por el contrario tiene mucha más convicción.
El solicita un préstamo para cancelar sus obligaciones financieras e invertir en la compra de materia prima como dulces, coco y leche para aumentar su producción de panelitas y tener unas mejores ventas.
texts.en:
Carlos is the father of seven children and happily resides in the town of Carmen de Viboral. There he works at his business of producing, selling, and distributing coconut candy, caramel sauce, and milk candy. He conducts his business from a bicycle cart that is equipped to handle this type of work.

Carlos decided to start his business because he was looking for an opportunity to get ahead. He suffered an accident at a coal mine where he used to work. Carlos is an example of perseverance and effort. Despite all of the adversities and health problems he has endured, he never got discouraged. On the contrary, he has much more conviction.

The loan he is requesting will be used to pay off his financial obligations and to invest in supplies such as brown sugar, coconut, and milk so that he can increase his candy production. This will help him to improve his sales.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making candy and to pay off his financial obligations.

loans.name: Faanee

texts.en:
Faanee is 32 years old and married with six children. 

She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, green and red peppers, and cucumbers that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Faanee needs a loan to buy a tiller, insect poison, fertilizer, sprayers, a crowbar, and gloves. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Faanee will use the profits from her sales to pay for her children's education.

loans.use:
to buy a tiller, insect poison, fertilizer, sprayers, a crowbar,
 and gloves

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy sacks of rice to sell for her buy-and-sell rice business.

Sherly has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Sherly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of three children, Eva works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Eva is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Eva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is 57 years old and married, with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, and noodles.

Leonor has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from buy-and-sell charcoal.

She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, and noodles.

loans.name: Brenda Roxana

texts.es:
Brenda tiene 20 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está soltera y trabaja haciendo limpieza en una casa, por el momento no tiene hijos y vive en casa de sus patrones, solo su madre depende de ella. 

Brenda ya cuenta con tres años de trabajar en la casa donde está empleada, esta actividad la aprendió porque desde pequeña le ha gustado hacer el oficio en su casa, y también por la necesidad de obtener ingresos para mantenerse.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar materiales para mejorar su vivienda.

 El sueño de esta joven es ver a su mamá en una mejor vivienda, y estar siempre pendiente de la salud de su madre.
texts.en:
Brenda is 20 years old. She studied until high school. She is single and works cleaning a home. For the moment she does not have children and lives in the home of her employers. Only her mother depends on her.

Brenda has already worked for three years in the home where she is employed. She learned this activity because since she was little she has liked to clean her home, and also because of the necessity of making an income to support herself.

She needs the loan to purchase materials to improve her home.

This young woman’s dream is to see her mother in a better home, and to always look after her mother’s health.

loans.use: to purchase materials to improve her home.

loans.name: Deysi Aracely

texts.es:
Deysi tiene 22 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, por motivos de escasos recursos económicos ella no pudo continuar con sus estudios, está acompañada y su esposo trabaja en la agricultura tiene una hija y es la única que depende de ella.

Actualmente, Deysi tiene una tienda, y se dedica también a  la elaboración de pan, y pupusas, cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en este trabajo, ella aprendió por su madre pues ella también se dedicó a la misma actividad por mucho tiempo, Deysi realiza el trabajo en su casa y solamente su madre se involucra.

Deysi utilizará el préstamo para hacer un horno, para hacer 3 ventanas donde tiene su negocio, comprará materia prima para la elaboración de pan y además una cocina para hacer pupusas.
Su sueño es tener un local adecuado para tener la mercadería que tiene en la tienda, de esta forma podrá ofrecer productos de muy buena calidad, podrá mejorar más su negocio y obtener más rentabilidad.
texts.en:
Deysi is 22 years old and studied through the ninth grade. As a result of limited financial resources, she was not able to continue her studies. Deysi is in a relationship and her husband works in agriculture. They have a daughter, who is the only one who is dependent on her.

Deysi currently has a store, but she also makes bread and “pupusas” (tortillas stuffed with various fillings). She has five years of experience and learned the trade from her mother, who has been in this same line of work for a very long time. Deysi works at home and her mother is the only other person involved.

Deysi will use this loan to build an oven with three vents in the space where she has her business. She will also buy supplies for making bread and a stove for making “pupusas”. Her dream is to have an adequate space for keeping the merchandise she sells in her store. This would allow her to offer products of the highest quality. As a result, she would be able to improve her business and obtain greater profitability.

loans.use: to build an oven with three vents, to buy supplies for making bread, and to purchase a stove for making "pupusas".

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
Elda is 28 years old and married with no children. She owns and operates a small flea market stall, selling souvenirs to tourists. She has been doing this for two years. 

Elda needs a loan to buy cava bowls, samoan designed necklaces and bangles, and elei printed shirts and shorts. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy cava bowls, samoan designed necklaces and bangles, and elei printed shirts and shorts

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 28-year-old single woman with three children. She makes and sells chop suey and curry with rice in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Lina needs a loan to buy vermicelli, curry powder, box of chicken leg quarters, onions, plastic plates, and cups. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Lina has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy vermicelli, curry powder, box of chicken leg quarters, onions, plastic plates, and cups

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as ceramics, cement, bonding materials and others.

loans.name: Alieta

texts.en:
Alieta is 48 years old and married with 7 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 11 years. Alieta needs a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, bags of fertilizer, a spade, a tiller, chemicals, sprayers, a crowbar, gloves and gum boots. 

Alieta has been a member of SPBD since 2003. She will use the profits from her sales to renovate the interior of her house and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a new wheelbarrow, bags of fertilizer, a spade, a tiller, chemicals, sprayers, a crowbar, gloves and gum boots

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
As a  parent of three children, Margie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear. Margie is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, shampoo, soap, chips, bread, etc., for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested additional loan to further build her business. Margie has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, shampoo, soap, chips, bread, etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 52 years old and married, with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Janet has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal business for five years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Janet aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 50 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Anita has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Anita aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Chela

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Chela works hard to support her family.

She has a personal products retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Chela is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more items like perfume, body lotion and other personal items.

Chela has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more items like perfume, body lotion and other personal items.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 37 years old, married with four children. Three of her children are in school. Ailyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ailyn requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell. Ailyn has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Ailyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Allen Grace

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Allen Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store.  She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fruit to sell to customers.

Allen Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.ru:
Абдумалик жизнерадостный и ответственный мужчина в возрасте 48 лет. Он родился и живёт в небольшом посёлке. Живёт он со своей женой и одним ребёнком в небольшом доме. Сам очень много работает, он мастером в местной мастерской. Он очень уважаемый человек. Для своей семьи делает всё возможное, чтобы они жили в достатке и ни в чём не нуждались. 

Абдумалик вот уже с несколько лет сотрудничает с Арванд. Он впервые брал кредит на потребительские нужды. Вот и сейчас также обратился для получения кредита на потребительскую нужду. Сейчас Абдумалик обустраивает свой дом, в котором они живут, чтобы его детям  было комфортно там жить. Он хочет закупить ковры  в дом, чтобы застелить полы. Но у него сейчас не достаточно средств, чтобы закупить ковры. Поэтому Абдумалик обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку ковров. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en:
Abdumalik is a happy and responsible 48 year-old man. He was born and still lives in a small village. He lives with his wife and one child in a small house. He is a repairman at a local shop and works a lot. He is a very respected person. He does everything possible for his family so that they could live comfortably and not in need.

Abdumalik has been partnering with Arvand for several years. He first took out a loan for consumer needs. And now he also came to obtain a loan for a consumer need. Abdumalik is currently repairing the house, where he lives, so that his children could live there comfortably. He wants to purchase rugs for the house to cover the floors. However, he does not have enough money to buy the rugs. This is why Abdumalik came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy the rugs. He thanks Arvand in advance for the support and hopes for a positive result.

loans.use: to buy rugs for his house

loans.name: Jose Ernesto

texts.es:
José tiene 38 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos con la cual ha procreado dos hijos que actualmente estudian en la escuela, por lo tanto son los únicos que dependen de él.

José se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, tiene cuatro años de dedicarse a este rubro y lo aprendió por medio de su padre y para llegar al lugar donde trabaja tarda alrededor de media hora. 

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para su cultivo, esto le permitirá mejorar la producción y obtener mejores ingresos. 

Su propósito es que su cultivo se desarrolle en buen estado y que tengan mayor rendimiento.
texts.en:
José is 38. He studied in school up to fifth grade. He is in a relationship, and his partner takes care of the domestic chores around the house. They have two children who go to school and who are dependent on him.

José has worked in agriculture and livestock farming for four years, and it's a job he learnt from his father. It takes him about half an hour to get to work from his home.

He needs this loan to buy seeds and fertilisers for his crops. This will allow him to improve production and earn more money. His goal is to fully develop his crops for a bigger harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilisers for his crops.

loans.name: Siniva

texts.en:
Siniva is a 36-year-old, married woman, with six children. To earn a living, she grows and sells cucumbers and cabbages in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Siniva needs a loan to buy chemicals, a tiller, gloves, seeds, a rake, a crowbar, and a new wheelbarrow. She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's education. Siniva has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2012.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a tiller, gloves, seeds, a rake, a crowbar, and a new wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina is a 33-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small lawn mowing business to earn a living. She has four years of experience with this business. Sina needs a loan to buy a new lawn mower, some spark plugs, a new pair of overalls, gloves, glasses and earmuffs. She plans to use her profits to help with her family's weekly expenses. Sina has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy a new lawn mower, spark plugs, overalls, gloves, glasses and earmuffs

loans.name: Leata

texts.en: Leata is a 31-year-old married woman with one child. She makes and sells donuts, pies and other goodies in her community to earn a living. She has six years of experience in this business. Leata needs a loan to buy bags of flour, bags of sugar, coconuts, icing sugar, yeast, a barrel of cooking oil, plastic bags and a new oven. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and to expand her business. Leata has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, coconuts, icing sugar, yeast, cooking oil, plastic bags and a new oven

loans.name: Gina Jean

texts.en:
Gina Jean is a hardworking entrepreneur who has fish vending and dressmaking businesses in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Gina Jean successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Gina Jean's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Aida works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling purified water in the Philippines and earns additional income from frozen foods. Aida is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of purified water to sell.

Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of purified water to sell.

loans.name: April Rose

texts.en:
April Rose is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, April Rose would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 68 years old and a widow with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, sardines, shampoo and other groceries. 

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru:
Бахром жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 38 лет лет. Он женат и имеет 3-их детей. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку. Сам Бахром живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Жена Бахрома также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей.

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Бахром занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Также Бахром подрабатывает мастером. От данного бизнеса он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Бахрому в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота. Сейчас Бахром хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Бахром очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Bahrom is a happy and hardworking 38-year-old man. He is married and has 3 children. He came to Arvand for the first time when he learned that there was an opportunity to obtain financial support. Bahrom lives with his family in a rural area. He does not have a higher education because he did not have an opportunity to attend a university due to his family's financial hardships. Bahrom's wife also does not an education and is a homemaker, involved with work at home and raising the children.

Bahrom is involved in his own business in order to have an income for food. He is involved in fattening up and selling cattle. Bahrom also works as a repairman. He earns a good income from this business. His wife also helps him with the business. She sells milk obtained from the livestock. Now Bahrom wants to increase the quantity of livestock to expand his business. This is why he came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy livestock. Bahrom hopes very much for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción, tiene 38 años de edad, es casado, tiene 4 hijos y vive junto a ellos y su esposa en una aldea del municipio de Gracias Lempira. Siempre se ha dedicado al cultivo de granos básicos, tiene 18 años de cultivar café, el cual vende en la zona ya despulpado y secado. ha mantenido en buen estado el cultivo por la inversión de préstamo, actualmente solicita el cuarto ciclo que es por 10,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar foliares y abonos para seguir dando buena asistencia a su finca y mejorar la producción. Su plan es seguir trabajando con sus cultivos para darle educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Concepción is 38 years old. He is married, has 4 children and lives with his wife in a village of the Municipality of Gracias Lempira. He has always worked growing basic grains. For 18 years he has grown coffee, which he sells already pulped and dried in his region. He has kept his plants in good condition by investing his loan. Currently he is requesting his fourth loan cycle of 10,000 lempiras in order to buy leaf absorbed fertilizers and organic fertilizers to keep on helping his farm and improve production. His plan is to keep on working his farm in order to give education to his children.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers and leaf absorbed fertilizers to help his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda is a 27 year old unwed woman who has 2 children. She makes and sells Elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for 2 years. Yolanda has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, a cutter, brushes, and rollers. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, a cutter, brushes, and rollers

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru:
Зебо является матерью одиночкой с двумя детьми, проживающая в городе Душанбе. Ее старшая дочь уже замужем и живет отдельно. Сын выпускник школы. Зебо сама опытная швея. Ей 56 лет. У нее среднее специальное образование. Она работает в Государственном учебном заведении, где  в течение 8 лет преподает там уроки кройки и шитья. В данный момент у нее более 15 учениц в классе. Она очень легко и доступно преподает свой предмет, за что все ученицы ее любят. 
Зебо сейчас нуждается в кредите. Она собирается купить бытовую технику для дома, а также частично купить одежду для сына выпускника. Она обещает погашать кредит за счет своей работы. Зебо нуждается в вашей поддержке для решения семейных нужд.
texts.en:
Zebo is a single mother with two children. She lives in the city of Dushanbe. Her eldest daughter is already married and lives separately. He son is graduating from high school. Zebo is an experienced seamstress. She is 56 years old. She has a secondary specialized education. She works in a state school where she has been teaching pattern-making and sewing lessons for the past 8 years. She currently has more than 15 female students in her classes. She teaches her subject in an easy-to-understand way, which is why all of her students love her.

Zebo now needs a loan. She is planning to buy household appliances for her home. She also plans to use a portion of the loan to buy her son graduation clothes. She promises to repay her loan with the earnings from her work. Zebo needs your support to fulfill the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy household appliances for her home, as well as using a portion to buy her son graduation clothes.

loans.name: Katie

texts.en: Katie is a 30-year-old married woman with five children. She makes and sells barbecue in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Katie needs a loan to buy a new bbq set, a box of chicken leg quarters, a box of mutton flaps, sausages, Chinese onions, soy sauce and tongs. She plans to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house. Katie has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy a bbq set, chicken, mutton flaps, sausages, Chinese onions, soy sauce and tongs

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe LAIDOU ont en moyenne  31ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KORO/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe LAIDOU sont à leur  7ème  prêt solidaire. SITAN 2ème  femme de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 15Kgs de piment, 25Kgs de Sel, 10Kgs de beurre de karité, 2 paniers de tomate et 20Litres d’huile. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Laidou group average 31 years of age with three children each, and they all live in extended traditional families in Koro/Segou (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). These women got to know each other through family links and have small businesses buying and selling condiments. Having repaid all their previous loans in full the women of the Laidou group are now on their seventh group loan.

Sitan, who is sitting second from the right in the photo, is planning to use her loan to buy 15 kilos of chili peppers, 25 kilos of salt, 10 kilos of shea butter, two baskets of tomatoes and 20 liters of oil. She gets her supplies locally and in the surrounding villages. She sells to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash and often on credit.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 15,000FCFA, which will be used for health-related expenses, food, clothing and school fees; the balance will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Pua

texts.en: Pua is a 22-year-old woman who is unwed with one child. She has a small lawn mowing business to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Pua needs a loan to buy a new lawn mower, some gasoline, new spark plugs, earmuffs and a new pair of overalls. She will use her profits to help with her family's weekly expenses. Pua joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new lawn mower, gasoline, new spark plugs, earmuffs and overalls

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a Djakarta motorcycle for transport purposes.

loans.name: Jocel

texts.en:
Jocel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jocel is 34 years old and both of her children are in school.

She has an internet café business in the Philippines. Jocel requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy new supplies for her internet café.

She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jocel would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her internet café.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling personal products. Lourdes is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Lelanie

texts.en:
Lelanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more sea food to sell for her fish vending business. Lelanie has been in this business for three years. 

Lelanie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more sea food to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of six children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Nenita is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase additional inventory to sell in her general store business.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory to sell

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of five children, Ramona works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Ramona is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more spare parts for her tricycle.

Ramona has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for her tricycle

loans.name: Trixie

texts.en:
Trixie is 29 years old and married with four children.  With three children in school, Trixie works very hard to provide for them.

Trixie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Trixie has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, noodles, sugar and other groceries. 

In the future, Trixie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Wilma works hard to support her family.

She has a firewood and charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Wilma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock to sell to customers.

Wilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 75 years old and a widow with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store and charcoal retail businesses in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries like soap, snack foods, shampoo and other groceries.

Zenaida has been in this business for 10 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Zenaida aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like soap, snack foods, shampoo and other groceries.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en: Ma. Luisa is 51 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Ma. Luisa is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens. Ma. Luisa has been raising livestock for twenty years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Begmurod

texts.ru:
Бегмурод добродушный и жизнерадостный  пожилой мужчина. Он женат и имеет двоих сыновей. Сыновья Бегмурода работают в местной мастерской плотниками и получают от своей работы средний доход. Бегмурод живёт со своей женой в небольшом доме в сельском посёлке. Чтобы прокормить свою семью он также занимается своим бизнесом а также работает плотником вот уже как 30 лет. Бегмурод занимается дехканством и животноводством.

У него имеется земельная площадь. Из общей площади земли, некоторая часть земли составляет богарные земли, а остальная площадь это поливные земли. На этой земле Бегмурод занимается выращиванием моркови, картошки и зерновых культур. А его жена помогает ему ухаживать и растить скот. Так как земельная площадь у них большая, они также пасут на ней своих скот. Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Бегмурод хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Для этого он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Бегмурод заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Begmurod is a kind and happy elderly man. He is married and has two sons. Begmurod's sons work at as carpenters at a local shop and earn an average income from their work. Begmurod lives with his wife in a small house in a rural village. He is also involved in his own business and has been working as a carpenter for 30 years in order to support his family. Begmurod is involved in farming and animal husbandry.

He has a land plot. Out of the entire land, some of the land is rainfed and the rest is irrigated. Begmurod grows carrots, potatoes and cereal crops on this land. His wife helps him to take care and raise livestock. Because their land area is large, they also graze their livestock there. The animal husbandry business yields a good income, and this is why Begmurod wants to expand this business by increasing his livestock headcount. He came to Arvand to obtain a loan for the purchase of livestock. Begmurod thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Ana Desideria

texts.es:
Ana tiene 40 años de edad, estudió hasta octavo grado, está soltera y tiene 4 hijos a su cargo y viven con ella, dos estudian bachillerato los otros van a la escuela, en su casa vive su madre y una hermana.

Desde hace 8 años Ana se dedica al oficio de costurera y aprendió porque asistió a una academia, además los fines de semana vende gaseosas, yuca, pastelitos y papas fritas en la cancha de futbol.

El préstamo lo necesita para surtir más el negocio que tiene, también comprará más materiales como telas, y otra parte para la compra de insumos agrícolas pues su tío realiza las labores y sembraran 1 hectárea de maíz. 

Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales, comprar una máquina de coser ropa y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana is 40 years old. She studied until 8th grade, is single and has 4 children that she takes care of and that live with her. Two are in college and the others go to school. Her mother and one of her sisters live in her house. 

Since the age of 8 Ana has worked as a seamstress and she learned because she went to an academy.  Also, on weekends she sells soda, yucca, small cakes and fries at the soccer field. 

She needs the loan to stock her business more. She will also buy more materials like fabric and use the other part to buy agricultural supplies because her uncle does the work and they will sow 1 hectare of corn.

Her dreams are for her children to be professionals, to buy a sewing machine and to earn more income.

loans.use: to supply her business, to buy more materials such as fabric, and to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Mujeres Xepecul Group

texts.es: Maria tiene 43 años de edad, (aparece en la foto de último de izquierda a derecha de blusa blanca con rosas) vive en el municipio de Nahualá, departamento de Sololá, tiene 4 hijos: el primero de 22 años de edad trabaja como maestro de educación física en la cabecera departamental, el segundo tiene 19 años de edad estudia sexto magisterio, el tercero tiene 17 años de edad estudia quinto magisterio y el cuarto tiene 13 años de edad estudia primero básico, se dedica a vender ropa típica y lo hace de forma ambulante en la comunidad donde vive y en comunidades cercanas, su mamá tenía el mismo negocio y desde pequeña se involucró en la misma, Maria necesita un crédito para comprar más ropa típica y surtir su negocio, el sueño de María es agrandar su negocio, colocar un puesto fijo y apoyar a sus hijos para que continúen estudiando.
texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old. (She is the woman farthest to the right in the photo, wearing a white blouse with roses.) She lives in the city of Nahualá in the province Sololá. She has 4 children: the first is 22 years old and works as a PE teacher in the main city of the province, the second is 19 and is in the 6th year of secondary school, the third is 17 and is in the 5th year of secondary school, and the fourth is 13 and is in middle school.

Maria sells traditional clothing for a living, working as a mobile vendor in her community and others nearby. Her mom had the same business and since she was a child, Maria has been involved in it. 

Maria needs a loan to purchase more traditional clothing and expand her inventory. Maria's dream is to grow her business, establish herself at a permanent location, and support her children so that they can continue their education.

loans.use: to purchase and sell traditional clothing

loans.name: Siyen's Group

texts.en: Siyen, 35 years old, is a married mother of four children living in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Farming rice and cassava is the main source of her family’s income, and her husband supplements the income by fishing. She has been in this business for 15 years.  Siyen has been with VisionFund for three cycles and she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Siyen wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to farm more crops and to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Iris Yaneth

texts.es:
Iris de 21 años de edad, es una joven soltera emprendedora y con buenas ideas de salir adelante, vive con su madre, dos hermanos y tres tios. Ella trabaja en una ciudad lejos de su comunidad y se tiene que transportar de un departamento a otro, le toca viajar en bus. Iris crecio solo con la ayuda de su madre y ahora que ella ya es mayor de edad su meta es que sus dos hermanos no les falte nada y puedan seguir estudiando.

Iris el préstamo lo necesita para ayudar a sus tios a plantar una milpa, ya que ella es el quien tiene las posibilidades de colaborar con su familia. Especificamente comprara abono, semilla de maíz, herbicidas, pesticidas.

Iris piensa que con su apoyo todos van a vivir una vida mejor y si es posible tambien cubrir mas necesidades en el hogar.
texts.en:
Iris is 21 years old and is a single entrepreneur with good ideas for getting ahead.  She lives with her mother, two siblings, and three uncles.  She works in a town far from her community and has to travel from one department to another by bus.  Iris was raised only by her mother and now that she is an adult, her goal is for her siblings have what they need to stay in school.

Iris needs this loan to help her uncles plant a corn field so she can help out the family.  She will buy compost, corn seeds, herbicides, and pesticides.

Iris believes that everyone will live better and be able to cover more household needs with her help.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Meipo

texts.en:
Meipo is a 52-year-old married woman with 10 children. 

She has a small vegetable garden and grows cabbages and cucumbers to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. Meipo has requested a loan to buy insect poison, sprayers, gum boots, a tiller, a wheelbarrow, a new machete, and a spade. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. With her profits, Meipo hopes to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, sprayers, gum boots, a tiller, a wheelbarrow, a new machete, and a spade

loans.name: Mary Ana

texts.en: Mary is a 42-year-old woman, who is married with three children. She has a small business selling toilet paper and tissues. She has two years of experience with this business. Mary needs a loan to buy a whole box of toilet rolls, tissues, plastic bags and rubber gloves. She will use her profits to pay for her family’s weekly expenses. Mary joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a box of toilet rolls, tissues, plastic bags and rubber gloves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy five calves to fatten and later sell.

loans.name: Imelda Agnes

texts.en: Imelda is a 38 woman who is unwed and has 3 children. She has a small lawn mowing business to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. Imelda needs a loan to buy new boots, a new pair of overalls, glasses, gloves, and a new lawn mower. She will use her profits to expand her business. Imelda joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new boots, a new pair of overalls, glasses, gloves, and a new lawn mower

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Isabel is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Isabel has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Evalyn

texts.en: Evalyn is 43 years old and married with four children.  With three children in school, Evalyn works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell. Evalyn has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, snack foods and other groceries.  In the future, Evalyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, three of whom are in school, Emma works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Emma is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en: Lerma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lerma is 43 years old, and all of her children are in school. She has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. Lerma requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to sell in her food stall. Lerma has been in this business for six years. In the future, Lerma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es:
Bertha, no cuenta con el capital necesario para surtir con mercadería fresca su negocio por ello opta por un nuevo préstamo que utilizara para dar continuidad a su actividad, comprara moluscos, camarones y diferentes tipos de pescado, esta compra le permitirá tener clientes satisfechos y sus ganancias seguirán siendo de mucha utilidad para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia y la cancelación de la nueva deuda.
Con la ayuda del crédito anterior incremento sus productos y ha podido mantenerse trabajando sin problemas.
texts.en:
Bertha doesn't have the capital necessary to stock her business with fresh merchandise, so she is opting for a new loan that she will use to continue her business. She will buy mollusks, shrimp, and other types of seafood.

This will allows her to keep her customers satisfied, and her income will continue to help her cover her family's basic necessities and the repayment of this new loan.

With the help of the previous loan, she increased her number of products and has been able to continue working without any problems.

loans.use: to purchase mollusks, shrimp, and other types of seafood

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina, con el financiamiento anterior tuvo la oportunidad para aumentar su ganado, sus nuevas ganancias le ayudan a brindar un mejor estilo de vida a su familia y seguir cubriendo sus compromisos económicos.
Se acerca la temporada ideal para invertir nuevamente en ganado para repasto y opta por solicitar un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ganado y concentrado para alimentarlo, así continuara fortaleciendo el negocio.
texts.en:
With her previous loan, Ernestina had the opportunity to enlarge her herd of livestock. Her new income is helping her provide her family with a better lifestyle and continue covering her economic obligations.

The ideal season to invest in livestock to re-pasture is approaching, and she has decided to request a new loan to invest in the purchase of livestock and feed, so that she can continue strengthening her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and feed

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
José, es felizmente casado, actualmente vive solo con su esposa, sus hijos ya son independientes, ambos administran una tienda de seis de la mañana a siete de la noche, ofrecen a sus consumidores productos varios. 
Invertirá en nueva mercadería para surtir el inventario de su negocio, comprara frijoles, arroz, azúcar, boquitas, bebidas, jugos, gaseosas, dulces, detergentes, jabón, etc., atenderá mejor a sus clientes, aumentara sus ventas e ingresos.
Su aspiración es continuar trabajando, cubrir las necesidades de su hogar y cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
José is happily married and currently lives only with his wife. His children are already independent. They both run a store from six in the morning until seven at night. They offer their customers various products.

He will invest in new merchandise to supply his business´s inventory. He will buy beans, rice, sugar, appetizers, drinks, juice, soda, desserts, detergents, soap, etc. He will better serve his customers and increase sales and income. 

His aspiration is to continue working, cover the cost of household necessities and pay his debt.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, appetizers, drinks, juice, soda, desserts, detergents, soap, etc.

loans.name: Houch's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Sangke district, Houch is 63 years old and married. She has nine children. She is a rice farmer while her husband is a fisherman. Having been in this business for almost 11 years, she currently can earn about 31,000 KHR per day. 

Houch has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Houch wants to use her portion to buy fishing materials. She hopes to catch more fish in order to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials

loans.name: Evelin Rosmeri

texts.es:
Evelyn tiene 22 años de edad, actualmente está estudiando segundo año de bachillerato general, está acompañada y su esposo es empleado de seguridad, tiene una hija y nadie mas depende de ella.

Evelyn se dedica a los oficios domésticos, además de estudiar cuando llega a su casa tiene que hacer los quehaceres del hogar, atender a su hija y a su pareja cuando llega del trabajo, decidió continuar con sus estudios gracias al apoyo y motivación de su pareja para poder superarse y tener un mejor nivel de vida, el lugar donde estudia está lejos de su hogar y tiene que viajar una hora en bus para poder llegar , estudia de lunes a viernes de 7:00 am a 4 pm, su hija la cuida su hermana en casa de su madre mientras ella estudia. 

Ella necesita muchísimo de este crédito para gastos en sus estudios y para mejorar su vivienda y ampliarla un poco, construirle un cuarto y necesitará comprar bloque, cemento, arena, hierro, madera y poder pagar la mano de obra. 

Su sueño es poder terminar sus estudios de bachillerato, luego sacar una carrera universitaria, tener su propia vivienda pues donde vive actualmente es de su padre.
.
texts.en:
Evelin is 22 years old, and currently is studying, in her second year of high school. She is in a relationship, and her husband is a security guard. She has a daughter, and no one else depends on her.  

Evelin does domestic work, as well as studying. When she arrives at her house, she has to do all of the housework, look after her daughter and her partner when he arrives from work. She decided to continue with her studies thanks to the support and motivation of her partner, in order to overcome her situation and have a better level of living. 

The place where she studies is far from her home, and she has to travel for an hour on the bus in order to get there. She studies Monday to Friday from 7am to 4pm, and her daughter is cared for by her sister in their mother's house while Evelin is at school. 

She really needs this loan for school expenses, and to improve her home and expand it a bit by building a room. For this, she will need to buy blocks, cement, sand, iron, wood, and will need to pay for labour. 

Her dream is to be able to finish her high school studies, and then pursue a University education and have her own home, as where she currently lives belongs to her father. 
.

loans.use: to pay for school expenses, and to improve her home and enlarge it a bit, building her a room. She will need to buy blocks, cement, sand, iron, wood, and be able to pay for labour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a small boat.

loans.name: Ekueta

texts.en:
Ekueta is a 50-year-old married woman with five children.
 
She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. Ekueta has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a tiller, a crowbar, a spade, new gum boots and a sprayer. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, Ekueta hopes to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a tiller, a crowbar, a spade, new gum boots and a sprayer

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en: Alejandra is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Alejandra is 46 years old and all of her children are in school. She has a business selling seafood in the Philippines. Alejandra requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell. She has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Alejandra would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalie is 39 years old and all of her children are in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

Rosalie has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Sokhoern's Group

texts.en:
Sokoern is 50 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She has six children. Rice farming is the only source of her family’s income and she has been in this business for 20 years. With the current business, she can earn approximately 30,000 KHR per day and save about 10,000 KHR each day for her future needs.
 
Sokhoern has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural products to help her coffee plants

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 28 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Emily has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Emily has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Emily would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Reyna Elsy

texts.es:
Reyna tiene 39 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está casada y su esposo es motorista de camión, tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela 

Reyna se dedica a los oficios domésticos, actualmente lava y plancha ajeno, y también desde hace 8 años trabaja de asistente de veterinaria. 

Ella necesita el dinero porque quiere invertir para un negocio de ropa, comprará blusas, faldas, ropa interior y venderá la mercadería en las comunidades cercanas. 

Su sueño es ver graduarse a sus hijos y que su negocio le funcione.
texts.en:
Reyna is 39 years old. She studied until sixth grade, is married and her husband is a truck driver. She has 2 children that go to school.

Reyna does domestic work, currently washing and ironing for other people. She has also worked for 8 years as a veterinary assistant.

She needs the money because she wants to invest in a clothing business. She will buy blouses, skirts, underwear and will sell the merchandise in the nearby communities.

Her dream is to see her children graduate and for her business to work.

loans.use: to invest in a clothing business. She will buy blouses, skirts, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is 32 years old, married, and has five children. She runs a small canteen selling a variety of snacks in the local school. She has been doing this for two years. Stella has requested a loan to buy slices of bread, jam, butter, paper plates and cups, soft drinks and plastic bags. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Stella will help her husband pay for their children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy slices of bread, jam, butter, paper plates and cups, soft drinks and plastic bags

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is 40 years old. She is a married woman with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Edelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Edelyn has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Edelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, fertilizers and poison since they plant two hectares of yucca and half a hectare of squash

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Doña Juana, tiene 51 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea del Municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella siempre busca como obtener ingresos, ha cultivado maíz y también a realizado trabajos en maquila. Hace dos años decidió tener cría y engorde de cerdos para venderlos, también cultiva palma africana. Ha decidido por un crédito de 11,000 Lempiras para comprarle alimentación a los cerdos y vender. Ella espera obtener mejor ganancia y poder ampliar el negocio, construyendo otras galeras y comprando mas cría de cerdos.
texts.en:
Juana is 51 years old, married and has two children. She resides in a village in the Municipality of Choloma, Cortes. She always is looking for ways to earn income having done work such as, corn cultivation, and manufacturing.

Two years ago she decided to work in the breeding and fattening of pigs in order to sell them, and also cultivate African palm. She has decided on a loan request of 11,000 Lempiras to purchase the feed for the pigs she sells. She hopes to increase her earnings and be able to grow the business, building other pig pens, and purchasing more pigs for breeding.

loans.use: Purchase the feed for the breeding, and fattening of pigs she sells.

loans.name: Bunna

texts.en:
Bunna, 44, lives with her husband and four children in a village of Kampong Cham province. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for almost 24 years. They supplement the family’s income by working as paid workers.

Bunna has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for one loan cycle and completely paid back the loan. She is now applying for a loan to buy one cow to help her agribusiness. She hopes to grow her business in order to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy one cow

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru:
Хасан жизнерадостный пожилой мужчина. Он женат и имеет четверо детей. У него очень дружная семья. Живут они в сельской местности. Чтобы иметь доход в семье, все члены семьи пытаются как-то зарабатывать деньги. Каждый трудится как может. Сам Хасан занимается животноводством и выращиванием сельхозкультуры. От этого дела он получает хороший доход. Он выращивает в своём небольшом саду виноград. Хотя это сезонный бизнес, но он также приносит ему доход.

Основным и стабильным бизнесом Хасана является животноводство. Он разводит и продаёт скот. В этом деле ему помогает жена и его дети. Они ухаживают за скотом, а также продают полученное от скота молоко. Бизнес животноводства приносит Хасану хороший и стабильный доход. Поэтому он желает расширить этот бизнес. Ему необходимо купить ещё несколько голов скота для выращивания и дальнейшей продажи. Для этого Хасан обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он надеется, что этот бизнес будет успешно расширяться и приносить больше прибыли, чтобы качественно удовлетворять нужды семьи. Хасан заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Hasan is a cheerful, elderly man. He is married and has four children. They live in a rural area and are a very close-knit family. All of the family members try to earn money so that they have an income. They all do what they can. Hasan raises livestock and plants crops and earns a good income. He grows grapes in his small garden. Even though it is a seasonal business, it still brings in money.

Hasan's main, stable business is livestock. He raises and sells cattle with the help of his wife and children. They take care of the cattle and sell milk. The livestock business brings him a good, stable income and he would like to expand further. Hasan applied for a loan with Arvand to buy a few more head of cattle to raise and sell. He hopes that he will be able to successfully expand his business and earn more money to meet his family's needs. Hasan thanks Arvand for their support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 56 years old, married and has seven children, one of whom is in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresita has been raising pigs for four years, and she has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 41 years old and married with two children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and has been in this business for two years.

Josephine requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Juvy requested a 16,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat. She has been in this business for 13 years.

In the future, Juvy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco tiene 33 años de edad,  es soltero, vive en el municipio de Nahualá, departamento de Sololá, obtiene sus ingresos por trabajos de herrería, aprendió de un su amigo todo lo relacionado a la herrería, tiene 3 años de esta realizando esta actividad, además hace trabajos de albañilería, los trabajos los entrega en la comunidad donde vive, es bien aceptado porque ya no hay otra persona que se dedica a trabajos de herrería, Francisco necesita un crédito por un monto de Q. 2,500.00 para comprar materia prima para trabajos de herrería (puertas, marcos de ventana, balcones entre otros), la meta de Francisco que sus trabajos sean aceptados en otras comunidades.
texts.en: Francisco is 33-years old.  He single and lives in the municipality of Nahualá, Sololá Department.  He earns his income with blacksmithing works.  He learned everything about being a blacksmith from a friend.  Francisco has been in the business for three years.  In addition, he works in brick laying.  Francisco delivers his works around the community where he lives.  He is well-received because there isn't anyone else in the area dedicating themselves to blacksmith works.  Francisco needs a loan in the amount of Q. 2,500.00 (USD $325) to purchase raw materials for his blacksmith works (doors, window frames, balconies and other items).  Francisco's goal is for his works to be received into other communities.

loans.use: to purchase blacksmiths'  raw materials.

loans.name: Maria Bastida

texts.en:
Maria Bastida is 68 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a general store business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years. 

Maria Bastida requested a 14,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sokry's Group

texts.en:
Sokry lives in a rural area located in the Sangke district of Battambang province. She is 25 years old. 

To support her family, she has been farming rice and fishing for seven years and supplements her family’s income by working as a garment worker. From the current business, she can earn about 28,000 KHR per day and can save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Sokry has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. 

As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help with her coffee crop.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.ru:
Хабиба живет в Б.Гафуровском районе города Худжанд. Она 50-летняя мать-одиночка. У нее единственный сын в возрасте 17 лет. Ее сын уже работает и помогает матери с обеспечением. Хабиба сама швея. Она более 10 лет занимается шитьем покрывала для колыбели. Хабиба работает с душой, ей нравится создавать красивые покрывала для колыбели младенцев. Это ремесло ей передано от матери и она благодарна, что мать обучила ее этому мастерству, с помощью которого она зарабатывает на жизнь. 
Хабиба сейчас обратилась за кредитом. Она хотела бы купить побольше ассортимента тканей и других необходимых швейных принадлежностей и таким образом расширить свою деятельность. Она ждет вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Habiba lives in the Ghafurov district of the city of Khujand. She is a 50-year-old single mother. Her only son is 17 years old. Her son already works and helps his mother with upkeep. 

Habiba herself is a seamstress. She has been working sewing bedspreads for children's cradles for over 10 years. Habiba puts all her soul into her work, she likes to create beautiful bedspreads for little kids' cradles.This craft was passed down to her by her mother and she is grateful that her mother taught her this skill, with the help of which she is able to make a living.

Habiba has now decided to ask for a loan. She would like to buy more types of fabric and other essential sewing materials and in this way to expand her business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other sewing materials

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 33 years old and a married woman with five children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rowena has a food vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years. 

She requested a 19,500 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Chelvin Del Carmen

texts.es:
Chelvin tiene 31 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor, tienen 4 hijos que viven en su casa los cuales estudian en la escuela.

Chelvin se ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida a los oficios domésticos, además lava y plancha ajeno, desde hace un año tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa y además le ayuda a su pareja en las labores agrícolas. 

El crédito lo necesita  para surtir la tienda, comprará artículos de primera necesidad como arroz, frijoles, aceite y gaseosas, y otra parte para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes y veneno.

Ella espera tener mucho tiempo de vida para seguir viendo crecer a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Chelvin is 31 years old. She studied up to third grade, is in a relationship, and her partner is a farmer. They have 4 children who live in their house, and who attend school. 

Chelvin has worked for most of her life doing domestic work, as well as doing washing and ironing for others. She has had a small store in her house for a year now, and she also helps her partner with farming work. 

The loan is needed to supply the store, as she will buy staple items such as rice, beans, oil and sodas, and another part of it will buy agricultural supplies like fertilizer and poison.

She hopes to have a long life to be able to continue watching her children grow up.

loans.use: to supply her store, by buying staple items such as rice, beans, oil and sodas, and to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizer and poisons.

loans.name: Xiomara Elizabeth

texts.es:
Xiomara, es madre de un niño de dos años, está acompañada, no recibe ayuda del extranjero, Xiomara es propietaria de una quesería, lo inicio por necesidad de tener ingresos para aportar en los gastos de su hogar, su horario de trabajo es de cuatro de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
Invertirá en la compra de empaque, bolsas y cuajada, para aumentar su productividad, cumplir con sus pedidos y tener buenas ganancias, espera ofrecer a su familia mejor alimentación, salud y vestuario.
Su visión es seguir fortaleciendo su negocio para tener una fuente ingreso estable y cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
Xiomara has a two-year-old son, she has a partner and doesn’t get help from outside the country.  She owns a cheese shop, which she started due to the need to obtain income to help with home expenses, her work schedule is from four in the morning to five in the afternoon.
She will invest the loan in buying packaging materials, bags and curdle product.  All to increase her productivity, meeting order levels and have good profits, she hopes to offer her family better nutrition, good health and clothing.
Her vision is to continue strengthening her business to have a stable source of income and be debt free.

loans.use: to buy cheese packaging materials, bags and curdle product.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, es soltero, vive solo, nadie depende económicamente de él, cuenta con un negocio de venta de celulares y accesorios, poco a poco ha progresado, ya cuenta con un local propio, sus labores inician a las siete de la mañana y finalizan a las cinco de la tarde, este oficio lo aprendió como empleado y tiene 5 años de trabajar de manera independiente.
Utilizará el capital para comprar celulares, carcasas, manos, libres, chips, cargadores, memorarías, etc., le ayudara a renovar los diferentes modelos de sus productos, atraerá más clientes, aumentara sus ventas e ingresos con los que mejorara su vida personal y cancelara las cuotas de su deuda.
Su aspiración es hacer buen uso del crédito para sacar el mayor provecho y cancelar lo más pronto posible.
texts.en:
Manuel is single, lives alone and has no one to support financially.  He has a business selling cell phones and cell phone accessories.  He has progressed little by little, and he now has his own storefront.  Manuel starts work at 7:00am  and finishes up at 5:00pm.  He learned the business as an employee, and he has been on his own for five years. 
Manuel will use the capital from the loan to purchase cell phones, cases, hands-free sets, chips, chargers, memory cards etc.  The loan will help him to renew his stock with different product models, attract more clients and increase his sales and income, with which he will improve his personal life and pay off the loan. 
Manuel's hope is to use the loan well to get the most out of it and pay off his loan as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cell phones, cases, hands-free sets, chips, chargers, memory cards etc.

loans.name: Sombon's Group

texts.en:
Aged 55 years, Sombon lives in a rural village, located in the Battambang province’s Bovel district, Cambodia. She is a married mother of four children. 

For the last 35 years, Sombon has been farming rice to make a living and she also works for others for a fee. Together, she and her husband can earn about KHR 60,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 40,000 each day for future needs. 

This is the first loan for Sombon with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. 

Sombon will use part of her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and she will use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland and she hopes to grow more rice to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Sombon's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Bovel district of Battambang province, Sombon is aged 54 years and married with four children, one of whom is still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 60,000KHR per day. 

Sombon has been with VisionFund for six cycles. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Sombon wants to use her portion to buy school materials for her kid. She hopes to make more crops, to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy school materials for her kid

loans.name: Maria Patrocinia

texts.es:
María tiene 21 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está soltera y se dedica a los oficios domésticos. 

Ella tiene 10 años de experiencia de dedicarse al trabajo de elaboración de hamacas, aprendió este trabajo gracias a sus padres que se lo enseñaron, ella durante el tiempo que le queda libre hace este trabajo para poder obtener más ingresos, el trabajo lo realiza en la casa donde trabaja de doméstica. 

El préstamo que solicita no necesita para comprar material para la elaboración de hamacas, comprará rollos de hilo de policeda y demás material que se emplea para la elaboración.

 Ella está muy decidida a seguir trabajando para ayudarle a sus padres en lo que sea necesario.
texts.en:
María is 21 years old and studied through high school. She is single and works as a domestic employee.

María also has 10 years of experience in making hammocks. She learned this trade from her parents. Whenever she has spare time at her job, she does this to generate more income. María does this work at the house where she is employed as a domestic.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy materials for making hammocks. María will buy rolls of silk thread and other materials that are used in her production. She is very dedicated and will continue working so that she can help her parents with whatever they need.

loans.use: to buy rolls of silk thread and other materials for making hammocks.

loans.name: Noern's Group

texts.en:
Noern, 50, is a married mother living in a rural village of the Bovel district of Battambang province. She has five children. She is a hard-working farmer who grows rice and raises pigs.
