Together with hard work, they can earn about 54,000KHR per day and save about 30,000KHR each day for future needs.

Noern has been with VisionFund for eight cycles. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Noern is going to use her portion to buy piglets and pig feeds. She hopes to fatten her pigs to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feeds

loans.name: Vanday's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Sangke district, Vandy is aged 26 years and married. She has one kid. To feed her family, she has worked hard as a farmer, growing rice and vegetables for several years; she also sometimes catches fish to earn more income. The current business earns her about 18,000KHR per day.

Vandy has been with VisionFund for five cycles. The past loans have helped her gradually improve her livings. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make healthy rice to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural area of the ThmorKoul district of Kampong Cham province, Sokun is 50 years old and married. To make a living, she has been working as a rice farmer. To supplement her family’s income, her husband also works as a paid worker. The current business earns her about 26,000KHR per day. 

Sokun has been with VisionFund for six cycles and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sokun wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Kimsoern

texts.en:
Kimsoern, 48, is married with three children residing in a rural village located in the Kampong Cham province’s Memot district, Cambodia. For the last 23 years, she has been farming rice and growing cassava; she can earn about 40,000KHR per day to meet the family’s need.

Kimsoern has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is applying for a loan buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her paddy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Bunna's Group

texts.en:
Bunna is aged 32 years and married with four dependent children. She lives in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district. She earns a living through growing cassava. Together, they can earn about KHR 80,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 40,000 each day for future needs.

This is Bunna’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Bunna has been a member of VisionFund for three cycles. She successfully used the loans to better her living condition. 

Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Bunna will use her portion to buy fertilizers and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to grow more rice and sell it for a good price so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies so she can help her coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her home - the roof and walls among other things.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel vive en el distrito de san juan de Lurigancho, es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo logro iniciar su negocio de venta de accesorios para celulares y computadoras, asi como también reparación de los mismos a domicilio,  en el mercado de su distrito; gracias a ello puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante.

Daniel está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar más accesorios para su negocio y de esta manera poder  atender mejor los pedidos de sus cliente y mejorar sus ventas; de esta manera podrá seguir luchando y haciendo realidad su gran sueño:” Tener otro local y crecer en su negocio”.
texts.en: Daniel lives in the district of San Juan de Lurigancho. He is a youth with a lot of desire to get ahead. with much effort he managed to open his business selling accessories for phones and computers in the district market. He also does repairs at his home. Daniel is grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to their help he can buy more accessories for his business. in this way he can better service his clients requests and increase his sales. So he can continue to strive to realize his great dream which is to have another sales point and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (phone and computer accessories) for his business.

loans.name: Leticia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Leticia, invirtió el préstamo anterior en la materia prima para elaborar diferentes tipos de pan, aumento su productividad, tiene mayor demanda de sus productos, los ingreso han mejorado un poco, su familia se encuentra viviendo en perfectas condiciones y mantiene un buen record crediticio.
Nuevamente solicita capital que le ayudara a comprar harinas, manteca, levadura, colorantes, huevos, azúcar, sal, leña, entre otros productos que son necesarios para que la panadería siga funcionando y seguir contando con la preferencia de sus clientes.
texts.en: Leticia invested her previous loan in raw materials in order to produce different types of bread.  She increased productivity and has higher demand for her products.  Her income has improved a little bit and her family is living in perfect conditions.  She maintains a good record of credit.  Currently she is requesting capital that will help her to buy flour, butter, yeast, dyes, eggs, sugar, salt, firewood, etc., among other products that are necessary for the bakery to continue operating and serving the preferences of its customers.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, yeast, dyes, eggs, sugar, salt, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of fish, crabs, shrimp, clams and other seafood.

loans.name: Tranquilina

texts.es:
Tranquilina de 67 años de edad, es ama de casa, está soltera y tiene un hijo  de 29 años, por su situación económica no logro estudiar. 

El trabajo que realiza es la agricultura, ella es de edad muy avanzada por lo tanto su hijo le ayuda, decidió dedicarse a esta actividad ya que un amigo le presta el terreno para cultivar, y le queda a 5 minutos de su casa.

El crédito para pagar a las personas que le ayudan en la siembra de maíz y comprará el abono. 

Ella espera tener fuerzas para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en: Tranquilina is 67 years old and a single housewife.  She has a 29 year old son, who was not able to study because of their economic situation.  The work that she does is in agriculture.  Since she is older now, her son helps her.  She decided to dedicate herself to this work since a friend lent her the plot of land to develop and it is 5 minutes from her house.  The loan will be used to pay the people that help her to grow the corn and also to purchase fertilizer.  She hopes to have strength to continue working.

loans.use: to pay the people that help her in planting corn, and to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Oneyda Lizeth

texts.es:
Hace 5 años, Oneyda de 35 años, se encontraba en la necesidad de aumentar los ingresos en el hogar, pues es madre soltera de dos hijas de 10 y 18 años. Un día, una idea surgió y es que la gente le pedía le vendiera ropa por encargo, ya que la mayoría siempre estaban ocupadas. Fue entonces cuando comenzó a ahorrar, hasta tener lo suficiente y colocó una tienda con el esfuerzo de su trabajo. De vez en cuando recibe ayuda del papá de sus hijas, mediante la pensión obligatoria, sin embargo no es suficiente para poder ver a sus hijas convertidas en unas profesionales. Es por esto que trabaja día a día, pues tiene su gran motivación.
Oneyda es una excelente comerciante de ropa, pues la sonrisa amable hace complemento con el buen trato a sus clientes que la han ayudado a seguir escalando. Ahorita necesita de un préstamo para comprar mercadería: camisas, pantalones, faldas, entre otros productos que le permitirán mostrar a sus clientes variedad y calidad. Con el esfuerzo y el apoyo de su mamá, sueña con que pueda tener una tienda en el centro de León, pues una de las mayormente transitadas. También espera en un futuro no muy lejano poder ofrecer la venta de zapatos de marca.
texts.en:
Oneyda, age 35, encountered the need to increase her household income five years ago. She is a single mother with two daughters, ages 10 and 18. One day she came up with the idea of accepting clothing orders since most of the people she knew were always busy. At that point, she began saving until she had sufficient funds. She was able to set up a store as a result of her work efforts. She periodically gets assistance from the father of her daughters as a result of mandatory child support payments. However, that is not enough to see that her daughters become professionals. For this reason, Oneyda works hard every day and this goal provides her a great deal of motivation.

Oneyda is good at selling clothes. A friendly smile accompanies the excellent service that she provides to her customers, which continue to increase in number. She now needs a loan so that she can buy merchandise such as shirts, trousers, skirts, and other products. This will enable her to provide both variety and quality to her customers. Through her efforts and with help from her mother, Oneyda dreams of opening a store in the center of León because it is one of the busiest areas. She also hopes in the not-so-distant future to begin selling brand-name shoes.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, skirts, and other products.

loans.name: Jose Santana

texts.es:
José tiene 66 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está casado y su esposa es maestra de educación básica.

Él es jubilado de una empresa de telefonía en la cual trabajó mas de 30 años, y durante un tiempo fue jefe departamental.

El préstamo lo utilizara específicamente para cancelar una deuda y lo demás para gastos personales y de esa forma podrá cubrir la necesidad que tiene.

Su sueño es seguir trabajando con nuestra institución y seguir siendo un cliente excelente y siempre ayudarle a su esposa.
texts.en:
José is 66 years old and has a high school education. He is married and his wife is a basic education teacher. José is retired from his job at the telephone company, where he worked for more than 30 years. During that time, he was a department head.

This loan will be used specifically to pay off a debt and other personal expenses. As a result, his outstanding needs will be met. His dream is to continue working with CrediCampo as an excellent client and to always help his wife.

loans.use: to pay off a debt and other personal expenses.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: José nuevamente esta solicicitand un crédito, por medio de kiva, para comprar una caja de hilo de seda para continuar elaborando las hamacas y comprar abono, herbicidas, pesticidas para su cultivo de maíz y frijol.
texts.en: José is asking for a new loan through Kiva to purchase a case of silk thread in order to keep weaving his hammocks. He will also buy  manure, herbicides and pesticides for his corn and bean crops.

loans.use: to purchase a case of silk thread to keep weaving hammocks, and to purchase manure, herbicides and pesticides for his corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Maritza De La Paz

texts.es:
Martiza tiene 34 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado, está acompañada y su pareja es comerciante, tiene dos hijos que viven con ella y están estudiando.

Ella es comerciante, vende productos de artesanías y bisutería, lo hace de forma ambulante en la zona donde vive desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar productos de bisutería y luego venderlo. 

Ella sueña con que su negocio crezca más y así tener más ingresos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Martiza is 34 years old. She went to school until fifth grade. She is married, and her husband is a salesman. She has two children who live with her and are going to school.

She is a salesperson; she sells artisan crafts and costume jewelry. She does traveling sales in the area where she lives, working from 6 am to 2 pm.

She needs the loan to purchase more costume jewelry and later sell it.

She dreams of growing her business more so she will have more household income.

loans.use: to purchase costume jewelry and later sell it.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen, 40, lives with her six children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son drives an auto rickshaw and pays a daily fare because the rickshaw does not belong to him. He is considered ultra poor and has been feeding his children alone. Shaheen had been saving for many days to buy him a new rickshaw but, at the time of purchasing it, she was short of money. 

Shaheen has requested a loan for her son to buy a new rickshaw with this contribution of savings. She hopes now her son won't have any need to pay a daily fare, which has caused him to earn a low income. He hopes that he will be able to generate more income because he will not have to pay a daily fare to anyone. 

Shaheen is very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, a serger, a table, an iron and fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming supplies to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Fredy David

texts.es:
Fredy, cada día tiene mayor demanda de sus servicios y el material con que cuenta no es suficiente para  cumplir con rapidez sus pedidos; por lo que se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de tubos, láminas, hierro y pintura, así cumplirá con el compromiso adquirido.
Actualmente Fredy tiene un taller de estructuras metálicas mejor equipado lo cual es posible por la buena inversión del crédito anterior, las ganancias las utiliza para ofrecer mejor estilo de vida a su familia cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en: Fredy has a growing demand for his services and he doesn't have enough stock material to fulfill his customers' orders quickly. This is why he has decided to get a new loan, to invest in the purchase of pipes, metal sheeting, iron and paint, so he can fulfill his commitments. Fredy now has a better equipped workshop for building metallic structures, which was made possible thanks to the good investment of his previous loan. He is using the profits to offer better quality of life to his family and to cancel debts.

loans.use: to buy pipes, metal sheeting, iron and paint.

loans.name: Oveider Manuel

texts.es:
Con apenas 29 años, Oveider ha logrado recoger muy buenos frutos producto de su trabajo duro y buena gestión a la hora de manejar su empresa.
El esta de dicado al 100% en una salsamentaría y tienda de abarrotes que está ubicada en zona rural del municipio de Planeta Rica, Córdoba. Trabaja todos los días de 7:00Am a 7:00Pm y los fines de semana se extiende hasta más tarde dependiendo de su clientela.
Él ofrece productos de la canasta familiar, carnes, granos, bebidas, licores, frituras, entre otros. Y con la ayuda de su hermana han logrado consolidar un buen negocio.
Con el afán de buscar más y mejores ingresos, solicita un préstamo para abastecer su bodega con una amplia cantidad de productos comprándolos al por mayor, de esta forma podrá vender con mejores precios a sus clientes afianzando una buena relación económica con ellos y haciendo que aumenten sus ventas.
texts.en:
At only 29 years of age, Oveider has been able to witness the good outcomes resulting from his hard work and the excellent management of his business. He is 100% committed to his delicatessen and grocery store, which are located in a rural section of the town of Planeta Rica, Córdoba. Oveider works every day from 7:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. On the weekends, he extends his hours depending on his customers.

Oveider offers household products such as meat, grains, beverages, liquor, snacks, and other products. With the help of his sister, he has been able to consolidate a successful business. In an effort to generate more income, Oveider is requesting a loan so that he can restock his store with an increased number of products that he will buy in bulk. This will allow him to sell at better prices to his customers, thus forming a good business relationship with them and increasing his sales.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of household products so that he can restock his inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to remodel her house, painting it, fixing the electrical connections and installing running water.

loans.name: Pach's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Pach is 38 years old and single. She earns a living through farming rice and growing cassava. She can earn about KHR 24,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 15,000 each day for future needs. 

This is the third loan for Pach, and she successfully repaid the loans with VisionFund. The loans from VisionFund have helped her better support her family. 

Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Pach wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Jose Wilfredo

texts.es:
José tiene 35 años de edad, es un hombre muy responsable dedicado a su familia y trabajador, desde niño ayudaba a su padre con la siembra de granos básicos y también aprendió el oficio de albañil, labores que hoy en día desempeña y obtiene ingresos para sostener a su familia, está casado y es padre de un niño de 5 años, José trabaja desde las 5:00 am hasta las 6:00 pm él se transporta siempre en una bicicleta para ir del cantón a la ciudad y estar puntual en su trabajo.


 El crédito lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas, como herbicidas y abono.

El sueño de José es poder construir una casa para su familia con un espacio amplio.
texts.en:
Jose, 35, is a responsible man, dedicated to his family and hard-working. He helped his father to sow basic grains from an early age, and he also learned how to work as a construction worker. Nowadays he works in both trades and he obtains the income to support his family. He is married and has a 5-year-old son. Jose works from 5 a.m. to 6 p.m. He travels by bike from his rural community to the city and he gets to work on time.
Jose needs the loan in order to purchase farming supplies such as herbicides and manure.
His dream is to build a spacious house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies such as herbicide and manure.

loans.name: Lor

texts.en:
Lor is 43 years old and lives with his family in a rural village located in the Battambang province. He is married with four children. For three years, he has been selling ice cream and sugarcane juice to make a living. 

Lor has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now he is applying for a loan to buy a cart to help his business. He hopes this loan will enable him to earn more income from his business.

loans.use: to buy a cart to help his business

loans.name: Min's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in the Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district, Min is age 40 years and married with four children. 

For the last 20 years, she has been farming rice to support her family. With the current business, she can earn about KHR 48,000 per day and can save about KHR 20,000 each day for future needs.

Min has been with VisionFund for one cycle, and completely paid back the past loan. 

As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. 

She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Angela Jimenez

texts.es:
Ángela de 54 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 2 hijos, ella tiene 15 años de experiencia en realizar la actividad de venta de ropa y realización de los oficios domésticos, esta actividad  la aprendió de su abuela y le inculcó buenos principios a Ángela, sus dos hijos le ayudan con el trabajo mientras no están en la escuela. 

El crédito lo necesita para mejorar su negocio de venta de ropa, comprará nuevos productos como calzados y bolsos para ponerlos a la venta, de esta manera dará un mejor servicio a sus clientes y tendrá un aumento en las ganancias económicas de su negocio.


Sus planes a futuro son apoyar en la educación de su hijo hasta que sean unos profesionales de éxito.
texts.en:
Ángela, 54 years old, is widowed and has two children. She has 15 years of experience selling clothes and doing housework. She learned this trade from her grandmother, who taught Angela good morals. Her two children help her with the work when they are not in school.

She needs the loan to improve her clothing sales business. She will buy new products, such as shoes and purses, to later put up for sale. In this way, she will better serve her customers and augment her business' earnings.

Her plans for the future are to support her children's education so they can be successful professionals.

loans.use: to improve her clothing sales business. She will purchase new products, such as shoes and purses, in order to put them up for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To  pay for his son's school fees.

loans.name: Harmony Group

texts.en:
Memory is a hardworking lady aged 42. She is a widow, her husband died in 2009, and she was left with 2 children. She is to the extreme left of the picture. She managed to survive doing her small business of selling fruits and vegetables along the Machipisa road in Harare. 
She has accessed loans twice from Thrive Microfinance together with her friends from the Harmony group. She is one of the group members who benefited from the previous loan. Her stall improved in terms of stock levels and her quality of life has also improved in terms of putting nutritious meals on the table for her family consistently. 
They want to borrow $1,600 together as Harmony group and she wants to use her portion to develop her stall by adding groceries to her stock. She is hoping the benefits from this loan will enable her to pay exam fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy groceries for resale.

loans.name: Savorn's Group

texts.en:
A 54-year-old mother of three children, Savorn resides in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Bovel district, Cambodia. To support her living, she has been farming rice and working for others for a fee. Together, they can earn about KHR 30,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR14,000 each day for future needs. 
 
This is the second loan for Savorn with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. 

Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan; Savorn wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two doors and install them in her home.

loans.name: Raksmey's Group

texts.en: Raksmey’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Raksmey makes a living cultivating rice, selling groceries and he also does extra work as a farm laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis tiene 27 años de edad, está soltero y no tiene hijos, actualmente trabaja y a la vez estudia administración de empresas, él vive en casa familiar.

Este joven es empleado en una gasolinera la cual es un negocio familiar, él administra el establecimiento y a los empleados, ya tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro. 

El préstamo lo utilizará específicamente para pagar una deuda que tiene pendiente. 

El sueño de Luis es sacar sus estudios y ser un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Luis is 27 years old, single, and has no children. He is currently working and studying Business Administration. Luis lives at home.

This young man is employed at a gas station that is owned by a relative. He manages the establishment and supervises the employees. Luis has been at this job for many years.

This loan will be used specifically to pay off an outstanding debt. Luis dreams of completing his studies and becoming a successful professional.

loans.use: to pay off an outstanding debt.

loans.name: Santos Cristina

texts.es:
Santos tiene 33 años de edad, es una mujer muy luchadora, tuvo que abandonar sus estudios cuando estaba cursando 6to grado. Desde entonces ha dedicado su vida a ofrecer sus servicios como ayudante en comedores, actualmente ella vive con sus padres, sus hijos estudian a 4 kilómetros de distancia desde su casa. Santos tiene que levantarse   temprano para irse a trabajar y regresa a su casa hasta las 5:00 pm.

Santos se ha dedicado a ofrecer sus servicios en comedores y restaurantes desde hace 5 años, pues siendo madre soltera tiene que luchar para poder pagarles el estudio a sus hijos, así también apoyar en los gastos del hogar y los gastos agrícolas de su padre quien se dedica a trabajar fuertemente en el campo.
Ella necesita el crédito para comprar los insumos agrícolas que utilizará su padre en la producción de granos básicos, pues es de la actividad que obtiene los alimentos para su familia.

En un futuro ella quiere establecer un negocio en donde pueda vender comida, para poder apoyar a sus hijos y a su padre quien con la edad cada vez está más cansado. Su sueño es poder ver a sus hijos graduarse y poder pagarles una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Santos, 33, is a striving woman who had to quit her studies when she was in 6th grade. Since then she has dedicated her life to working as a dining room assistant. She lives with her parents. Her children study 4 km away from home. Santos has to get up early to go to work and she returns at 5:00 pm.
She has offered her services at dining rooms and restaurants for 5 years because being a single mother, she struggles to pay her children's studies and to contribute to the household expenses and her father's farming expenses. Her father works hard as a farmer. 
Santos needs the loan to buy the farming supplies that her father will use in the production of basic grains, because this is the activity from which the family gets food.
In the future, Santos wants to establish a business where she can sell food so she can support her children and her father, who gets more tired as he ages. Her dream is to see her children graduate and to be able to pay their university studies.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies which her father will use to grow basic grains.

loans.name: Yoern's Group

texts.en:
Yoern is age 53 and married. She is a mother of five children. 

To make a living, she and her husband have been farming and supplement their family’s income by working for others for a fee. Have been in this business for 35 years, Yoern can earn about 30,000 KHR per day. 

Yoern has been with VisionFund for one cycle. 

Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. 

She hopes to make more income from her paddy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Loek's Group

texts.en: Loek’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Loek makes a living cultivating rice  and her husband also does extra work as construction laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sovanra's Group

texts.en: Sovanra’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sovanra makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a construction laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Edzel

texts.en:
Edzel is 54 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.

Edzel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Edzel has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns additional income from food vending.

Edzel aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 56 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Elena's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Elena has taken a PHP 5,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Elena is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, would like to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 23 years old and has one child.

She and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Maricel is taking out a housing loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

She has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. 

With your help, Maricel can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Mauricio Alfredo

texts.es:
Mauricio tiene 48 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador quien ha dedicado su vida a la agricultura, todo esto para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, de los cuales uno de ellos es mayor de edad. Actualmente a sus hijos se los cuida su hermana quien les prepara la comida, y hace otras actividades domésticas, ya que por circunstancias ajenas su madre tuvo que dejarlos, quedando ellos solo con su padre.
En las actividades agrícolas lo apoyan sus hijos en su tiempo libre, así también se ha dedicado a la  crianza de gallinas y su hermana lo apoya.
El crédito lo utilizara para comprar insumos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Mauricio is 48 years old. He is a hardworking man who has dedicated his life to agriculture, all of this to give his children a better quality of life, one of which is older. Currently his sister takes care of his children. She prepares their food and does other domestic activities, as due to external circumstances their mother had to leave them, leaving them with only their father. 

In their free time his children help him with his farming tasks so he has also dedicated himself to the raising of chickens, and his sister supports him. He will use this loan to buy farming supplies.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Zoila Esperanza

texts.es:
Zoila tiene 38 años de edad, estudió hasta séptimo grado, actualmente es madre soltera de un hijo que vive con ella.

En ocasiones Zoila se dedica a la venta de “alborotos” entre otros productos, pero su negocio principal es la venta de cerdos y venta de algunos productos lácteos, fue la necesidad la que la llevó a dedicarse a estas actividades, y trabaja durante todo el día.

El crédito lo necesita para ampliar el negocio de venta de productos lácteos.

Su sueño es que el negocio siga creciendo y apoyar a su hijo en todo lo que sea necesario ya que no tiene el apoyo del padre.
texts.en:
Zoila is 38 years old, and she has studied until the seventh grade. She is a single mother of one child who lives with her.  

On occasions, Zoila sells groceries and similar items, but her principal business is selling pigs and some dairy products. Necessity led her to devote herself to these occupations, and she works all day. 

She needs the loan in order to expand her dairy products business. Her dream is that the business may continue to grow and that she may support her child in whatever way may be necessary, as she no longer has the father’s support.

loans.use: to expand her dairy products business.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
María es madre de tres hijos y está acompañada, su pareja trabaja en una granja cuidando cerdos mientras ella atiende su negocio, la familia se levanta muy temprano, ella hace el desayuno, el oficio y lleva a sus hijos a la escuela.

María atiende  su pequeña tienda en su casa, ella vende golosinas, granos básicos, refrescos, productos básicos del hogar, entre otros. Ella tiene cuatro años de  administrar su tienda que le genera buenas ganancias, pero además de vender en su casa, los fines de semana lleva a vender enchiladas, tostadas de plátano, agua en bolsa, refrescos a  la cancha de fútbol  del cantón, aprovechando  que la gente se acerca a ver los partidos de futbol los días domingos.

El préstamo lo necesita para invertir en su negocio para comprar productos nuevos, ella quiere abastecer más el negocio con otros productos como sorbetes y paletas.

Su sueño es poner en su negocio una mini farmacia y una mini librería que pueda abastecer con productos donde pueda cubrir las necesidades de las familias vecinas y eso le generaría mas ingresos para en un futuro pagarle la universidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is the mother of three children and lives in a common-law relationship.  Her partner works on a farm caring for pigs while she runs her business. The family gets up very early. She makes breakfast, does her job and takes her children to school.

María runs her small store in her house. She sells sweets, basic grains, soft drinks and basic household goods, among other items. She has been managing her store for four years and it generates a good profit. Moreover, in addition to selling goods at home, on the weekends she takes enchiladas, roasted banana, water and soft drinks to sell at the soccer field in the canton, taking advantage of the fact that people go to watch the soccer teams on Sundays.

She needs the loan to invest in her business and purchase new products. She wants to add more items to her inventory, such as sorbets and popsicles.

Her dream is to install a mini-pharmacy in her business and also a mini-bookstore that she can stock with products, which  would meet the needs of neighboring families. This would generate more income so that in the future she would be able to send her children to the university.

loans.use: to invest in her business and purchase new products to add to her inventory, such as sorbets and popsicles.

loans.name: Thach

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Thach is 60 years old and married. She and her husband have four children. She and her husband have earned a living through farming rice for 27 years. She supplements her income by working as a garment worker. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately 27,000 KHR per day to support her family.
 
Thach has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is asking for a new loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru:
Чамшед трудолюбивый и жизнерадостный парень. Он является самым старшим сыном в  своей семье. Живёт он с мамой, потому что его отец умер несколько лет назад. Чамшед работает плотником уже боле 5 лет, у него очень хороший опыт по строению и ремонту домов. Этим делом он зарабатывает себе на жизнь и помогает своей маме. 

Чамшеда в ближайшее время собирается жениться, так как пришло время создавать семью. Сейчас он вместе со своей мамой готовится к данному мероприятию. Ему необходимо купить много вещей для своего приданного,  также мебель в новую квартиру и бытовые принадлежности. Поэтому Чамшед решил обратиться в Арванд, когда узнал о программе Кива, и хочет получить кредит на покупку приданного для своей свадьбы. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и очень надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en:
Jamshed is a hardworking, cheerful man.  He is the oldest son in his family and only lives with his mother these days as his father died a few years ago.  He has been working as a carpenter for more than 5 years, and has a lot of experience building and renovating peoples' homes.  By doing this work, he not only earns his own keep, but helps support his mother as well.

Jamshed is preparing to get married soon as he feels it's time to start a family of his own.  His mother is helping him with the preparations; he needs to buy a number of things for a wedding dowry, as well as furniture and appliances for a new apartment.  He recently found out about Kiva and has decided to seek a loan through Arvand to pay for his wedding dowry.  He is hoping for a positive outcome, and would like to thank Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: pay for his wedding dowry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Dilbarshan

texts.ru: Дилбаршан женщина с умелыми руками. Она опытная портниха. Дилбаршан более 35 лет занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Она работает в ателье и имеет своих регулярных клиентов. Она шьет и женские и мужские одежды. Ее клиенты довольны ее работой. Дилбаршан является основной кормилицей семьи, так как ее муж Мирзоали имеет маленькую зарплату. Она старается обеспечить своих 3 детей со всеми необходимыми средствами. Она хочет купить новую швейную машинку и с такой целью она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Dilbarshan is a woman with skillful hands. She is an experienced seamstress. Dilbarshan has offered her sewing services for more than 35 years. She works in a dress-making shop and has her own loyal customers. She sews women's and men's clothing. Her customers are pleased with her work. Dilbarshan is the primary breadwinner in her family, as her husband Mirzoali has a small salary. She strives to provide her three children with all of the necessities. She wants to buy a new sewing machine, which is why she is requesting a loan for 3000 somoni. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Mahfiratkhon

texts.ru: Махфиратхон в своей жизни пережила много трудностей. Первый брак у нее был неудачным и поэтому она развелась. Махфиратхон сама обеспечивала своего сына после развода. Она вначале помогала своей сестре купле продажей продуктов питания. Постепенно она начала свой бизнес. Она более 15 лет занимается переработкой и продажей сухофруктов. Махфиратхон покупает абрикосы, перерабатывает их и продает на местном рынке как курага. Махфиратхон сама продает готовую продукцию на местном рынке. Ее муж помогает ей введению бизнеса. Она во второй раз вышла замуж и теперь счастлива. Она имеет 2 сыновей. Махфиратхон хочет  развевать свой бизнес. С такой целью она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки абрикосов. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mahfiratkhon has lived through many difficulties in her life. Her first marriage was an unhappy one which is why she got divorced. Mahfiratkhon raised her son by herself after her divorce. At first, she helped her sister buy and sell food products. Gradually, she started her own business. For more than 15 years, she has processed and sold dried fruits. Mahfiratkhon buys apricots, processes them and then sells them at the local market as dried, pitted apricot halves. Mahfiratkhon sells the final product herself at the local market. Her husband helps her run this business. She got remarried and now is very happy. She has two sons. Mahfiratkhon wants to develop her business. For this purpose, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 somoni to buy apricots. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy apricots to turn into dried fruit.

loans.name: Edwin Orlando

texts.es: El señor Edwin habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe en la comarca llamado Los Madrigales Nortes, junto a su compañera de Vida quienes tienen 3 hijos en edades escolares, el labora para una empresa privada desde hace ocho años, su esposa se dedica a trabajar como domestica, el solicita el crédito para la compra de Materiales de Construcción como Cemento, Arena, Piedrin, Azulejos. ya que el construirá el Pantri en la cocina ya que desea ir mejorando la vivienda poco a poco. Agradece el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado.
texts.en: Señor Edwin lives in the Los Madrigales North district of the municipality of Ticuantepe with his wife and their three children, who are all in school. Señor Edwin has worked for a private company for eight years, and his wife works as a cleaner. He hopes to gradually improve his home, and is building a pantry for the kitchen. Señor Edwin is applying for a loan to purchase construction materials, such as cement, sand, and gravel, and is grateful to Kiva and Afodenic for their support.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 30 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Liza's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Liza has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Liza has taken a PHP 5,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan purchase for building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Liza is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 7,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help Emelita will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Emelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 60 years old and married.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Josefina is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Josefina has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. 

With your help, Josefina can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future she would like to save enough to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 5,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help Felomina will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 42 years old and married with seven children. With three children in school, Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Elizabeth  has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Elizabeth has taken a PHP 9,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan purchase for building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Elizabeth is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 56 years old, widowed, and has three children. 

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Letecia is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 4,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.  

Letecia has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. 

With your help, Letecia can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her business of selling fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Gabriel Arturo

texts.es:
Gabriel tiene 39 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales algunos estudian, otros trabajan y tiene un recién nacido.

Gabriel tiene un taller mecánico ubicado en el cantón, tiene 18 años de dedicarse a esta labor, fue aprendiendo a reparar vehículos desde los 15 años, ya que al principio trabajó como ayudante de un taller.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar una maquina desmoldarora de llantas.

Sus planes a futuro son abrir un nuevo negocio frente a la gasolinera que está ubicada cerca de su casa.
texts.en:
Gabriel is 39 years old. He went to the school through the ninth grade. He is married and his spouse is a housewife. He has 5 children and some of them are in school, other work, and he has a newborn.

Gabriel has a mechanics shop located in his canton. He has been doing this work for 18 years. He started to learn about repairing vehicles when he was 15. At first, he was an assistant in a shop. 

He needs the loan to buy a tire changer. His plans for the future are to open a new business that is located close to his house.

loans.use: to buy tire changer.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara tiene 30 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, está casada y su esposo trabaja en una gasolinera, tiene dos hijos en las edades de 3 y 2 años y aún no asisten a la escuela, por lo cual son los únicos que dependen de Sara. 

Sara se dedica a la venta de ropa, lo hace casa por casa en las comunidades cercanas, ella decidió dedicarse a vender ya que una amiga lo realizaba y a ella le pareció una buena forma de negocio que le ayudaría mejorar sus ingresos, tiene tres años de estar realizando las ventas, además parte de los ingresos de la familia provienen también de su esposo que labora para una gasolinera, el horario en el cual ella visita las comunidades es por la mañana.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar un vehículo ya que ella con su esposo han ahorrado una parte del dinero para comprarlo y esto les permitirá movilizarse mejor al lugar donde compran su mercadería.  

Su sueño es seguir adelante con el negocio y darle una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sara is 30 years old. She studied until the third grade. She is married and her husband works in a gasoline station. She has two children, 3 and 2 years of age, who do not yet attend school. Consequently, they are the only ones who depend on Sara.

Sara sells clothing house to house in communities nearby. She decided to start this business because a friend did so and it seemed to her a good kind of business that would help to improve her income. She has been making sales for three years. In addition, part of the family’s income also comes from her husband, who works at a gasoline station.  Her schedule of visiting communities is during the morning.

She needs the loan to purchase a car since she and her husband have saved part of the money to purchase it. This would enable them to travel better to the place where they buy her merchandise.

Her dream is to continue moving her business ahead and to give her children a better life.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle.

loans.name: Jose Concepcion

texts.es:
José tiene 50 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, solamente estudió hasta noveno grado, está acompañado y tiene tres hijos.

José tiene varias actividades económicas, como lo son una tienda, un molino y también realiza trabajos de albañilería desde hace varios años, en la tienda su esposa se encarga de administrarla,  muchas veces también sus hijos ya que él se dedica a las otras actividades económicas y trabaja todo el día. 

El crédito lo invertirá para comprar mercadería para el negocio ya que la zona donde él vive hay personas que necesitan comprar determinado producto y no lo encuentran hasta que van a tiendas más lejanas por eso el aprovechará esa oportunidad de negocio para tener bien surtida su tienda y la gente pueda comprar rápido y fácil. 

Sueña con mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia  y  seguir ampliando el negocio trabajando fuertemente  y administrando muy bien el crédito y las inversiones.
texts.en:
José is 50 years old. He is a hardworking person and only went to school up to the ninth grade. He is married and has three children. 

José has several economic activities, such as a store, a mill and also bricklaying, which he has done for several years. His wife is in charge of running the store. A lot of times, his children also help, since he works at other activities and he works all day long.  

He will invest in buying merchandise for the business, since in the area he lives in there are people who need to buy certain products and they don't find it so they go to far away stores. That is why he will take advantage of this business opportunity to keep his business well stocked so people can shop quickly and easily.  

He dreams of improving his family's quality of life and keep expanding his business and managing it very well with the loan and investments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Suha Criter Group

texts.en:
This group is called Suha Criter. It consists of three women. They all live in traditional and simple families in Aden, Yemen. They know one another through friendship and neighbourhood connections. They applied for a loan of 90,000 YER from AMB.
 
Suha is a 28-year-old married woman. She is the leader of the group. Suha lives with her family in their own house. She is an educated woman and studied up to secondary education. She is very dynamic and energetic. 

Suha lives with her father and the rest of the family in their own house, but it is very small and most of it is not renovated from the inside. As a result, Suha is requesting a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks in order to build other rooms and make the house spacious. 

Suha's dream in the future is building more than one floor and renovating them.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks in order to build other rooms and make the house spacious.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana es asalariada obtiene sus ingresos de su labor como despachadora de productos farmacéuticos, tiene que viajar diariamente donde su suegra a dejar y traer a su hija durante sus horas laborales, por ser madre soltera y no tiene con quien dejar su hija en su casa.  solicita este crédito para comprar cemento, arena, piedrin y hierro para construcción de un pozo en su vivienda ya que el agua es escasa y es de vital importancia en la vida cotidiana.  Su mayor propósito es darle lo mejora a su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Ana is a salaried worker, earning her income from her job delivering pharmaceutical products.  She has to travel to her mother-in-law’s daily, in order to drop off her daughter during her working hours, as she is a single mother and has no one at home with whom she can leave her daughter.

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase cement, sand, gravel, and iron, for the construction of a well in her home, as water is scarce, and is vitally important for daily life. Her biggest goal is to give the best to her little daughter.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for digging a well.

loans.name: Rohila

texts.ru:
Рохила 42-летняя жительница района Гиссар. Она работает швеей уже 8 лет, а муж работает детским врачом в центральной больнице столицы. У них трое сыновей. Все они еще учатся. Средний сын Рохилы учится в 9-ом классе таджикско-турецкого лицей-интерната. Он способный ученик и любит предмет математики, физики и английского языка. В будущем он хочет поступить в ВУЗ и уже сейчас учится усердно. 
Сейчас Рохиле и ее мужу необходимо оплатить за годовое обучение сына в лицей-интернате, а также оплатить за общежитие. Их собственного сбережения не хватает для этой цели, поэтому Рохила обратилась за кредитом в организацию "Хумо", где предлагают кредит на образование по низким процентным ставкам. Этот кредит ей очень важен. Благодаря данному кредиту ее сын сможет продолжить учебу в лицее.
texts.en:
Rohila is a 42-year-old resident of the Gissar District. She has worked as a seamstress for 8 years already. Her husband is a pediatrician in the capital city's central hospital. They have three sons. All of them are already in school. Rohila's middle son is in the 9th grade at the Tajik-Turkish Lyceum Boarding School. He is a clever student and loves the subjects of math, physics and English language. In the future, he wants to enroll in university and is already studying very hard so he can do so.

Now Rohila and her husband must pay for her son's tuition at his lyceum boarding school as well as for his dormitory. Their personal savings are not enough for this purpose which is why Rohila applied for a loan from the "Humo" organization. "Humo" offers loans for education at a low interest rate. This loan is very important to her. Thanks to this loan, her son will be able to continue his studies at the lyceum.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition at a lyceum boarding school as well as his dormitory costs.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 8,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help Christina will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Christina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
Lorenza is 61 years old, widowed, and has four children. 

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Lorenza is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 6,500 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Lorenza has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Lorenza can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future she would like to save enough to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 48 years old and has five children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Elsie and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Elsie is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 7,500 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Elsie has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. 

With your help, Elsie can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to save enough to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

texts.en:

Melinda's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Melinda has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Melinda has taken a PHP 6,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Melinda is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

With your help, Maribel can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Marydel

texts.en:
Marydel is 56 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marydel's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Marydel has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Marydel has taken a PHP 7,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Marydel is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Mohammed. He is a married man with five children, living with his family in Sana'a, Yemen. Mohammed has a university education. Unfortunately, he couldn't find a job to look after his family.

In 2010, Mohammed started his own business through opening a phones and accessories store. He decided to begin this business because he realized that it would be profitable due to a new settlement area. His business is located in a good area of town and his main customers are the public. He works 6 days a week and 12 hours a day and gets support every month. 

Recently, Mohammed has earned good profits. Unfortunately, most of what he earns goes to the expenses of the family. On the other hand, Mohammed wants to enlarge his business. As a result, Mohammed applied for a loan of 150,000 YER to buy more phones rechargers in order to strengthen his business. He hopes that this loan will increase his stock, result in more customers, and earn a higher profit.

In the future, Mohammed plans to get a bigger store to supply larger quantities of goods. He thanks you for your first support.

loans.use: to buy more phones rechargers in order to strengthen his business

loans.name: Ramah 26 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Ramah 26. It is comprised of seven women from Taiz, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 330,000 YER from AMB.

Inas is the leader of the group. She is a 35-year-old married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 14 years old, and the youngest one is a year and a half old.  She lives with them in their own house in Taiz.  She works as a housewife and she is a very dynamic woman. Her husband immigrated to Saudi Arabia. He left home many years ago in order to improve the condition of his family. Recently, he received a good amount of money from his business there. He sends money to his family monthly, but the money is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family.  Inas's house needs to be renovated from the inside. Most of the rooms are not renovated in addition to the kitchen and the bathroom. This affects Inas negatively, and she feels ashamed especially if any gusts or visitors come to her house. For this reason, Inas applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase cement to renovate the house from the inside.

Inas hopes to renovate her whole house and rent it in order to improve the living standards of her family. She hopes to open a saving account in AMB for her children.

loans.use: to purchase cement to renovate her house from the inside.

loans.name: Al- Hanan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Hanan. It consists of four hardworking women from Aden, Yemen. They have requested a group loan of 180,000 YER from AMB, and they will hold each other accountable for the loan repayment.

Shaklia is a very active woman from a poor family. She is 35 years old and a mother of five children. She is the leader of the group. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. Over time, he became unable to look after his family. Shaklia wanted to help him in this responsibility. She started selling women's clothes as a door to door, using a small amount of capital, five years ago. Her income from this business is very low, and she wanted to improve it. 

Most of what Shaklia earns goes towards the expenses of her family. On the other hand, she wants to improve her business. For this reason, she asked for a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more women's clothes for resale to her customers.

Shaklia looks forward to expanding her business further through opening a small store selling women clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more women's clothes for resale to her customers.

loans.name: Martha Angélica

texts.es:
La joven Martha Angélica, es madre soltera de un hijo, es promotora social en una de las instituciones de la ciudad de León, se dedica a esta desde hace dos año, inicia sus labores a las 8:00 am y finalizándolas a las 5:00 pm de lunes a viernes en este mismo horario, ella realiza esta labor para la mantención del hogar, de su hijo y su mamá.

La joven Martha Angélica,  se acercó a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito el que utilizo  para gastos médicos como son exámenes especiales, los cuales le permitirán recuperar la salud de su querida y amada madre.
texts.en:
Martha Angélica, a young woman, is a single mother of one child. She is a social promoter of one of the institutions in the city of León.  She has had this job for two years. She starts her work at 8 a.m. and ends it at 5 p.m. from Monday to Friday. She does this work in order to support the household, her son and her mother.

Young Martha Angélica came to Ceprodel to request a loan, which she will use for medical expenses. Her beloved mother needs special examinations in order to recover her health.

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses (Special  Examinations).

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Shiela would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 49 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Elenita works very hard to provide for them.

Elenita's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Elenita has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Elenita has taken a PHP 6,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Elenita is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Diocelyn

texts.en:
Diocelyn is 36 years old and has four children.  Diocelyn is married and all four children are in school.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Diocelyn is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Diocelyn has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Diocelyn can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Erenea

texts.en:
Erenea is 59 years old and has three children.    She is widowed  and has  children who are in school. She and her family  survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

She  is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 7,500 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.  

Erenea  has been an NWTF borrower since 2012.  With your help, Erenea can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future,  she  would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy construction materials to complete the building of her house.

loans.name: Saboha 22 Mayo Group

texts.en:
This group is called Saboha 22 Mayo. It comprises five women who live in Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 270,000 YER from AMB.

Sabah is 25 years old and married, with three children.  Sabah is uneducated woman, but she is very active and dynamic. She is a talented and respected professional woman. She has a great determination and doesn't surrender easily to the obstacles and problems. As a result, she started her own business selling groceries and goods in a small shop in her area. 

As the source of income for her family, Sabah has sold groceries and food products for many years. She started this business with a small amount of capital. Thanks to Sabah's hard work, she has been able to develop and expand her merchandise. The profits from this business have allowed her to expand her sales volume. 

For the purpose of further developing in her business, Sabah turned to Al-Amal Microfinance Bank. She is requesting a loan of 70,000 YER to buy more  goods and items for the grocery in order to meet all the demands of her customers.

Sabah plans to invest the earnings from the loan to further increase her business. She hopes to provide her children with a secure future.

loans.use: to buy more goods and items for the grocery in order to meet all the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine instead of the first one in order to increase her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy equipment for making dough, as well as flour and coal for his bakery.

loans.name: Virgen De Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen de las Mercedes está en su ciclo 20, es un grupo muy antiguo que está luchando cada día para poder crecer y salir adelante. Las mismas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras, emprendedoras que están luchando por dar a sus familias todo lo que no pudieron tener.
Liz es una de las integrantes, ella es vendedora, y comenta que tiene una despensa bien surtida en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano, ya que tiene mucha clientela. Al principio empezó con muy poco, pero poco a poco se fue afianzando y hoy ya tiene muy buena clientela.
Pide este préstamo ya que quiere poder surtir su despensa con todo tipo de productos para poder dar a sus clientes lo que piden. Quiere comprar azúcar, fideos, carne, leche, panificados, arroz, bebidas, aceite, etc. Todas están agradecidas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo y que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group “Virgen de las Mercedes” is on their 20th loan cycle. The group started a long time ago and the members strive every day to grow and get ahead in life. The members are known in the area as very hard-working and enterprising women who strive to give their families everything they were not able to have. 

Liz is one of the members. She is a vendor, and she says that she has a well-stocked grocery store. She works every day from very early in the morning as she has many customers. At the start, she began with very little, but she has been getting her business established little by little and now she has a very good customer base. 

She is asking for this loan because she wants to be able to restock her grocery store with all sorts of products in order to be able to give her clients what they order. She wants to buy sugar, noodles, meat, milk, bread products, rice, drinks, oil, and other products. All of the members are grateful for the opportunity they are receiving, which will be of great help to them.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, meat, milk, bread products, rice, drinks, oil, and other items to sell

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: El señor Víctor, hombre trabajador quien siempre esta buscando la mejora en sus hogar, en compañía de su esposa quien trabaja como domestica para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar, el quiere construcción el muro en la parte de enfrente de sus casa para mayor seguridad, el crédito lo solicita para comprar, Arena, Cemento, Piedras, Hierro, etc. el se muestra muy contento y agradecido con Kiva y Afodenic por la confianza que le han dado ya que con los créditos anteriores ha mejorado su vivienda.
texts.en:
Victor is a hardworking man who is always looking to improve his home. Together with his wife, who works as a housekeeper in order to help him with household expenses, he wants to build a wall in the front of his house for greater security.

He is requesting a loan to buy sand, cement, rocks, iron, etc. He is very happy and grateful for the trust that Kiva and AFODENIC have given him, since with the previous loans he improved his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Shakora Group

texts.en:
The Shakora group consists of three hardworking women from Aden, Yemen. They have requested a group loan of 140,000 YER from AMB and will hold each other accountable for the loan repayment.

Safia is a very active woman from a poor family. She is 61 years old and a mother of five children. Her oldest child is 38 years old and the youngest one is 20 years old. She lives with her family in their own house. 

She is the leader of the group. Safia wanted to improve the condition of her family. She has worked for four years selling women's clothes with a amount of small capital from other people, who decided to help her  improve the condition of her family.

 Her income from this business was very low, and she wanted to improve it. For this reason, she asked for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to increase her income through purchasing more women's clothes for resale to the customers in her area.

Safia looks forward to expanding her business more. She hopes to save a lot of money in order to renovate her house, so she is waiting for your support. She is a very grateful and kind woman.

loans.use: increase her income through purchasing more women's clothes for resale to the customers in her area.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothing)

loans.name: Samand

texts.en: Samand is a 42 year old man who has been in the sheep breeding business for 15 years. He is married with two children. Both of his children are teenagers and they are going to secondary school. Samand’s wife does not work but she helps her husband in their family business.  Samand is an IDP (internally displaced person) from his home which was in Füzuli city, now he is living with his lovely family in the Alixanli village of Fuzuli region. Today he needs a loan to support his business development in amount of 1500-Azerbaijan New Manat. With this amount Samand wants to buy a few lambs and raise them to sell. For aid and help Samand says he is thankful to Kiva organization. In the future he wants to build a new stall for his animals.

loans.use: to buy a few lambs to raise and sell

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en: Evelyne studied professional cooking and baking at a vocational school and had dreams of opening her own restaurant. Therefore in 2008, she opened Molyne Restaurant to serve the population of Clercine. Business was going well, but after the earthquake she had to move. Thanks to support received through Zafen, the re-launch phase was a success. She bought some kitchen equipment which helped satisfy her demand. Her take out restaurant has had a strong office staff clientele who always ask to be able to dine in at her location. Therefore, Evelyne is in the need of a freezer, folding chairs, and tables to prepare a cozy place for customers to sit and enjoy the meal. This new request will help buy new equipment to enhance the space as well as the quality of service.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, chairs, and tables and to renovate the restaurant.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está en su octavo ciclo, donde todas y cada una de ellas está creciendo por salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias. Todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, lo que les permitirá seguir luchando y creciendo por mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Graciela, una persona muy trabajadora  y emprendedora, quien comenta que tiene una librería con todo tipo de productos que con mucho esfuerzo pudo formar. Comenta que por medio de su negocio ayuda a su familia, dándoles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Es una señora muy luchadora y trabajadora que quiere salir adelante y capacitarse para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Graciela pide este préstamo para poder comprar libros, cuadernos, lápices, pinceles y demás, con lo que podrá surtir su local y seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo y de poder capacitarse y crecer.
texts.en:
This group is on its 8th cycle, where all members are growing with the purpose to get ahead and help their families.
They are all filling out the poverty elimination survey, which will help them grow to continue fighting to improve their lives.
One of the members is Graciela, a hardworking and entrepreneurial person. She has a bookstore where she sells all sorts of products that she was able to compile with much effort.
Through her business she is able to help her family by giving them everything she couldn't have. She is a very hardworking lady that wants to get ahead and study to improve her life conditions.
Graciela requests this loan to buy books, notebooks, pencils, color pencils and products that she will stock her store with and work like she has done in the past. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, as well as the one of learning and growth.

loans.use: to buy books, notebooks, pencils, color pencils and other bookstore products.

loans.name: Divina Misericordia Group

texts.es:
Divina Misericordia está en el segundo ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde dos de las señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de ellas es la señora  Elizabeth, quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos variados que vende de manera ambulante. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que por medio de su esfuerzo y sacrificio está saliendo adelante. Comenta que le gustaría seguir trabajando para poder seguir ayudando a su familia por medio de sus ingresos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar más cosméticos, de manera a seguir con sus ventas, cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Divina Misericordia is in its second cycle of the women's committee program, where all the women promise to work and help each other to be successful. They are striving to eliminate poverty, as two of the women find themselves below the poverty line.

One of them is Elizabeth, who sells various cosmetics door to door. She is a very hard-working woman who through her effort and sacrifice is becoming successful. She says that she would like to keep working in order to continue helping her family with her income. She asks for this loan to be able to buy more cosmetics in order to continue with her sales, fulfilling the orders of her customers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Villa Flamenco Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Villa Flamenco está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité, es un grupo nuevo, donde las integrantes tienen mucho entusiasmo y quieren poder crecer con el trabajo unido de todas. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación de vida de cada una de ellas.
