Elva, una de ellas vende ropas de manera ambulante, y comenta que aunque tiene mucha competencia, trata siempre de dar lo mejor de sí, ya que por medio de ese trabajo también ayuda a su familia dándoles todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna.
Pide este préstamo, ya que de esa forma podrá tener una mayor variedad de prendas que poder ofrecer a sus clientes, y también captar a más. Agradecen por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo, que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Villa Flamenco group is in its first cycle of the committee program. It is a new group with enthusiastic members who want to grow through all of the members' united work. They are doing a poverty elimination survey to understand each woman's situation.

Elva, one of the women, sells clothes from door to door, and she comments that although she has lots of competition, she always tries to do her best because she also helps her family with this job, giving them everything that they need for a dignified life. 

She is requesting this loan because she will be able to have a wider variety of clothing to offer to her clients, and to get new clients as well.

They appreciate the opportunity that they are receiving, which will be of great help to them.

loans.use: to purchase various articles of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Santa Clara Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Clara está en su ciclo número 3° Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Vidalia, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir que se encuentra en un nivel medio, que a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo y por medio de la venta de ropas podrá ir mejorando su vida y sus ingresos.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra prendas variadas para vender, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Santa Clara group is in their third loan cycle with the women's committee program.  They are all participating in the poverty elimination survey to be able to understand each person's situation.

One of the group members is Vidalia, who was in level two on her last survey, which means a middle level.  With effort and work selling clothing, she will be able to improve her life and her income.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase a variety of clothing to sell.  This will help her firm up her business plan, which will help her improve her profits.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing to sell.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El progreso está en su ciclo 8 del programa de comités, también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde a través del esfuerzo de todas quieren ir mejorando sus vidas y sus ingresos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Nilsa quien se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza a través de su negocio, el cual es una peluquería. Ella comenta que por medio de su sacrificio y su trabajo viene creciendo, ya que siempre atiende muy bien a sus clientes, y de esa forma se está haciendo conocida.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para su peluquería, como ser tintes, tijeras, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues y demás con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y luchando.
texts.en:
The El Progreso group is in their eighth loan cycle with the committee program.  They are also participating in the poverty elimination survey, where thanks to their efforts, they all want to improve their lives and their incomes.

One of the group members is Nilsa, who is improving her situation through her business, which is a beauty salon.  She says that through her sacrifice and her work she is growing, since she always cares for her customers well and she is making herself known.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of various supplies for her beauty salon, including dyes, scissors, creams, shampoo, rinses, and other items.  This will allow her to continue working and fighting.

loans.use: to purchase dyes, scissors, creams, shampoo, rinses, and other items.

loans.name: 4 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El grupo 4 de Mayo está en su ciclo número 1  del programa de comité de mujeres, son de la ciudad de Curuguaty, una ciudad bastante lejana de la capital del país, eminentemente rural, donde ellas en su mayoría se dedican a actividades agrícolas.
La Sra. Ramona es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la cría de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, patos, cabras y demás, y de esa forma se gana la vida para poder ayudar a su familia y sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en comprar balanceados varios, para que de esa forma siga con la cría de sus animales, y también luchando para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
texts.en:
The group "4 de Mayo" (May 4th) is on its first loan cycle for the committee of women program. The group is from the city of Curuguaty, a predominantly rural city that is quite far from the capital of the country, where the majority of them make a living doing agricultural work. 

Ramona is one of the members. She works raising barnyard animals such as chickens, ducks, goats and others. She makes a living in this way in order to be able to help her family and her loved ones.  She is asking for this loan in order to invest it in the purchase of different types of animal feed, so that she can continue raising her animals and fighting to be able to help her family through her work.

loans.use: to buy animal feed so she can sell animals

loans.name: Esperanza Y Fe Group

texts.es:
Esperanza y fe es un grupo que se formó en ciudad del este, son 23 las mujeres que integran este comité, todas y cada una de ellas está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder conocer la situación de pobreza de cada una de ellas, y conforme a eso poder trabajar.
Espiriona es una de las integrantes de este grupo, quien además es la presidenta, ella vende todo tipo de prendas, y a través de su trabajo da a su familia para tener una vida digna y sin privaciones. Es una mujer muy sacrificada y luchadora, que quiere seguir creciendo y capacitándose para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas de invierno, ya que se acerca el frío y quiere poder tener buena variedad de prendas que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Esperanza y Fe is a group from Ciudad del Este. There are 23 women in this group, each one of completing the survey to eliminate poverty so that they can come to know each's situation and be able to find a solution.

Espiriona is one of the members of this group, who in addition to being its president, sells all kinds of clothing and through this work gives her family a dignified life and without lacking for basic needs. She is a very hard working and self sacrificing woman, who wants to continue growing and learning in order to have a better quality of life. She asks for this loan in order to be able to buy winter clothing as the cold season is approaching and she wants to have a good variety of clothing to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing to sell.

loans.name: San Agustin Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Agustin está en su  primer ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para ir superando su pobreza.
Una de ellas es la señora  Lidia, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que debe seguir esforzándose para poder ir superándose poco a poco. Ella está empezando a trabajar en la venta de ropas, y por medio de esto quiere abrirse camino y poder ayudar a su familia. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, y de esa forma poder ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The San Agustin group is in its first loan cycle in the women's committee program. They are completing their poverty surveys, where each person puts her best effort toward overcoming poverty.

One of them is Lidia, who in her survey demonstrated a level one on the poverty index, which is to say she should continue making efforts to be able to better herself little by little. she is beginning to work selling clothing, and through this work she wants to create opportunities and be able to help her family. She seeks this loan to be able to buy a variety of clothing to sell, and in this way be able to offer variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy various clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana está casada, tiene 4 hijos que ya son mayores e independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de frazadas en la ciudad, realiza sus ventas a los turistas que llegan hasta su ciudad.
Juana está viviendo con su familia en una casa cómoda en ciudad del este, Hoy día ella tiene una clientela formada y muy responsable con ella.
Es una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe dudas que va a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar ropas, y de esa forma poder agregarlo a sus actividades.
texts.en: Juana is married, has 4 children who are grown and self-sufficient. She works selling clothing in the city, making her sales to tourists who arrive in the city. Juana is living with her family in a comfortable house in Ciudad del Este. Today she has a steady clientele. She is a hard-working person with the drive to succeed. She has a jovial and enterprising spirit and without a doubt she will be able to reach all the goals she has set for herself. She seeks this loan to be able to buy clothing and in this way be able to add them to her inventory.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jose Dolores

texts.es: El señor Jose Dolores, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa e hijos quienes ya están mayores de edad, el se dedica al albañilería y su esposa trabaja para una empresa del estado, el solicita este crédito para completar los materiales y construir un muro al rededor de su casa, el tiene Piedras ya compradas pero le falta, con este financiamiento comprara. Cemento, Arena, Piedrin, Hierro, Tablas, etc. Agradece a Kiva y Afodenic ya que así su casa tendrá mayor seguridad y privacidad.
texts.en:
Señor Jose Dolores lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with his wife, and his children who are now grown. He works in construction, and his wife works for a state-owned company. 

He is requesting this loan in order to compile materials and build a wall around his house. He has already purchased the stones, but he needs materials; and with this financing he will buy cement, sand, gravel, iron, planks, and similar items. He thanks Kiva and AFODENIC, because his house will have more security and privacy.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en: Rashad is 29 years old. Two years ago he was married and has a child. Rashad and his wife are IDP (internally displacted persons) from Füzuli city. Now they are living in Bala Bahmanli village in the Füzuli region. Rashad has been in the animal breeding business for three years. He buys little cattle, raises them and sells them in the local bazaar to earn money. Today Rashad wants to develop his business, so he needs 800 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to repair the stall for cows. Rashad says great thanks for help to the Kiva organization and all lenders. In the future he wants to buy more cows and to produce dairy products to sell.

loans.use: to repair the stall for cows

loans.name: Elba Teodora

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Progreso, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Elba, tiene 77 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo 15 hijos,  5 fallecieron y los 10 que aun están vivos ya son mayores de edad,  en ciertas ocasiones vive en casa de una hija.
Doña Elba es una mujer que siempre le gusto trabajar y así salir adelante y mucho mas desde que su marido falleció ya que al quedar sola tuvo que afrontar la dura realidad de salir adelante sola, ella tiene una granja en su casa donde cría pollos, tiene más de 300 pollos por temporada y para esta labor cuenta con la ayuda de una persona a quien le paga para que le cuide la finca y le ayude con la crianza de los pollos, ella compra los pollos muy pequeños los cría por tres meses y luego cuando tienen un desarrollo adecuado los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su hogar, así ella sale adelante sola.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar pollos, medicinas y alimentos para los mismos. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del banco. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The "Health and Progress" credit group meets in the city of Tosagua every fifteen days. This area is known for being very dynamic, and the majority of its population works in agriculture and raising animals, because it is an area with a large amount of vegetation.

Elba lives here, and she is 77 years old. Many years ago, her husband passed away and she was left a widow. She had fifteen children in her marriage. Five of her children passed away, and the ten that are still alive are adults now. Sometimes, she lives with one of her daughters. Elba is a woman who has always liked to work in order to get ahead, and she has worked even harder since her husband passed away because she has had to confront the harsh reality of getting ahead on her own. She has a farm in her house where she raises chickens. She has more than 300 chickens per season, and she has the help of someone whom she pays to take care of the farm and to help her raising the chickens. Elba purchases the chickens when they are very small, and she raises them for three months. When they are sufficiently large, she sells them to businessmen who come to her home. This is how she gets ahead, all on her own. 

She is going to use this loan to purchase chickens, medicine, and food for the chickens. She has been in the credit group since the beginning, and she likes it because of the help and benefits that she receives from the bank. Her dreams are to get ahead, and to have good health.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, medicine, and food for the chickens.

loans.name: María Marlene

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Progreso, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  21 y 19 años,  el menor estudia en un colegio a distancia y es el que aun vive con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña María es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su marido, el tiene un local en el cual se dedica a dos actividades, vende aceites y lubricantes para automóviles y también realiza servicio técnico a teléfonos celulares y venta de repuestos y accesorios de estos, el trabaja todos los días en su local ya que por la calidad de su trabajo tiene muchos clientes, Doña María también en ocasiones le ayuda en su labor cuando él está muy ocupado, ya son más de 20 años que el realiza esta labor con lo cual el saca adelante a su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar lubricantes y repuestos de teléfonos. Lleva más de 15 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así ella puede ayudarle a su marido. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Salud y Progreso credit group meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua, which is known for being very dynamic.  A majority of the inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals, and it is an area with a lot of vegetation.

María lives in this place.  She is 44 years old, married, and has two children who are 21 and 19 years old.  The younger one is in high school and still lives with her.  Her husband is a merchant.  María is a good wife, who is requesting this loan to help her husband.  He has a store dedicated to two activities: he sells oils and lubricants for automobiles, and also services mobile phones and sells parts and accessories for them.  He works every day at his store, since he has many customers thanks to the quality of his work.  María sometimes helps him with his work when he is very busy.  He has done this work for more than 20 years and it has helped their family succeed.

This loan will be used to purchase lubricants and telephone parts.  She has been a member of the credit group for 15 years and likes it because she can help her husband.  Her dream is to succeed.

loans.use: to purchase lubricants and telephone parts.

loans.name: María De Lourdes

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Progreso, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 55 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tiene 4 hijos,  tres mayores de edad y la menor de 15 años que estudia en colegio y es la que aun vive con ella.
Doña María es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante y con esto darle lo mejor a su hija,  ella en sociedad con otra persona tienen una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas, carnes,  entre otras cosas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde,  lleva 4 años que con este negocio el cual le permite salir adelante  sola.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por las ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
The "Health and Progress" credit group meets up every fifteen days in the city of Tosagua. This area is known for being very dynamic, and the majority of its population works in agriculture and raising animals, because it is an area with lots of vegetation.

María lives here, and she is 55 years old. Her husband passed away many years ago, and she was left a widow. She has 4 children from her marriage; three are adults, and her youngest daughter is 15 years old. Her daughter studies in school, and she still lives with María. María is a woman who likes to work to get ahead, and to be able to give the best to her daughter. She has a business with another person- they have a small store with basic goods. They sell all kinds of products, such as rice, sugar, oil, detergents, beans, vegetables and fruits, and meats. She works every day from 6am until 8pm, and sometimes even later. She has been working at this business for 4 years, which has allowed her to get ahead on her own.

She is going to use this loan to stock up her store more- she is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, lunch meats, and other basic goods. She has been in the credit group from the start, and she likes the help that she gets with the loans. Her dreams are to give the best to her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergents, lunch meats, and other basic goods.

loans.name: Sarandjam

texts.en: Sarandjam is a 35-year-old woman who is in the picture. She lives in Mahmudlu village of Füzuli region with family, but members of the family are internally displaced persons. Sarandjam has been married for 13 years and has two children, a school-aged daughter and son. They go to sixth and fifth class in the village school. Her children are getting older and her husband’s salary is not enough to cover their increasing expenses.  For this reason she wants to develop her business, and that's why she has applied to Komak Credit Union for a loan in the amount of 2100 AZN so she can buy more cattle to expand her business. In the future she wants to give a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to expand her business

loans.name: Sewa Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SEWA ont en moyenne  36 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à SORON/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente du lait, des céréales, des condiments et  du savon. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SEWA sont à leur  2ème  prêt solidaire. FATOUMATA  femme assise au milieu sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 90Litres de lait frais. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Sewa group are women averaging 36 years of age, with four children. They all live in traditional extended families in Soron, Segou (the fourth administrative region of Mali).

They know each other as relatives and work selling milk, cereals, condiments and soap. Having repaid their prior [loan], the Sewa group members are now on their second solidarity loan. Fatoumata, the one seated in the middle of the photo, plans to use her loan to buy 90 liters [24 gallons] of fresh milk. She stocks up locally and in the nearby villages. She sells to a mixed clientele, for cash and often on credit.
She plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 15,000 West African francs, which will be used for expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and school fees, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a 58-year-old widow with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Julieta has a spare parts retail business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional spare parts to offer for resale.

Julieta has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts to offer for resale.

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en:
Anelyn is 32 years old and has two children. Anelyn is married and both of her children are in school.

Anelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Anelyn requested a loan of PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Anelyn has been raising pigs for eight years.

In the future, Anelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Hannah Jayne

texts.en:
Hannah Jayne is 28 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Hannah Jayne runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, diapers and other groceries. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is 52 years old and married with one child who is in school. 

Marlene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Marlene has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, toothpaste, diapers, laundry soap and other groceries. 

In the future Marlene would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a 51-year-old married mother of nine children. Four of her children are in school, and she is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Marilou has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marilou requested a loan of PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Marilou has been in this business for two years. In the future, Marilou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Rio Marie

texts.en:
Rio Marie is 27 years old and a single woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Rio Marie has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Rio Marie requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to offer for sale.

Rio Marie has been in this business for three years. In the future, Rio Marie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to offer for sale.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité está conformado por 15 mujeres inspiradas en una mejor y buena calidad de vida, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maxima, que se encuentra contenta por formar parte del comité que mediante eso ella pudo emprender una  actividad para ganar dinero, ella elabora comestibles y se dedica a la venta de los mismos de manera ambulante, ya que con ello podrá luchar para el bienestar de ella y la de su familia.
 La Sra. Maxima Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de productos para poder elaborar las comidas que vende, como ser verduras, condimentos, panificados, hortalizas y demás. Agradece por la oportunidad que ha recibido de poder seguir creciendo y luchando.
texts.en:
The group consists of 15 women who aim to have a better quality of life. One of the members is Maxima. She is happy to be a part of the group, through which she was able to start a business to earn money. She makes food products and sells them on the streets. With this business she will be able to fight for her wellbeing and that of her family.

Maxima is requesting this loan in order to buy products for making the meals she sells, such as vegetables, condiments, bread products, and other products. She is grateful for the opportunity she has received of being able to continue growing and striving to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, bread products, and other products to make meals

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is married and they have a child. She operates a small store selling grocery items to the people in her village. She sells canned goods, biscuits, eggs, and soap to the people in her village. 

Her income goes to pay for meals and revolving capital in the business. She wants to sell more merchandise, that is why she is asking for additional capital of PHP 9,000 to buy sardines, bread, soap, and shampoo to sell. It will help increase sales capacity and improve her income for her family's sustenance.

loans.use: to buy sardines, bread, soap, and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita lives simply in Pinopoc. She is a hog raiser and a vegetable vendor too. She is 57 years old and has 10 children. She raises hogs to sell, and she plants and harvests vegetables too. 

She operates her business well and is willing to expand it with enough capital. She is now asking for additional capital of PHP 8,000 to invest in her hog raising business. She will buy feed and vaccines for her pigs and fertilizers for vegetable farming too. She hopes to keep increasing her income for her family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for his pigs and also fertilizers for vegetable farming

loans.name: Buena Fe Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama buena fe, ellas están en su ciclo número 17, son mujeres jefas de familia que se unieron para poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar.
Selva es una de ellas, una mujer muy sacrificada que esta luchando por sus seres queridos, es decir, por su familia. Se dedica a la venta de perfumes, lo que le permite poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener, y tal vez un poco más. Ella quiere seguir luchando, y es por eso que pide este préstamo, ya que quiere comprar una mayor variedad de perfumes, y de esa forma mejorar sus ingresos y su situación de pobreza.
texts.en:
This group is called “Buena Fe”. They are on their 17th loan cycle. The members are women who joined together in order to get ahead in life and help their families by working together. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, which will enable them to ascertain the situation of each member and work according to this information. 

Selva is one of the members. She is a very selfless woman who is fighting for her loved ones, that is, her family. She makes a living by selling perfumes, which enables her to give her loved ones everything she was not able to have and sometimes a little more. She wants to continue striving to get ahead; for this reason, she is requesting this loan, which she will use to buy a greater variety of perfumes so she can improve her earnings and her poverty level.

loans.use: buy various perfumes to sell

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Progreso, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 65 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad e independientes.
Doña Rosas es una mujer que le gusta valerse por si misma para salir adelante, ella en las noches instala una carreta en las afueras de su casa en la cual vende comida, la especialidad es el arroz con menestra y carne asada,  son muchas personas que todas las noches van hasta su local a servirse sus platos ya que son deliciosos, una hija que vive cerca de su casa le ayuda con esta labor, ya son más de 10 años que lleva con este negocio el cual le permite salir adelante sola.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 5 años  y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Salud y Progreso communal bank meets every 15 days in the city of Tosagua.  This place is known for being very dynamic.  Most of the inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals.  It is an area with great vegetation.

Rosa, age 65, lives in this place.  Her husband died several years ago, and she was left a widow.  However, she and her husband had five children who are now adults and independent.

Rosa is a woman who likes to be self-sufficient in order to get ahead.  In the evenings she sets up a cart outside of her house and sells food.  Her specialty is stew with rice and roasted meat.  There are a lot of people who go to her place every evening to get her delicious dishes.  A daughter who lives close to her house helps her with this work.  She has had this business for over ten years.  It allows her to get ahead alone.

She will use this loan to buy rice, meat, and other supplies to prepare the food.  She has been in her communal bank for five years.  She likes it because the loans help her a lot.  Her dream is to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, and other supplies.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 40 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Faith has a rice retailing business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to provide additional capital for her business by purchasing bags of rice to sell.

Faith has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Faith hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma requested a PHP 14,000 loan through PMPC to buy more ingredients for snack vending.

Thelma has been in this business for 25 years now.

Thelma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for snack making

loans.name: Jackielyn

texts.en:
Jackielyn is married with two children. Jackielyn is 32 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Philippines.

Jackielyn is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 12 years. She has requested a loan to buy sacks of feed for her pigs.

Jackielyn has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Jackielyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feed

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a microfinance member of PMPC. She is 35 years old, married, and has a snack vending business in Plaridel. This is how she supports her family with a meagre income of PHP 5,000 per month. 

Recently, Jocelyn availed a loan to purchase Nipa thatch for roofing. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase Nipa thatch for roofing

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 44 years old, married and a microfinance member of PMPC. She has a construction store in Lopez Jaena, that brings a promising income of PHP 8,000 per month. Doing this type of business allows Mila and her family to support their daily needs. 

Recently, Mila asked for a loan to purchase wood sticks for retail. She wants to have enough inventory so that she will be able to cater to the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase wood sticks for retail

loans.name: Mary Criza

texts.en:
Mary Criza is 44 years old, married with eight children. Seven of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Mary Criza has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell. She has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 60-year-old widowed mother and has six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lilia has a business in which she sells fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. Lilia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to offer for resale.

Lilia has been in this business for three years. In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to offer for sale.

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is 39 years old and married with two children and both are in school. Suzette works very hard to provide for them.

Suzette runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Suzette has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Suzette would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 47 years old and has two children. Veronica is married and both of her children are in school.

Veronica is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Veronica requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Veronica has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Veronica would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional equipment and computers, as well as conduct some promotional events and marketing activities for her translation office.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rosalie requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosalie has been in this business for three years now and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Necita

texts.en:
Necita is single and has a nipa palm roof-making business in the Philippines.

Necita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her nipa palm roofing business.

Necita has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Necita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her nipa palm roofing business.

loans.name: Ellene

texts.en:
Ellene is 31 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Ellene works very hard to provide for them.

Ellene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Ellene has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Ellene would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 54 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rebecca has been raising pigs for 18 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Hang, 56, is a married woman who lives is Prey Chhor Dirstrict, Kampong Cham Province. She has been involved in farming for more than 30 years. She has five children of whom two of have already married, while the rest still depend on her support. Hang and her husband can make approximately $5  USD per day.

The main source of their income has come from farming on their rice field that is located behind their small house. 

Hang has been an honest and reliable client of Hattha Kasekor for one loan cycle already. In this second loan, she would like use this amount of money to pay for an official passport for her husband to go to the nearby country of Cambodia to work for supplementary salary during the farming break. 

She would like to thank you for this useful loan and is willing to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: to pay for an official passport for her husband

loans.name: Preciosisima

texts.en: Preciosisima is 60 years old and married with 12 children. She is residing in Barangay Bintana, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Preciosisima has a corn farm as their source of income. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for five years. Since she is a member, she borrowed money with a loan amount of 14,000 PHP with the purpose of buying fertilizers for the corn crops on the farm. She is hoping to improve living conditions by using the profits of the farm income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the corn farm.

location.town: Tangub - Bintana, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Bella Patricia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Progreso, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Bella, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos mayores de edad,  uno de ellos  aun vive con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Bella una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y salir adelante, tiene un restaurante  en su casa, allí ella con la ayuda de su marido y de una sobrina a quien le paga por sus servicios  prepara deliciosos desayunos, almuerzos y meriendas, día a día ella varia el menú con la intención de complacer  a sus clientes,  trabaja todos los días y casi todos el día.  Tiene su restaurante por más de 8  años y siempre les ha ido muy bien ya que sus clientes la prefieren por la sazón que le pone a sus platos y esto la hace especial.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 10 años  y le gusta porque con ayuda de los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su restaurante.
texts.en:
The Salud y Progreso Credit Group meets every fifteen days in the city of Tosagua. This locale is known for being very dynamic, and for being a zone of lush vegetation, where most of the inhabitants work in agriculture and livestock raising. 

Señora Bella lives here. She is 52 years old, and she is married. She has six children from this relationship. They are grown up, and one of them still lives with her. Her husband is a businessman.

Doña Bella is a woman who has always liked to work and move forward. She has a restaurant in her house; and there, with the help of her husband, and a niece whom she pays, she prepares delicious breakfasts, lunches, and snacks. She varies the menu daily in order to please her customers. She works almost all day long, every day.  She has had her restaurant for more than eight years, and things have always gone very well for her, as her customers prefer her for the flavor she gives her dishes; this is what makes her special.

She is going to use the loan to purchase rice, meat, seafood, and other supplies for preparing the food. She has been in the credit group for 10 years, and she likes it because she started her business with the help of the loans. Her dream is to continue improving her restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase rice, meat, seafood, and other supplies.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 51 years old and married with four school-age children. She is residing at Barangay Baybay, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. Lolita is a business woman with an internet cafe business. She also owns a fishing boat as well as a rice and a corn farm. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for three years. Lolita applied for a loan to pay for land preparation and purchase farm inputs. She is hoping to improve living conditions by using the profits of the business.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation and purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
$600 is offered to Celina to improve her business. She is married and has four children. She has a kiosk where many people come to shop every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as body lotion, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, coffee, water, Sprite and bread. She has involved herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Celina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy body lotion, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, coffee, water, Sprite and bread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a clean and efficient liquefied petroleum gas cooking energy package.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza is 44 years old and married with three school-age children. She is residing at Barangay Garang, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Liza has a rice field as their source of income. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for five years. Since she is a member, she availed the loan program and borrowed with the loan amount of 5,000 PHP for the purpose of buying school supplies for her children for the upcoming school class.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for her children for the upcoming school class.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita requested a 10,000 PHP loan through PMPC to purchase inventories of soft drinks and canned goods to sell.
She has been in this business for 11 years now. Jovita would like to save enough for emergencies and hopes to maintain her membership with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of soft drinks and canned goods.

loans.name: Lilliam Xiomara

texts.es: Doña Lilliam desde hace mucho tiempo imparte el pan de la enseñanza en un Colegio Estatal, su esposo que labora para una empresa privada le ayuda con los gastos del hogar y a base de Prestamos y esfuerzos propios han podido mejorar su vivienda pero aun no completa las mejoras por lo que solicita el crédito para Comprar Cemento, Arena, Piedrín, Hierro y pagar mano de obra para la Construcción de una habitación.  De esta manera ella contara con mayor espacio  y privacidad en su hogar, ya que su niña va creciendo y necesita acondicionarle su espacio.
texts.en:
Doña Lilliam has been a teacher in a state school for a long time. Her husband, who works for a private company, helps her with the household expenses. 

With loans and their own efforts, they have been able to improve their home. But they have not yet completed the improvements, so they are requesting a loan in order to buy cement, sand, gravel, and iron; and to pay for labor for the construction of a room. In this way, she will have more space and privacy in her home, as her daughter is growing up, and she needs to prepare a space for her.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for a room.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to sell chickens. She opened her business a year ago with her own working capital of $200. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to sell chickens.

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en: Anatalia is a 54-year-old widow and has a vegetable-farming business. She plants eggplant. She also pay laborers in her farming business. After harvesting, she immediately sells her crop to nearby vegetable stalls and markets. She is asking for additional capital of 5,000 PHP to buy fertilizers for her vegetables so they will produce a bigger harvest. She hopes to achieve economic stability someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for vegetable farming

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is a businesswoman in Lopez Jaena. She is 49 years old, married and a microfinance member of PMPC. Rita runs a retail store selling bamboo poles, bamboo and wooden sticks for carpentry. Running this type of business has supported her family, especially in the education of her children. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bamboo poles to sell. Rita believes having enough inventory would allow her to cater to her customers' needs. She is thankful that she has signed up for membership with PMPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo poles to sell

loans.name: Firaddin

texts.en:
Firaddin is 44 years old, is married and has four children. His wife is a housewife. They live in the Boyuk Bahmanli village of Fuzuli region, near the war zone, as internally displaced persons. Firaddin has been in the cattle breeding business for many years. Now he breeds sheep. 

To support his business Firaddin needs a loan in the amount of 1,400 AZN to buy more lambs to increase the size of his flock. This is his second loan; previously he took a loan from Kiva and all of his payments were on time. Firaddin says he is greatly thankful to Kiva and its lenders for their help.

loans.use: to buy more lambs

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Yin is a 55-year-old married woman and comes from Toul Chambak village in Kompong Cham province. She has three children; two of them are married, so there is only one child left in her care. Yin has working as a farmer for more than 35 years now. The average income of her family is 4 USD per day, which can be made by farming.

Yin has already borrowed in three loan cycles from Hattha Kaksekar, which has helped her in improving her living standard. However, now she needs another loan in the amount of 700 USD to buy farming supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and related things for this farming season.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizers and related supplies

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a businesswoman. She helps her husband by running her retail business. Her little store is situated in Lopez Jaena and earns a monthly income of 8,000 PHP for the family. 

Aida has signed up her membership with PMPC for financial access. Aside from loans she also enjoys insurance benefits. Recently, she took out a loan to purchase inventory of milk, oil, soap, and noodles to sell. She wants to have enough inventory to cater to her customers' needs.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of milk, oil, soap and noodles to sell

loans.name: Sanginmo

texts.ru: Сангинмо разведенная женщина и живет с единственной 13-летней дочерью в районе Шахритус. Ее дочь школьница. Сангинмо работает усердно, чтобы обеспечивать свою маленькую семью. Она уже 6 лет как занимается продажей овощей на рынке. Дочь тоже помогает ей после занятий. Сангинмо сейчас нуждается в кредите. Она хочет увеличить ассортимент овощей и таким образом увеличить доходность от продаж. Для этой цели Сангинмо просит кредит и с надеждой ждет поддержки.
texts.en: Sanginmo is a divorced woman. She lives with her only old daughter,  who is 13 years old, in the Shahrituz region.  Sanginmo's daughter is in secondary school. Sanginmo works very hard to support her little family. She has been selling vegetables at the marketplace for six years. Her daughter also helps out after school. At present Sanginmo needs a loan. She would like to expand the selection of vegetables and thus increase her revenues. This is why Sanginmo has applied for a loan. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for efficient and affordable cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 29 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Irene works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, cooking oil, noodles, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Irene has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, cooking oil, noodles, biscuits, etc. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, cooking oil, noodles, and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Adjo est une jeune femme mariée de 25 ans. Elle réside dans le quartier Djidjolé et a deux enfants. En 2007, elle a commencé le commerce de denrées alimentaires notamment les légumes et les ignames. Actuellement elle gère une boutique à son domicile et s’approvisionne 02 fois par semaine. 
Adzo est très active et accueillante. Pour répondre au besoin de ses clients, elle souhaite diversifier ses produits pour augmenter ses revenus.
Ce micro crédit lui permettra d’atteindre ses objectifs par l’achat de 03 bidons d’huile végétale, 02 sacs de riz et 01 panier de tomates fraiches.
texts.en:
Adjo is a 25-year old married woman. She lives in the Djidolé neighborhood and has two children. In 2007, she launched a business selling food products, especially vegetables and yams. At present she manages a store at home and restocks twice a week.

Adjo is very energetic and friendly. In order to meet customer demand, she would like to diversify her product selection and thus increase her revenues. This microloan will allow her to meet her goals by buying three jugs of vegetable oil, two bags of rice and one basket of fresh tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy three jugs of vegetable oil, two bags of rice and one basket of fresh tomatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for efficient cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clean and efficient cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Humberto Jose

texts.es: Don Humberto es trabajador de la Municipalidad en el cargo de Inspector de Transporte, con su salario y creditos ha venido mejorando su vivienda, brindando mejores condiciones a su familia que está compuesta por él, su esposa y sus hijos que estudian y dependen economicamente de él; cuenta con la ayuda economica de su esposa que se dedica a vender refrescos naturales en su casa de habitacion.  Don Humberto desea construir un Porche y una tapia que medira 11 x 7 mts, solicita este credito para la compra de materiales como cemento, arena, piedrin, hierro y pagar mano de obra  y asi realizar su pequeño proyecto.  Expresa que con creditos futuros pretende continuar con las mejoras que aun le quedan por hacer en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Don Humberto works for the municipality as a transportation inspector. With his salary and with loans, he has been improving his home, providing better conditions for his family, which is composed of himself, his wife, and their children. They are still in school, and they depend on him financially. He has financial help from his wife, who sells natural soft drinks from their house. 

Don Humberto wants to build a porch, and a wall that will measure 11 by 7 meters, and he is requesting a loan for the purchase of materials such as cement, sand, gravel, and iron; and to pay for labor. This way, he will carry out his little project. He says that with future loans he hopes to continue with the improvements to his home that he still needs to make.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for a porch and a wall.

loans.name: Mary

texts.fr:
Mary, 41 ans, habite le quartier Djidjolé, une banlieue de Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle a débuté en 2005 le commerce des produits de première nécessité. Faute de fonds de roulement, elle s’approvisionne une fois par semaine au grand marché de Lomé. Elle consacre à son activité 6 jours sur 7 et plus de 15h de temps par jour. 
Très dévouée, elle sollicite ce microcrédit pour acheter 02 sacs de détergents, 02 cartons de savons de Marseille et 06 cartons Lait PEAK. 
Les bénéficies lui permettront de couvrir les besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mary is41 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Djidolé, which is a suburb of Lomé. SHe is married and has three children. In 2005, she launched a business selling first necessity goods. Since she is short on working capital, she restocks once a week at the big market of Lomé. She works in this business six days out of seven, working more than 15 hours per day.

Very goal-oriented, she is seeking this microloan to buy two bags of detergents, two cartons of the household Marseille soap and six cartons of Peak powdered milk. Her revenues will allow her to take care of the everyday family expenses.

loans.use: to buy two bags of detergents and soap and six boxes of milk.

loans.name: Liceth Del Carmen

texts.es: Liceth junto a su esposo quien es albañil han logrado establecer su propio negocio  de donde reciben ingresos para el sustento diario y los gastos del hogar, sus dos hijos habitan con ella, la mayor estudia y trabaja para pagar sus gastos de estudios, en cambio el menor estudia la primaria y depende economicamente de sus padres.  Doña Liceth solicita este Financiamiento para comprar Mercaderia, como: Zandalias, Zapatos, Ropa en general y asi incrementar su inventarios para dar mayor cobertura a su clientela. Desea crecer en su Negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Liceth, along with her husband who is a construction worker, has managed to establish her own business. From this she obtains her incomes for the daily sustenance and the household expenses. 

Her two children live with her. The older attends to school and also works to pay for her studies. The younger goes to elementary school and is financially dependent on his parents. 

Liceth is requesting this loan to buy merchandise, like: sandals, shoes and clothing. This way, she will increase her inventory and will be able to offer more products to her clients. She wishes to expand her business so she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sandals, shoes, clothing and other products for her business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
Agée de 38 ans, Ama vit à Tokoin avec sa famille. Elle est coiffeuse de profession  et Elle gère à domicile la vente des jus de fruits et du « SODABI » une boisson locale alcoolisée depuis 2012. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes à Tsévié, une ville à environ 35  Km de Lomé.
Afin d’augmenter son stock et son chiffre d’affaires, elle sollicite ce prêt pour acquérir 10 bidons de « SODABI » et 9 bidons de jus de fruits.
texts.en: Ama is 38 years old and she lives in Tokoin with her family.  She works as a hairdresser and since 2012, she has also been selling fruit juices and "sodabi" (a local alcoholic beverage), from home.  She buys her goods from wholesalers in Tsévié, a town located about 35 kilometers from Lomé.  In order to increase her stock and turnover, she is requesting this loan, which will allow her to buy ten cans of "sodabi" and nine cans of fruit juices.

loans.use: to buy ten cans of alcoholic beverages and nine cans of fruit juices.

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr:
Ami est une jeune dame, mariée, et a 22 ans. Elle mère de deux enfants. Pour contribuer aux dépenses de sa famille, Ami a commencé en 2007 la vente ambulante des produits alimentaires dans son quartier et dans les marchés. Faute de mévente, elle a commencé en 2013, la vente des chaussures et tapette pour femme.
Elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter 01 douzaine de chaussure pour femme et 02 douzaines de tapette pour dame.
texts.en: Ami, age 22, is a young woman who is the mother of two children.  In order to cover some of her family's expenses she has been selling food products, in her neighborhood and at local markets, since 2007.  Because of a slump in sales, she also started to sell shoes and flip-flops for women in 2013.  She is requesting this loan to buy 12 pairs of women's shoes and 24 pairs of flip-flops.

loans.use: to buy 36 pairs of shoes and flip-flops.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les quatre  membres du groupe Sabougnouma ont en moyenne 36 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kognoumani l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kognoumani. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, pagnes wax, œufs, huile rouge et tubercules. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Aminata (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pagnes wax. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 25 pièces de pagnes wax  à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Kognoumani et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Aminata compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The majority of the women who make up the Sabougnouma group are married within monogamous families.  On average, they are 36 years old and have three children each.  They all live in Kognoumani, a neighborhood of Bamako, and they have come to know one another through neighborhood ties and also through their income-generating activities at the Kognoumani market. They sell wax fabrics, eggs, red oil and tubers.  In order to increase their businesses, they have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso, and this is their second solidarity loan.

Aminata (seated on the right-hand side in the photo) is an important reseller of wax fabrics.  She is planning to use her loan to buy 25 sets of wax fabrics in Bamako.  She resells her merchandise on a retail basis in Kognoumani and also as an itinerant seller, and most of her customers are women.  Thanks to this loan, she is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 CFA francs which will be reinvested in her business and also used to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy wax fabrics.

loans.name: Intigam

texts.en:
Intigam is 38 years old. He is living in Horadiz village of the Fuzuli region, with his wife and son, who is 7 years old and this year is going to first class. Intigam has been an Internally Displacted Person from Füzuli city for 20 years. 

Intigam has a cow, and he prepares dairy products for selling. In this business, his wife helps him. Also, he buys little cattle, raises them and sells them for slaughter. 

Now Intigam wants to buy one more dairy cow, and therefore, he needs 800 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Intigam is thankful for this aid from the Kiva organization. In the future, he wants to build a big stall for cows and increase his business.

loans.use: to buy one more dairy cow

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Sambo is aged 25 years. To support the family, he has been farming rice and sometimes he works for others for a fee. The current business earns his family about US$14 per day to meet his family’s needs. 

Sambo has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now he is going to apply for a new loan to pay for the university's tuition fee for his youngest brother. He hopes this loan will enable him to support his brother's education and keep him in university until his graduation.

loans.use: to pay for the university's tuition fee for his youngest brother

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 39 years old and married with seven children. With five children in school, Nilda works very hard to provide for them.

Nilda's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Nilda has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Nilda has taken a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Nilda is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future, would like to save enough money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Moussodje Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les quatre membres du groupe Moussodjè ont en moyenne 38 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kognoumani l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, d’amitié, de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kognoumani. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits, de la friperie de meilleures qualités,  de fruits, du bois de charbon et du charbon. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Bintou (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de friperie de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une balle de friperie à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Lafiabougou et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Bintou compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Most of them married in monogamous households, the four members of the group Moussodjè average 38 years of age and five children each. The women all live in Kognoumani, a district in Bamako. And they know one another through ties of kinship, friendship, community, and their revenue-generating businesses at the Kognoumani market. The members of the group have small-scale businesses involving clothing, secondhand clothing of the best quality, fruit, and charcoal.  

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Bintou (sitting at the far right in the photo) is a major vendor of secondhand clothing of the best qualities. She intends to use her loan to purchase a bale of used clothing in Bamako. In Lafiabougou and by hawking, her sales are made at the retail level to a customer base composed mostly of women. 

With this loan, Ms. Bintou plans on making an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and meeting sundry needs at home.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing

loans.name: Mehriban

texts.en:
Mehriban is 48 years old, married and has two children. Her daughter was married last year, and her other child, who is a 19-year-old boy, is studying at university. 

Mehriban’s family are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan – Fuzuli city. Today they are living at Bala Bahmanli village of the same city. 

Mehriban has been in an animal-breeding business for 11 years. She prepares delicious cheese from cow's milk and sells it in the local bazaar. Mehriban learned this profession from her mother-in-law. Now she needs her first loan from the Kiva organization in the amount of 2,100 Azerbaijan New Manat. With this loan, Mehriban wants to repair the stall of her cows. Mehriban says great thanks to the Kiva organization and all lenders for the help.

loans.use: to repair the stall of her cows

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr:
Madame Cécile est âgée de 48,  mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vit chez son mari à Djicoroni l’un des quartiers de Bamako. 
Dû  à ses  conditions de famille, elle n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école, raison pour laquelle elle a embrasé les  activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa grand-mère  depuis son enfance.  Après avoir mené plusieurs activités  auprès de cette dernière, elle finit par choisir la  vente du sable il y’a 10 ans. Sa notoriété est bonne car elle peut  ventre plusieurs chargements de camion  10 tonnes  par jour.  Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle en sable, elle décide de  faire recours à  l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en son 1èr  prêt  avec Soro Yiriwaso.  Avec ce  financement  elle compte commander 9 voyages de camions  avec les propriétaires de camion  et effectue sa vente dans le quartier de Kanadjiguila l’un des quartiers de Bamako à une clientèle  mixte.  
Elle compte  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150.000 FCFA  qu’elle envisage utiliser pour  le remboursement des intérêts, participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et investir le reste dans d’autres activités génératrices de revenus.
texts.en:
Cécile is 48 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She lives with her husband in Djicoroni, a neighborhood of Bamako.  Because of family circumstances, she never had the opportunity to attend school. Instead, she's been involved in income-generating activities since her childhood, under the guidance of her grandmother.  Working with her grandmother, she was first involved in several activities before deciding to sell sand ten years ago.  She is now a well-known seller who sometimes sells several truck loads of sand per day, each load weighing ten metric tons. 

In order to fully meet the needs of her customers, Cécile has decided to turn to Soro Yiriwaso, with which she is taking her first loan.  She is planning to use her loan to order and pay for nine round-trips from truck owners.  She resells her merchandise in Kanadjiguila, another neighborhood of Bamako.  Her customers are both men and women.

Cécile is expecting to make a monthly profit of 150,000 CFA francs.  This profit will allow her to repay her loan's interest, to cover some of the daily needs of her family, and to invest in other income-generating activities.

loans.use: to buy sand.

loans.name: Ibou

texts.fr:
Âgé de 65 ans, monsieur Ibou s’active dans l’agriculture depuis le bas âge. Il a appris le métier par son père, qui lui, l’a appris de son grand père, ça fait des générations que cela a été perpétré dans la famille. Il possède des terres qu’il exploite déjà depuis des années, mais c’est pour préparer l’hivernage, qu’il a besoin d’un crédit de 500 000 f pour acheter des semences et de l’engrais.
Ibou marié et père de famille s’occupe de la dépenses quotidienne et de l’éducation de ces enfants.
Il aimerait associer l’agriculture à l’élevage de bœufs pour diversifier et maximiser ses revenus qui lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Aged 65, Mr. Ibou has been active in agriculture since infancy. He learned the trade from his father, who himself learned from his grandfather, as this was perpetuated through generations in the family.

He owns land he has already been farming for years, but in preparation for the winter season, he needs a credit loan of 500,000 francs (XOF) to buy seeds and fertilizer. 

Ibou is married and a father and takes care of his children's daily expenses and education. 

He would like to combine agriculture with cattle breeding to diversify and maximize revenues, enabling him to improve the family's nutritional conditions.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer to grow crops

loans.name: Maricor

texts.en:
Maricor is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Maricor has been in this business for four years. Maricor earns more income from a general store.

Maricor has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Delirita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Delirita works hard to support her family.

She has a business of making nipa roofing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Delirita is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional materials like bamboo sticks, nipa leaves, etc., for her business.

Delirita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like bamboo sticks, nipa leaves, etc., for her business

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 21 years old and has one child.

Jean and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Jean is taking out a housing loan amounting to 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Jean has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. 

With your help, Jean can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Amelita will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 27 years old with one child. She works very hard to provide for the family.

Marissa's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Marissa has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Marissa has taken a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Marissa is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future, would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 44 years old and has seven children. She has two children who are in school.

She and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Gloria is taking out a housing loan amounting to 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Gloria has been an NWTF borrower since 2013.

With your help, Gloria can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La  Señorita Maria tiene 25  años, está casada con el Sr. José de 31 años, ella es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, donde trabaja netamente a la fabricación y ventas de hamacas, cochas y  sobrecamas con su madre.
Maria y su madre confeccionan las hamacas, colchas y sobrecamas y lo lleva a vender a cuotas en otras ciudades y así le resulta más rentable, hoy en día fábrica en gran cantidad ya que también tiene varios clientes macateros que compra en gran cantidad.  	
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilo y color para la fabricación de los materiales que ella y su madre venden.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria is 25 years old and is married to Mr. Joseph who is 31. She is from the city of Carapeguá and works manufacturing and selling hammocks, bedspreads, and quilts with her mother. They then sell them in other cities, something which has become very profitable for them. Today she manufactures large amounts and has several customers who are street vendors buying in large quantities. 

She is requesting a loan to buy yarn and pigment to manufacture the materials that she and her mother will sell.

loans.use: to buy yarn and pigment for making bedspreads, blankets, and sheets.

loans.name: Marianne

texts.en:
With her desire to have a decent job and be able to help her parents have a better living, Marianne dreams to continue and finish her studies. Unfortunately, her parents do not have enough finances to support her; thus, she is asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to pay for her tuition fee. 

At 18 years of age, Marianne does have a lot of dreams for her future. She hopes that Kiva lenders will help her achieve those dreams by granting her loan request.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition fee

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Cristina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing/fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling Avon and Natasha products and raising livestock. Cristina is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing/fish-vending business.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business

loans.name: Jie-La

texts.en:
Jie-La is 22 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jie-La's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Jie-La has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Jie-La has taken a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Jie-La is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future, would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Medy

texts.en:
Medy is 28 years old and has three children.

She and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Medy is taking out a housing loan amounting to 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Medy has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. 

With your help, Medy can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Leonida works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of dried coconut meat business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Leonida is borrowing 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell for her buying and selling of dried coconut meat business.

Leonida has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
