loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Danaya sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 46 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Lafiabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Lafiabougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce, d’habits (pagnes wax), de draps, de la restauration et du bois de chauffage. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Kadiatou (femme debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits (pagnes wax). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 23 pièces de pagnes wax au grand marché.  La revente se fait  au comptant et à crédits à Lafiabougou et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Kadiatou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The four women in the Danaya group are mostly married in monogamous households. They are on average 46 years old with five children. They all live in Lafiabougou, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako. They became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the Lafiabougou market.

The group members are small retail merchants, selling clothes (pagne wax fabric), linens, food preparations and firewood. So they can resupply by paying cash, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan cycle.

Mrs. Kadiatou (the woman standing at the far right in the photo) has a great reputation at selling clothes (pagne wax fabric). She intends to use her loan to buy 23 lengths of pagnes wax at the general market. Retail sales are made for cash and on credit, in Lafiabougou and as an itinerant vendor, to a clientele composed mostly of women.

Mrs. Kadiatou hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 50,000 CFA francs to be reinvested in the business and used to ensure their children's upkeep.

loans.use: buy pagnes wax (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les six  membres du groupe Djiguiya ont en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Lafiabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Lafiabougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, produits cosmétiques (pommades et parfums), habits, céréales et lait. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Kadiatou (femme assise devant de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est une vendeuse de produits cosmétiques (pommades et parfums) de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 6 cartons parfums, 5 cartons et de pommades à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Lafiabougou à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Kadiatou compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Mostly married in monogamous households, the six members of the Djiguiya group are on average 39 years old with four children. They all live in Lafiabougou, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako. They became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the Lafiabougou market.

The group members are small retail merchants, selling cosmetics (pomades and perfumes), clothing, cereals and milk. To increase their stock-in-trade, the group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan cycle.

Mrs. Kadiatou (the woman sitting in front on the left in the photo) is a vendor of quality cosmetics (pomades and perfumes). She intends to use her loan to buy 6 cartons of perfumes and 5 cartons of pomades in Bamako. Retail sales are made in Lafiabougou to a clientele composed mostly of women.

Mrs. Kadiatou hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 50,000 CFA francs to be reinvested in the business and used to meet small household expenditures.

loans.use: buy cosmetics

loans.name: Xiomara De Jesus

texts.es: Xiomara recibe ingresos de la Venta de los cerdos ya sean criollos o comprados, ella tiene mucha experiencia ya que toda la vida se ha dedicado a esta actividad.  Su esposo es Vulcanizador y sus tres hijos estudian y dependen economicamente de ella. Doña Xiomara Solicita credito para comprar Cerdos y asi venderlos a un precio mayor para obtener mayores ganancias. Su mayor deseo es que no le falte el pan de cada dia a su humilde familia.
texts.en:
Xiomara earns an income from selling pigs, both the ones she raises and the ones she buys.  She has a vast experience because she has done this type of work all her life.  Her husband is a vulcanizer and their three dependent children attend school.

Xiomara is requesting a loan to buy pigs which she will sell at a higher price to earn a profit.  Her greatest desire to to keep food on the table for her humble family.

loans.use: To buy and sell pigs.

loans.name: Santos Javier

texts.es: Don Santos Javier diario sale sobre las calles del poblado de Muelle de los Bueyes en su unidad de transporte donde ofrece el servicio de Taxi a persona que lo soliciten, corriendo la suerte que aveces no ecuentra mucha demanda, sin embargo no se desanima piensa que el dia de mañana estara mejor siendo la esperanza su consuelo.  cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa quien tiene una pulperia en su casa, si bien es cierto que ambos aportan pues no es suficiente para la inversion que necesita como es instalar el techo en una parte de su vivienda que actualmente esta al aire libre, solicitando credito para comprar Zing, Perlines Golosos y pagar mano de obra ante de caiga el invierno y evitar mojarse con las lluvias.  Se esfuerza cada dia para darle lo mejor a su dos hijos que son menores de edad.
texts.en:
Santos Javier goes out on the streets of the town of Muelle de los Bueyes in his vehicle, from which he offers taxi service to people who need it. Every day he tries his luck, but sometimes does not find much demand. Nevertheless, his doesn't lose spirit because he believes that tomorrow will be better. Hope is his consolation. He has the help of his wife, who runs a small store out of their house. Both of them pitch in but it is not enough to cover the amount of money they will have to put into installing a roof in one part of his home, which is currently open to the air. 
Santos Javier is requesting a loan to purchase zinc and beams and to pay laborers, before winter comes so they can avoid getting wet with the rains. 
He works hard each day to give the best to his two young children.

loans.use: to purchase zinc, nails and beams and to pay laborers to replace his roof.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 34 years old and has three children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Jonalyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jonalyn has been pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jonalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 51 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like shampoo, soap, sugar, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like shampoo, soap, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a married woman with four children, and she is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 60 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Carmelita has a sewing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials like threads, zippers, buttons, etc. for her sewing business. She has been in this business for 5 years. 

Carmelita would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more materials like threads, zippers, buttons, etc. for her sewing business

loans.name: Leolenita

texts.en:
Leolenita is 57 years old and married with nine children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. 

Leolenita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and farm supplies. She has been farming sugarcane for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and farm supplies

loans.name: Saven

texts.en:
Saven is a 35-year-old married woman who has worked as a farmer for 15 years. She lives in Kang Meas District of Kampong Cham Province. Savan has four dependent children who are in school. Saven and her husband can earn around USD 7 in one day.

This couple has got a loan from Hathta Kaksekar two times already. During this time, she wants one more loan to buy a motorbike to drive to the rice field and to pick her child up from school sometimes since the field and the school are a little bit far from her house. Saven promises to pay the loan with interest to Hattha Kaksekar punctually like she has done before.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Melojane

texts.en:
Melojane is 59 years old, married and lives with her family. 

She has a cafeteria serving meals to customers. With eight years experience in this field, she earns well and can provide for her family. She works hard every day in order to generate income for the family and to give a responsible and reliable service. 
 
Melojane has requested this loan to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare food to sell. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits.

The story of Melojane and her business is just one of the many examples of the clients of GDMPC for economic development.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Union Delicias Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 6  personas   responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “UNION DELICIAS” uno de ellos es  JUAN  de 54 años soltero y sin   hijos,  Juan    se dedica ya hace 10 años a la venta de productos de limpieza en un mercado (alquilado)  por ejemplo(papel higiénico, legía, ambientador para baño, ceras etc.)  todos los días con el merito de salir adelante y seguir progresando en la vida  ,  Juan   ha logrado mejorar su economía  y mejorar su calidad de vida , y  así Seguir mejorando su negocio , su mayor sueño es tener su propia tienda , Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más producto de limpieza  y así poder tener más ingresos. Juan es  el único que se encuentra parado en la foto,  A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y Edaprospo y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
This is a group comprised of six members who are involved in different business activities.  Their communal bank is called "UNION DELICIAS".  One of the members is Juan, 54, who is single and has no children.  For ten years he has worked selling cleaning products at a rented stall in the market.  He sells toilet tissue, bleach, bathroom freshener, wax, etc.  Every day he works to get ahead and continue prospering in life.

Juan has been able to improve his economy and quality of life.  He wants to continue improving his business and one day have his own store, which is his greatest dream.

He will use the loan to buy more cleaning products to earn more income.  Juan is the only one standing in the photo.  He is grateful to Kiva and Edaprospo for the loan which will help him prosper.

loans.use: To buy cleaning products.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth lives with her partner and 7 children, 5 of whom are currently in school. She is 34 years old and is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Bernadeth has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Bernadeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ma. Candonieta

texts.en:
Ma. Condonieta works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Ma. Condonieta is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Ma. Condonieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 47 years old and married with six children. With three children in school, Nena works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sugar, sardines, noodles, etc. to sell.

Nena has been in this business for five years.

In the future Nena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sugar, sardines, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn works hard to support her family. She has a live-in partner and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Jenelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Jenelyn has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a butcher shop business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of meat to sell. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of meat to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rice, beans, oil, detergents, bread, sausage, dairy products, etc. for the upcoming patron saint festivities, when demand increases.

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty is 34 years old and has six children. She is married and five of her children are currently in school.

Letty is in the agricultural business of farming vegetables and bananas in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Letty would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Confiamos En Ti Group

texts.es: La Sra. Luz  de 56 años de edad  y madre de  4 hijos, la Sra. Luz  tiene un pequeño negocio de ventas de productos de belleza   ya hace un 1 año. La sra.luz,  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos para su negocio   (cosméticos)   Y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Luz  y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado   y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada.  A la Sra. LUZ está sentada   se le distingue por su camisa de color lavanda se encuentra al costado del joven que luce polo marrón,   Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Luz  is 56 years old and is the mother of 4 children. She has had a small business selling beauty products for a year now. Luz has managed to build up regular customers which has provided an income which enables her to cover the household expenses. In the future she would like to have a place of her own where she can sell the products and make more profits. 

She will use the loan provided to buy more cosmetics for her business so she can meet the needs of her customers and so continue to make progress.

Luz and all the other members are grateful to Kiva for the loan provided and for the confidence which has been shown in them. Luz is seated and is wearing a lavender-coloured shirt. She is next to the young man in a brown t-shirt.

She signs off with the promise that she will meet her scheduled repayment targets.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en:
Jelyn is 47 years old, married and lives with her family. She has a retail store in their village where she sells assorted food and beverages to generate additional income while her husband works as a driver.
 
Jelyn has three years' experience in this field, and she works hard every day in order to provide income for the family, to support her husband and to ensure the wellbeing of her children.

She has requested this loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell. She is aiming to develop her business and to increase her profits, as the couple want to give their children a better education.

The story of Jelyn and her business is just one of the many examples of the clients of GDMPC for economic development.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

Merly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rudith

texts.en:
Rudith works hard to support her family. She is married and has a manicure service business in the Philippines.

Rudith requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like nail polish, pushers, and other needed materials. She has been in this business for 10 years now, and in the future, Rudith would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like nail polish, pushers, and other needed materials.

loans.name: Lina Della

texts.en:
Lina Della is 56 years old and married with one child. 

Lina Della is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming vegetables for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her work.

Lina Della would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es:
Mario de 39 años de edad, se creció con sus padres y su abuelo quienes se dedicaban a la agricultura desde temprana edad, especialmente a la siembra de granos básicos y crianza de cerdos, carece de estudios ya que en el tiempo donde se creció los accesos a la educación era muy aledaño a ellos,  por sus escasos recursos económicos.

 De esta forma se dedicó a trabajar en las actividades agrícolas y de crianza de cerdos junto a su abuelo, con el paso del tiempo fue adquiriendo experiencia y conocimientos en realizar esta actividad y decidió independizarse y formar su hogar, ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos,  juntos son padres de 2 hijos uno de 10 años y el otro de 17 quienes se encuentran estudiando educación básica en la escuela de su cantón,  hace 11 años Mario participó en un curso de formación de electricista   que duro 6 meses y se graduó con el título de electricista actividad que realiza en la actualidad y se ha convertido en su más fuerte, fuente de ingresos y en segunda opción la agricultura de esta manera lleva el sustento diario a su familia.


Mario se dedica a la ejercer  el oficio de electricista y realizando esta actividad tiene 4 años de experiencia, actividad que aprendió en un curso de formación que fue impartido por programas solidarios del gobierno y también en el tiempo que no hay demanda de trabajos de instalación, se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de cerdos actividad que aprendió de su padres y su abuelo.  Fue así como decidió continuar esta actividad motivado por los buenos resultados económicos.

El crédito será invertido  para comprar 3 cerdos para la crianza y después son puestos a la venta a un mejor precio,  y otra parte será destinada en compra de materiales para hacer una ampliación en la instalación eléctrica de su casa,  pues tiene dos habitaciones donde aún no tiene instalado y también hará reparaciones al techo de la misma, ya que se acerca la apoca de lluvias y tendrá que prepararla  para asegurar el bienestar de su familia, ya es esta quien le proporciona amor, motivación y fuerzas para continuar sus actividades laborales.  


Los sueños de Mario son, los de tener una casa equipada con todo lo necesario para su familia, hacer una ampliación la cual se sirva para instalar la cocina, haber terminado de pagar el crédito y adquirir uno nuevo, para la compra de más herramientas para trabajar, apoyar la educación de sus hijos hasta que sean unos profesionales, con las ganancias y el buen manejo del crédito sueña con tener su propio vehículo el cual le sirva para trasportar los materiales y equipos y salir y disfrutar de momentos agradables con su familia.
texts.en:
Mario, 39, was raised by his parents and grandfather who worked in agriculture, especially growing basic grains and raising pigs.  He was unable to get an education because the school was too far away and economic resources were scarce.

So he dedicated his time to agricultural activities and raising pigs with his grandfather.  Over time he gained experience and knowledge in the trade and decided to become independent and set up his own household.  His wife is a homemaker and they have two children, 17 and 10, who study at the regional school.  Mario participated in an electrical training course 11 years ago which lasted six months and he obtained an electrician's certificate.  He now works in this activity which is his strongest source of income, with the second alternative being agriculture, to support the family on a daily basis.

Mario has four years' experience working as an electrician.  He took a course offered by the government.  So when there is no demand for electrical installation he works in agriculture and raising pigs which he learned from his parents and grandfather.  So he has continued like this because of the good profits.

He will use the loan to buy three pigs to raise and then sell at a higher price.  He will also buy electrical materials for his house, because two of the rooms still do not have electricity.  He also will repair the roof of his house because the rainy season is approaching and he wants the family to be comfortable.  His family are the ones who give him love, motivation and strength to continue working.

Mario's dreams are to have a house equipped with everything his family needs, including a new kitchen, to pay back the loan and take out another one, buy work tools, and support his children in their education so they become professionals.  Wtith profits and good management of the loan, he dreams about having his own vehicle to transport materials and equipment, as well as go out and enjoy special moments with his family.

loans.use: To buy three pigs to raise and sell, and to buy electric materials for his house.

loans.name: Sounkalo

texts.fr:
Agée  de 31 ans,  Sounkalo est un  polygame, qui vit dans une grande famille avec  ses femmes et ses  enfants  dans le quartier Djicoroni l’un des quartiers de Bamako.  
Il n’ a pu faire des études du à des raisons sociales c’est ainsi qu’il s’est intéressé au commerce depuis à bas âge auprès de son père, qui  exerce diverses  activités génératrices de revenus. Sounkalo opta pour l’achat venter des prêts à porter.  Il est très sollicité dans son secteur,  surtout  par les hommes, son notoriété est bon, car il reçoit des commandes à travers des voyageurs.  
Pour  l’élargissement et l’amélioration de son activité,  il n’a pas prit du temps pour faire recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 3 ans.  Avec ce financement, il compte acheter 60 pantalons jeans et 60 chemises de meilleures qualités à Bamako.  Il effectue son activité dans la ville de Bamako  à une clientèle majoritairement composée d’hommes au comptant et à crédit. Il compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de  120.000 FCFA qu’elle envisage d’utiliser pour le remboursement des  taux d’intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso et participer aux dépenses quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aged 31 years, Sounkalo is a polygamist who lives in a large family with his wives and children in Djicoroni, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako.

He was unable to pursue schooling due to social reasons. He became interested in commerce since an early age alongside his father, who had various income-generating activities.

Sounkalo opted to trade ready-to-wear clothing. He is very much in demand in his sector, especially by men. He has a good reputation, as he receives orders from travelers.

Over the past three years, he had not yet called upon the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to help expand and improve his business.

Now with this funding, he intends to buy 60 jeans and 60 quality shirts in Bamako. He conducts his business in the city of Bamako to a clientele mainly composed of men, for cash and on credit.

He hopes to attain monthly profits of 120,000 CFA francs he will use to repay Soro Yiriwaso loan interests, and to participate in daily household expenses.

loans.use: buy ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Jerito

texts.en:
Jerito earns a living from his van, which he uses for rental and to provide transportation services. Aswell as this, he also has a job as a funeral services driver. His main goal in life is to earn enough money to support his children and help them live well. 

He successfully repaid his previous loans used to service his vehicle, and he has demonstrated effort and determination in order to provide his children with the best possible education. 

He has taken a new loan recently to buy new tires to replace the old, used tires on his van, and to cover maintenance costs. 

He wants to improve the general standard of living of his whole family in the future.

loans.use: to buy new tires to replace the old, used tires on his van, and to cover maintenance costs

loans.name: Nila

texts.en: Nila is 50 years old and chose to be single. She lives in a rural community with her relatives and has been engaged in buying and reselling feed, vitamins and herbicides for almost five years. She aims to make her business more profitable in order to earn sufficient income to provide her necessities, save for her future and support the financial needs of her niece and nephews. She plans to acquire more stock of the said products to resell but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, Nila wants to take a loan of PHP 18,000 to purchase additional stocks. Being patient and industrious, Nila hopes that someday, she will become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of feeds, vitamins and herbicides to resell

location.town: Brgy. Ineangan, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Tha, 33, is a married woman and has three children who are her responsibility. The family is residing in the Prey Chhor District of Kampong Cham Province with a daily income is USD 2.50. Tha and her husband are farmers in a cassava field, which is located not so far from their house.

Tha has been a customer of Hattha Kaksekar for two loan cycles. Recently, she would like one more loan to buy some farming materials and hire some laborers to help her with her farming. She hopes that this loan will have a great effect on her farming and help her to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy farming materials and hire laborers

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is 45 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, biscuits, bread, etc. to sell.

Rufina has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and earns additional income from direct selling Avon products.

Rufina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchaase additional stock like soft drinks, biscuits, and  bread to sell

loans.name: Graciana

texts.es:
Graciana es una persona de 69 años de edad,  que se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su hogar ella es una persona muy responsable dedicada a su familia con mucho amor y felicidad les atiende cada día a día, ya que lo más importante en su vida. Ella vivió y se creció con su abuela quien dedicó toda su vida a realizar los oficios domésticos de su casa, su abuela era una persona muy humilde y trabajadora y fue ella quien le enseño buenos valores morales y espirituales, y poniendo en práctica todo la aprendido de su abuela ha podido salir adelante. Ella trabajo en una casa prestando sus servicios domésticos, de esta forma adquirió conocimientos y experiencia.
  
Transcurrió el tiempo y Graciana formo su hogar con su esposo, quien se dedica a la agricultura y son padres de 3 hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad.  


Ella se dedica a la crianza de gallinas indias y a la venta de huevos,  es una actividad que la ha realizado por más de 5 años y se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, por otra parte su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de granos básicos y compra y venta de ganado también se dedica a los oficios domésticos se preocupa por mantener su hogar lo más higiénico posible ya que su prioridad son su familia.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar fertilizantes y plaguicidas para los cultivos de maíz y frijol, ya que nos encontramos en la época de invierno y es necesario la aplicación de estos dos elementos para su crecimiento y producción, y otra parte será destinada en compra de concentrado para ganado,  ya que tiene dos vacas que se encuentran en estado de gestación y necesitan las vitaminas y nutrientes necesarios para el periodo

Las planes que ella tiene para un futuro son las de ampliar y mejorar su casa, donde agregara una cocina y una galera para guardar leña y el alimento del ganado y apoyar en el estudio de sus hijos ya que de ellos manifiesta querer ser ingeniero agrónomo. También tienen la fe de adquirir un nuevo crédito para la compra de un vehículo que les facilite el traslado de las cosechas y el traslado de leña de sus propiedades para su casa.
texts.en:
Graciana, 69, has been a homemaker all her life.  She is very responsible and dedicates much love and happiness to her family who she cares for on a daily basis, as they are her priority in life.  She was raised by her grandmother who also cared for the home.  She was a very humble, hard-working person who taught Graciana good moral and spiritual values.  By putting into practice what she learned from her grandmother, she was able to get ahead.  She used to work for a private home as a domestic employee, which gave her knowledge and experience.

Time elapsed and Graciana formed her own family with her husband, who is a farmer.  They have three children who attend school in the community.

Graciana has been in business over five years raising hens and selling eggs, which is her main source of income.  Her husband grows basic grains and buys and sells livestock.  She also cares for the home to make it as clean as possible since her family is her priority.

The loan will be used to buy fertilizers and insecticides for her corn and bean crops, since the winter season is at hand and it is time to apply these two elements for crop growth and production.  The rest of the loan will be used for animal feed for the livestock, since one of the two cows they have is pregnant and needs vitamins and the necessary supplements.

Her plans for the future are to expand and renovate her house, installing a kitchen and porch for firewood and animal feed.  She also wants to support her children's education, since one of them wants to get a degree in agonomy engineering.  She hopes to obtain a new loan to buy a vehicle to make harvest transport easier, and to carry firewood from her property to her house.

loans.use: para comprar fertilizantes y plaguicidas para los cultivos de maíz y frijol y concentrado para ganado.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 49 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like biscuits, sugar, sardines, etc. to sell.

Salome has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like biscuits, sugar and sardines to sell

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 56 years old and married with 10 children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Vicenta is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Vicenta has been farming sugarcane for six years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 53 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming corn in the Philippines. Victoria is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Victoria has been farming corn for 12 years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gail

texts.en: Gail has been running a retail store selling assorted groceries and snacks in their community for a living. She has been doing this for more than six years, earning enough to provide for the needs of her only child. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business.  She borrowed a loan recently to buy more grocery goods and snacks to resell. She wants to improve her business as well as the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Brendalyn

texts.en:
Brendalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who makes and sells dried fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to make dried fish for her buy and sell of dried fish business.

Brendalyn has been in this business for three years. Brendalyn earns more income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Nobena

texts.en:
Nobena is 53 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Nobena has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell of charcoal business for three years and earns additional income from food vending.

Nobena aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Tereso De Jesús

texts.es:
Tereso de 30 años de edad,  es una persona  con muy buenos principios y valores, él se dedica al trabajo de motorista,  camina de su casa hacia su trabajo 10 minutos, entra a labores a las  5:30 am y sale alas 4:30 pm. Su nivel de estudio es octavo grado. Su esposa  se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar, ademas se dedica a la crianza de aves, esta familia es un un modelo a seguir que no se dejan vencer por las circunstancia de la vida.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar cemento, esto permitirá arreglar un entrada donde él habita,esto permitirá mejorar un cementado que a sido dañado.

 Tereso  planea a futuro comprar un carro propio para traer insumos para los animales y así no pagar transporte.
texts.en:
Tereso is 30 years old and is someone with very good principles and values. He makes a living working as a driver. He walks 10 minutes from his house to get to work, where he starts at 5.30am and finishes at 4.30pm. He has had education up to eighth grade. His wife looks after the house and also raises birds. This family sets an example to follow since they do not allow themselves to be beaten by life's circumstances. 

The loan he is requesting is to buy cement. This will enable him to repair a doorway where he lives by repairing some cement work which has been damaged.

Tereso's plan for the future is to buy a car of his own to bring supplies for the animals so he doesn't have to pay for transport.

loans.use: to buy cement to repair a doorway where he lives.

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Nièta est composé des femmes mariées vivant avec leurs maris et leurs enfants dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djicoroni l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (pagnes wax) de toutes sortes, la restauration et  de balaies. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Adiaratou (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une réputation dans la vente des habits (pagnes wax) de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 600 pièces de pagnes wax en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détails à Djicoroni et en ambulant à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Adiaratou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinjecté dans l’activité et subvenir aux petits besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
The Nieta group is made up of married women who live with their husbands and their children in traditional families. On average they are 34 years old with four children. They all live in Djicoroni, one of the neighbourhoods in Bamako and met through family ties, living in the same locality, and friendships. The members of the group sell clothing (traditional wax pagnes) of every description, brooms, and do catering. Hoping to increase their business assets, the members of the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and this is their second solidarity loan.
Mrs. Adiaratou (the woman sitting on the far right in the photo) is well known for her clothing (wax pagnes) of every description. She plans to use her loan to purchase 600 units wholesale at the big market. She will sell her merchandise retail in Djicoroni and as an itinerant saleswoman to her mainly female customers. With this loan Mrs. Adiaratou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 90 000 FCFA which she will use to reinvest in her business and to provide for her children's needs.

loans.use: To purchase wax pagnes (traditional dress)

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis es un joven emprendedor, tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero y vive en el Distrito de Callaria junto a sus padres.

Es un hombre con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello, que desde hace más de 8 meses trabaja como Operador de limpieza en la Municipalidad de la zona donde reside y con el dinero que gana apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar.
La casa de sus padres está construida de material de madera, y su gran anhelo es poder construir su casa de material noble, para que sea más resistente y su familia pueda tener mayor comodidad.
Luis está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá arreglar su moto y así podrá desplazarse a diversos lugares sin ningún inconveniente. De esta manera seguirá luchando para cumplir su sueño y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is a young entrepreneur. He is 29 years old, single and lives with his parents in the district of Callaria. He is a man with a strong will to get ahead. This is why he has been working as a member of the municipality’s cleaning staff for eight months. With the money he earns, he helps his parents to cover the home expenses. His parents’ house is built with wood. His biggest dream is to be able to build a house with solid materials in order to make it more resistant and improve his family’s comfort.

Luis appreciates the help that Kiva lenders have given him. He will be able to fix his motorcycle and use it to travel easily to different areas. This way, he will be able to make his and his family’s dream come true.

loans.use: to fix his motorcycle and be able to use it to go to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bedroom set.

loans.name: Marina De La Cruz

texts.es:
Marina tiene 46 años de edad, estudió hasta primer  grado, está acompañada  y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 5 hijos los cuales dos de ellos viven con ella y los otros tres están en hogares aparte.

Marina es comerciante, ella tiene una tienda desde hace 24 años, decidió poner esta tienda porque en el lugar no habían, entonces ella vio la necesidad de poner este negocio además ella cultiva la tierra desde hace 2 años ya que le ayuda al esposo en los trabajos del campo.

El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para surtir más la tienda ya que pocos productos y el dinero que tenía lo invirtió en la enfermedad de un hijo suyo, comprará churros, sodas, dulces y productos de la canasta básica como frijoles, arroz, huevos, etc. 

Sus sueños son que Dios siempre le preste vida para seguir en su tienda y cuando pueda y ayudarle siempre a su esposo para sacar adelante a sus hijos entre los 2.
texts.en:
Marina is 46 years old. She went to school through the 6th grade. She is married and her spouse is a farmer. She has 5 children. Two of them live with her and the other three on in their separate homes.

Marina is a merchant. She has had a store for 24 years. She decided to open this store because there wasn't one in the area, so she saw the need to start the business. She has also worked the land for 2 years, helping her husband with the farmwork. 

The loan she has asked for is to stock her store more, since it has few products and the money she had was spent on her son's illness. She will buy churros, soda, sweets and staple products such as beans, rice, eggs, etc. 

Her dream is for God to keep giving her life so she can continue in her store and whenever she can help her husband to get their children ahead between the two of them

loans.use: to stock her store by buying churros, soda, candies and staple products such as beans, rice, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Claire

texts.en: Claire successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying fertilizer for farm improvement. She earned enough from her farm that she was able to put up another line of business which is swine fattening. To purchase feeds, she took a new loan recently from GDMPC. In the near future, she wants to improve her agri-business as well as the general living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda grows and harvests a number of crops, work that she has done since she was married. Her husband works in a private company as a construction worker since it was the only way they had to move the family forward. She gets up early to prepare food for the family and has to go to the fields to oversee her farms as well as her crops. 

Hilda is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizer, since she needs farm improvement. In the future, she wants to have a better house and she is sure that she can achieve her goals with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Sobre una mesa de madera, se dividen unos recipientes de metal donde Rosa, de 56 años, almacena el pan a comercializarse por la calles de su ciudad, desde hace más de 30 años, vendiendo en Chinandega. Ofreciendo panes dulces, simples y con quesos, pues no le da pena trabajar decente para ayudar a sacar adelante a su familia. Su esposo e hijos de 19 y 33 años, siempre la han apoyado y la siguen ayudando, pues además de ser un negocio familiar, no hay otros ingresos.
Rosa solicita de un préstamo para comprar carne, arroz, aceite y otros productos, pues tendrá la oportunidad de ofrecerle a sus clientes mayor variedad, lo que le ayudará en el crecimiento de su negocio.  Hasta cuarto grado de primaria logró llegar, sin embargo, sus sueños siguieron y ahora, como siempre, piensa seguir trabajando fuerte para comprar una camioneta para su trabajo y más adelante remodelar su casa.
texts.en:
On a wooden table, there are metal containers where Rosa, 56 years old, stores the bread that she sells on the streets of her city. She has done this for more than 30 years, selling in Chinandega, offering sweet bread, plain bread and cheesy bread. She is not ashamed to do honest work to help her family get ahead. Her husband and her children, aged 19  and 33, have always supported her and they continue to help her. In addition to it being a family business, there is no other income. 

Rosa is asking for a loan to buy meat, rice, oil and more. She will have the opportunity to offer her customers a wider variety, which will help her grow her business. She was able to go to school up to the fourth grade. Nonetheless, her dreams went on and now, like always, she plans to keep working hard to buy a pick up truck for her work and in the future remodel her house.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice, oil and other products.

loans.name: Rosibel Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosibel tiene 22 años de edad, estudió hasta primer año de bachillerato, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y albañilería, solo tienen un hijo que a{un no va a la escuela y nadie más depende de Rosibel.

Ella se dedica al trabajo doméstico pero también le ayuda en la agricultura a su esposo desde hace 3 años que formó su propio hogar, trabaja en un horario de 8:00 a12:00 de la mañana.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar seis sacos de abono y 5 litros de veneno para echarle a la hierba mala, esto le ayudará mucho porque preparará muy bien la tierra para que el cultivo crezca bien.

Sus sueños son seguir apoyando a su esposo en la agricultura y sacar adelante a su hijo.
texts.en:
Rosibel is 22 years old. She studied until the first year of high school. She is in a relationship and her partner is in agriculture and bricklaying for a living. They only have one son that does not go to school and no one depends more on Rosibel.

She is in domestic work for a living, but also helps her spouse in agriculture. It has been 3 years since she formed her own home. She works on a schedule of 8:00 to 12:00 in the morning.

The loan that she needs is for buying six sacks of fertilizer and 5 liters of poison to kill weeds. This will help her very much because she will prepare the land very well so that the crops grow well.

Her dreams are to continue supporting her husband in agriculture and to provide for her son.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of fertilizer and 5 liters of poison.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en: Rosenda has been selling farm products in her village along with her snack vending business. She supplies fruits and vegetables in the market which she acquired from her farm and her neighbor's farm. She successfully repaid her previous loans used for farming and her business activities. Recently, she took a new loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer. She wants to expand her business to ensure a better source of income for the family. Rosenda hopes to have a better living situation in the future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Procesa

texts.en: Procesa, a mother of four, has managed a general store for many years and she earns well to support her husband’s income. She has sustained it with the support of the entire family. The couple wants to provide a better living to their children. Her husband improves his painting services while she plans to improve her retail store to earn more income. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, she wants to improve the business as well as the general condition of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn, a farmer from Clarin, Misamis occidental, successfully repaid her previous loan used for farm improvement. She has been doing this for more than seven years. To improve her farm more, she took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer. Aside from her salary, she wants to earn from her farm where she put up some of her investments. Evelyn hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Ana Mabel

texts.es:
Ana tiene 47 años de edad, estudió hasta primer grado, en la actualidad ella está soltera pero tiene cuatro hijos, solo tres viven con ella que van a la escuela, y uno ya se acompañó.

Ana se dedica a la agricultura desde que tiene 10 años de edad, tuvo que aprender a trabajar ya que su padre cuando se iba a sembrar para preparar la milpa la llevaba  a ella y así fue como aprendió, ella cultiva el maíz y frijol y el lugar le queda a 20 minutos de su casa 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar 3 sacos de formula y 6 de sulfato, con esto ella podrá cultivar con la esperanza que en noviembre estará sacando las cosechas que servirán una parte para vender y pagar el préstamo y la otra para el alimento familiar.
     

Sus sueños son mejorar la producción de la siembra de maíz, y continuar trabajando para darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana is 47 years old. She studied until the first grade. She is currently single, but has four children. Only three live with her that are going to school, and one is already married.

Ana has been in agriculture for a living since she was 10 years old. She had to learn to work, as when her father went to prepare the corn field to plant, he brought her and that was how she learned. She grows corn and beans and the location is 20 minutes from her house.

The loan that she needs is to buy 3 sacks of formula and 6 of sulfate. With this she will be able to cultivate with the hope that November will bring harvests that she will in part sell and pay the loan and the other to feed her family.

Her dream is to improve the production of her corn crops and to continue working to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of formula and 6 of sulfate.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
En el mercado oriental, resalta desde lejos un puesto de cosméticos. Toda una línea de crema para la piel, de gel para el cabello o de shampoo, está ordenada por marcas y tipos, dejando los productos de Luis, de 57 años, organizados en una forma lineal. Este hombre soltero, pero todo un modelo a seguir para sus 6 hijos ya mayores, trabaja en el área desde hace 20 años, pues de su idea, junto con su hijo, iniciaron con un gran proyecto, lo que se ha convertido en el sustento de su hogar.
Tras llegar a tercer año de la universidad, se vio obligado a no continuar debido a problemas económicos, lo que no lo detuvo a salir adelante. Luis no tiene otros ingresos, por lo que para mantenerse en el mercado necesita de un préstamo para comprar una máquina de escritorio, que le servirá para ampliar el orden de los datos del negocio. Ahora, este hombre no dejas su sueños atrás pues está decidido en seguir estudiando para concluir su carrera y en un futuro poner una oficina en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the oriental market, a cosmetics shop jumps out from afar. All lines of skin creams, hair gel or shampoo, is ordered by brand and type leaving the products of Luis who is 57 years old, arranged in a linear fashion. This single man, but in every way a model to continue for his 6 children, already older, has worked in this area for 20 years. As his idea, together with his son they began a great project, which become the main income of the home.
After arriving at the third year of university, he saw himself obligated to no longer continue due to economic problems, which have not kept him from succeeding. Luis does not have other income, so for him to stay in the market he needs a loan to buy a register that will allow him to expand the order and dates of the business. Now this man did not leave his dreams behind. He has decided to continue studying to conclude his career and in the future put an office in his business.

loans.use: to buy a sales register.

loans.name: Yancy Patricia

texts.es:
Yancy  tiene 25 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado de nivel académico, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja de vigilante de una empresa de teléfonos, tiene 2 hijos los cuales uno de ellos va a la escuela y nadie mas depende de ella.

Yancy se dedica al trabajo doméstico, pero también trabaja en la agricultura, en este momento ella está esperando otro hijo por lo cual ha pausado su trabajo. El trabajo agrícola se lo enseñaron sus padres desde muy pequeña y le queda muy cerca a unos 5 minutos de donde ella vive y viaja a pie.

El crédito solicitado lo necesita para comprar dos cerdos y engordarlos para luego venderlos y obtener ingresos.

Sus sueños son que su hijo nazca muy sano y prepararlos académicamente.
texts.en:
Yancy is 25 years old. She studied until the 5th grade. She lives with her partner who works as a guard at a telephone company. She has two children who go to school and no one depends on her more.

Yancy is in domestic work for a living but also works in agriculture. Currently she is expecting another child which has paused her work. She was taught agricultural work by her parents from a young age and she stays close, some 5 minutes from where she lives and travels by foot.

She needs the loan requested to buy two pigs to raise and later sell to obtain income.

Her dreams are that her son be born very healthy and to prepare them academically.

loans.use: to buy two pigs to raise and later sell.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en: Mylene has been renovating her home with her previous loan and has successfully repaid it.  To earn a living, she works as a cook in a private company. She was promoted to a canteen supervisor for her exemplary performance.  She always finds a way to earn an income to support the needs of her children. She took a new loan recently to cover the labor costs for house repair. In the future, she wants to see her children's success and an improvement in their standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs for house repair.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en: Mylene is 33 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, sugar, spices, noodles, eggs, soft drinks, etc.  Mylene has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening and fishing. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, sugar, spices, noodles, eggs, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 38 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, eggs, soap, etc. Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, eggs, soap, etc.

loans.name: Gerarda

texts.es:
Gerarda tiene 50 años de edad, no tuvo el privilegio de ir a la escuela pues siempre desde muy pequeña se dedicó  al trabajo en finca, se acompañó y quedo como madre soltera de ocho hijos de los cuales cuatro viven con ella  y solo dos asisten a la escuela y dependen económicamente de ella,  en su casa vive una nuera con su bebé. 
Su familia se dedica a la agricultura  pues es un persona a que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y sus hijos le apoyan en las actividades que hay que realizar en la milpa, pues desde muy joven ella aprendió a trabajar con sus padres, esta es la única actividad económica que ella tiene, cuando van a trabajar ellos madrugan ya que el terreno les queda lejos de sus casa y se tardan aproximadamente una hora en llegar,  trabajan todos los días  desde las cinco de la mañana hasta las once. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar abono  y otros insumos para el manejo del cultivo, se verá beneficiada con este crédito en tener una buena producción pues con el crédito trabajará la milpa y la frijolera y así tendrá siempre alimento en su casa. 

Ella desea sacar adelante a sus hijos que están estudiando, mejorar su casa también espera tener una buena producción y obtener ganancias  para seguir invirtiendo en las actividades agrícolas que realiza con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gerarda is 50 years old. She did not have the privilege of going to school, as ever since she was a small girl she did farm work for a living. She was in a common-law marriage and left as a single mother of eight children, of whom four live with her, and only two attend school and they depend on her economically. Her daughter-in-law lives in her home with her baby.
Her family is in agriculture for a living, as they are people that have always liked working and her children support her in the activities she has to do in the maize fields. Since she was very young she learned to work with her parents. This is a unique economic activity that she has. When they go to work they wake up very early as the land is far from their house and it takes about an hour to arrive. They work every day from five in the morning until eleven.

The loan that she needs is to buy fertilizer and other inputs for crop management. She will benefit from this loan by having a good production as with the loan she will work the maize and bean fields and she will always have food in the house.

She her children to get ahead in life by studying, improve her house, and she also hopes to have a good production and obtain income for continuing to invest in the agricultural activities that she does with her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other inputs for crop management.

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  SIGUIDIA est constitué de  8 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  TORAKABOUGOU de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  fruits et légumes à l’image de MAÏMOUNA qui est la 1ère femme assise  dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 2 sacs de 100 kg  d’oranges, 120 kg de bananes et 1 carton de pommes avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Siguida group is made up of eight married women who average 40 years of age with four children each. They live in nuclear families in the Torakabougou district of the town of Bougouni.

They got to know each other as neighbors and friends and through their businesses. They joined the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the aim of strengthening their financial capacity so that they can run their businesses better, and they are on their first loan. 

This group of women buy and sell fruit and vegetables, and this is the case for Maïmouna, who is sitting on the far left of the photo. With her loan she is planning to buy two 100 kilo sacks of oranges, 120 kilos of bananas and a carton of apples from wholesalers in Bougouni. She sells her products at the market and from home, on a retail basis, for cash and on credit to a varied customer base.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 15,000FCFA, which will be used to repay her loan and invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger is a 42-year-old father, raising his family in a rural community. In addition to being a farmer, he operates his motorcycle transport business to generate additional income. He aims to uplift their standard of living, in order to educate his four children and satisfy their necessities.

To continue using his motorcycle, he would like to ask a loan of PHP 5,000. He will use the loan to buy wheels, sprockets, and other spare parts needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle. Through this loan, he believes that some day he will improve his business, as well as their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy wheels, sprockets, and other spare parts for his motorcycle

location.town: Brgy. Ineangan, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia has run a general store for many years while her husband works as a construction worker. For many years, the couple has earned better income that provides for the family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. To improve sales, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods. In the future, she aims to find ways to improve their living situation and dreams to improve the general living of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Africana

texts.en: Africana is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Africana is 30 years old and has two children who are currently in school.  Africana has a business directly selling a collection of personal products in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional collections of personal products to sell to her customers.  Africana has been in this business for four years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional collections of personal products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vehicle repair shop business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her business. Helen has been in this business for four years. Helen also earns more income from food vending.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.  Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sold-out beverages and new stock for her business

loans.name: Rai Said

texts.es:
Rai es un joven de 19 años de edad, soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica junto a su madre.
Es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora. Su mayor motivación es su madre por lo que día a día trabaja incansablemente para poder brindarle lo mejor y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Desde hace 1 año trabaja como Asesor de Ventas de Moto en una empresa prestigiosa de la zona donde reside y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable y luchadora.
Rai está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que con el apoyo brindado él podrá comprar una cocina para  su hogar, de esta manera sentirá mayor comodidad. Asimismo utilizará también esa ayuda para pagar sus estudios y   algunos materiales que le piden en la Universidad.
texts.en: Rai is a young 19 year old man who is single and lives in the city of Ica together with his mother. He is an enterprising and hardworking person. His greatest motivation is his mother who works tirelessly day by day to be able to afford him the best and improve his quality of life. For a year he has worked as a motorcycle sales consultant in a prestigious business in the zone where he lives, and he has done very well because he is a responsible and determined person. Rai is very thankful for the lenders of Kiva because of the support afforded he will be able to buy a stove for his home and in this way feel more comfortable. Additionally, he will use the help in order to pay for his studies and some of the materials that they request in the university.

loans.use: to buy a stove for greater comfort and to pay for school.
